loans.name: Antonio

texts.en: Antonio S. is from the village of General Balao, Solana, Cagayan. He is 32 years old. Antonio is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Antonio provides painting services to local community members. Antonio has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. Antonio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antonio is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Antonio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: Eduardo vive en la zona Chojasivi, Provincia  Los Andes, del Departamento La Paz, junto a sus hijos  los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar. Se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno cuya producción de leche la vende a Pil Andina (Planta industrializadota  de leche), también realiza trabajos de albañilería en diferentes sectores del departamento. El préstamo será para compra de ganado. Es su segundo  crédito en Impro y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Eduardo lives in the zone of Chojasivi, province of Los Andes, department of La Paz. He lives with his children who are school age. He works raising cattle that produce milk that he sells to Pil Andina (an industrial milk plant). He also works bricklaying in several parts of the department. This loan will be to buy cattle. It is his second loan with Impro and his first time on Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Irshad Muhammad Bota's Group

texts.en:
I. lives in the small Pakistani city of Borewala, which is famous for its shrines. She is a 42-year-old talented lady who, as well as being a housewife, operates a business selling hand fans. She makes hand fans (from wood, cloth and hard papers) and sells them to local markets in Borewala as well as the local community to supplement her family's income. The hand fans are very popular in Pakistan because they help the air when electricity is not available. I. sells a good number of hand fans every month and earns a good profit.
I.'s husband has a business repairing bicycles. He operates a small shop in the nearby market from which he repairs bicycles and sells spare parts to his customers. I. has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy the latest repair tools and spare parts for his business. I. is hopeful that her husband will be able to increase his income by investing money in his business.
Note: In the picture, the lady who is raising her hand is I..

loans.use: To buy bicycle repair tools and spare parts

loans.name: Fris

texts.en:
Fris C., age 36, owns and operates a pig-raising business. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. She and her husband live with their four school-aged children in the village of Pantaon, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental.

In 2009, Fris joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Fris has successfully repaid a loan of 40,000 PHP. She is now requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional feed for her pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a teacher at one of the high schools in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is 40 years old and a father of two children aged 10 and 9 years. In his home, he lives with five people and he is the breadwinner for his family. However, for most parents and guardians in the country, school fees have become an issue that most of them would find very difficult to meet on their own without credit support, given the income levels and family responsibilities. John falls in that category and he wants this loan to enable him pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA D. LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba  y departamento D. Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Florencia; tiene 43 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. verduras, ella venD. tomates, lechugas, zanahorias, pepinos y cebollas en el mercado D. Urubamba y también tiene una pequeña chacra donD. cultiva las verduras, la socia quiere ampliar su negocio.  La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras al por mayor.


La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Florencia belongs to the “Reyna D. Los Angeles” (Queen of Angels) Community Bank.  The bank is in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Forencia, age 43, is married and has four children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling vegetables.  She sells tomatoes, lettuce, carrots, cucumbers, and onions at the Urubamba fair.  She also has a small farm where she grows the vegetables.

She wants to expand her business.  She is requesting the loan to buy vegetables wholesale.

She is grateful for the requested loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She operates a retail shop business, selling maize flour, wheat flour, and rice. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. In addition she sells charcoal, which contributes to her other source of income. Zipporah faces a major challenge of the high cost of transport and seasonality in her business. She hopes to own a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 80,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and crates of soda (soft drinks) for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To  purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and crates of soda (soft drinks) for resale.

loans.name: John Naut

texts.en:
John Naut E. is a twenty-eight year old man, married to Elizabeth Naut. Together they have two lovely children who are still very young. John has run a motorcycle business in Eldoret Town for three years and earns a monthly income of KES 9,000. He also owns a shop where he sells groceries such as green vegetables.

This will be John's first loan with KADET. He plans to use it to buy spare parts for his motorcycle and groceries for resale. In the future, John plans to expand his grocery business, so that he can have enough income to feed and educate his children.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for a motorcycle and groceries for resale

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es: María Esperanza O. D. P. D. 61 años D. edad, resiD. en San Martín, mismo lugar en el cual se dedica a su trabajo. Ella vive junto a su esposo, dos hijos y un nieto. María se dedica a la venta D. ropa para bebés y niños, la cual comercializa D. forma ambulante, a pesar que su trabajo es muy duro ya que tiene que caminar por mucho tiempo para vender gran parte D. sus productos, ella siempre sale con la mejor disposición D. aumentar sus ventas cada día. María solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar más ropa, en diferentes colores y tallas, y D. esta forma aprovechar las fiestas D. fin D. año, lo cual es la ilusión D. todos los comerciantes, ya que para esta época las ventas suben considerablemente.
texts.en:
María Esperanza O. D. P., 61, lives in San Martín where she also works.  She lives with her husband, two children and a grandson.

María sells infant and children’s clothing.  Despite her work being very hard because she has to walk long distances to sell most of her products, she always sets out with the best disposition to increase sales every day.

María is asking for a loan to buy more clothes in a variety of colors and sizes to take advantage of the end of year festivities, which are every merchant’s dream, because during this time of year sales spike considerably.

loans.use: To buy infant wear.

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.en: Maximiliana belongs to the “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” cooperative bank, which is located in the Oropesa district of the province of Quispicanchi in the deparment of Cusco, Peru. She is 48 years old and single with one child. She is requesting the loan to invest in her bread-making business. The city of Oropesa is famous for making bread. Maximiliana is interested in using the loan to buy flour, yeast, wood, and other ingredients to make bread. She is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Invest in her bakery

loans.name: Nilsa Nidia

texts.es:
Nilsa tiene 45 años de edad, es casada, y tiene dos hijos, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito de la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, caracterizado por que sus pobladores se dedican principalmente al cultivo de frutas.

Yolanda se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, ella cuenta con un grupo de clientes que le compran sus productos con frecuencia, mientras más pedidos le realizan obtiene mas puntos de parte de la empresa que le provee los productos y por consiguiente obtiene mayores ganancias. Por este motivo siempre se esfuerza por obtener cada vez más clientes.

Nilsa desea implementar su stock de productos de belleza para poder satisfacer la demanda con la que actualmente cuenta, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Nilsa is 45 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives together with her family in Tambogrande district, in Piura province, in the region of the same name.  The area is noted for the fact that its inhabitants are mainly fruit growers.

Nilsa's business is selling beauty products through a catalog.  She has a group of customers who buy her products frequently.  The more orders her customers make, the more points she earns with the company that provides her products and, hence, the more profits she makes.  For this reason, she is always working hard to attract more customers.

Nilsa would like to add to her stock of beauty products in order to meet the demand that she currently has.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 700 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To increase her stock of beauty products

loans.name: Mulay (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Maluay esta formado por 11 mujeres que son amigas y vecinas, viven en una misma comunidad y en su mayor parte se dedican a la agricultura y cría de animales pero también realizan otras actividades de comercio. Viven en la comunidad de Maluay caracterizándose este sector porque se puede admirar la belleza de la naturaleza en donde se respira un aire de tranquilidad fuera de los ruidos de la ciudad.

La Señora. Ruth Adriana M. vive por la comunidad de la Paz que pertenece a Maluay, tiene 24 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos quienes por el momento pasan en casa. Su esposo trabaja en un taller realizando estucos (cielos rasos), viven en su casa propia.
Doña Ruth Adrina  es costurera actividad que desempeña hace 6 años, es profesional en esta rama ya que tiene su titulo, labora en una fabrica de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, en su casa se dedica a la cría de pollos iniciando en esta actividad con su segundo crédito. Este es su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por su suegra a formar parte de este grupo, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos. Su meta es terminar  su casa.

La Señora. María Doraliza Q. vive en la comunidad de la Paz que  pertenece Maluay, nuestra socia se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada
por sus vecinas de la comunidad. Ella se dedica a la agricultura y lo que cosecha es para su consumo, también cría animales como: cerdos, pollos y cuyes los que vende en su propia comunidad.
Doña María Doraliza tiene 43 años, es casada y tiene 8 hijos, su primer hijo es casado y vive independiente, sus dos hijas siguientes trabajan  y le ayudan económicamente en los gastos del hogar y sus cinco últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita del sector. Su esposo es albañil y viven en su casita la misma que fue construida entre los dos.
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más cerdos. Su sueño es ampliar su casa.

Nota: En la foto nos acompaña una niña que es hija de una de las socias.
texts.en:
The Maluay communal bank is comprised of 11 women who are friends and neighbors.  They live in the same community and most of them are involved in farming and raising livestock.  Some of them are merchants.  They live in the Maluay community which is known for its natural beauty and tranquil atmosphere, away from the noisy cities.

Mrs. Ruth Adriana M. lives in the community of La Paz which belongs to Maluay.  She is 24 years old, married and has two children who live at home.  Her husband is a drywall worker.  They live in their own home.

Mrs. Ruth Adrina has been a seamstress for six years.  She has a professional diploma and works in a factory Monday through Friday from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.  At home she raises chickens and has used two loans for this business activity.  This is her third loan through the communal bank since she was invited by her mother-in-law to become a member.  She plans to use the loan to buy chickens.  Her goal is to finish her home.

Mrs. María Doraliza Q. lives in the community of La Paz which belongs to Maluay.  This member has had two loans through the communal bank and she was invited to join the group by neighbors in her community.  She grows crops for her own consumption.  She also raises pigs, chickens and guinea pigs which she sells in her own neighborhood

Mrs. María Doraliza is 43 years old, married and has 8 children.  Her eldest son is married and lives independently.  The next two daughters work and help her with household expenses.  The other five children study at the local school.  Her husband is a bricklayer and they live in the house they both built.

She plans to use to loan to buy more pigs.  Her dream is to finish her home.

Note: In the photo there is a little girl accompanying us.  She's the daughter of one of the members.

loans.use: To buy chickens and pigs

loans.name: María Margarita

texts.es:
La Señora. María Guaman es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Porvenir, vive en la comunidad de Amarillo en la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia es de clima frió, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura. Muchos han migrado en busca de trabajo para entregarle un mejor futuro para sus hijos.

La Señora. María tiene 49 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 31, 29, 22, 13 y 8 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos son casados y viven independientes, su hijo de 13 años   estudia en el colegio y su ultima hija en la escuela. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo su propio vehiculo, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña María se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos y de su hogar pero también es negociante de animales como: ganado, gallinas, cerdos, pollos, etc.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 13 años, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más animales. Su meta es crecer  en su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. María Guaman is a member of the Communal Bank “Nuevo Porvenir” (New Future). She lives in the community of Amarillo in the parish of Cumbe, an area that experiences cold weather. The people engage in trade, livestock breeding, and agriculture. However, many have migrated in search of work so that they can provide a better future for their children.

Sra. María is 49 years old, married, and has five children (ages 31, 29, 22, 13, and 8). Her three oldest children are married and live independently. Her 13 year old son is in high school while the youngest daughter is in elementary school. María’s husband is a professional driver who operates his own vehicle. This couple was able to build their own home.

Doña María takes care of her children and her home, but she also sells animals such as cows, hens, pigs, chickens, etc. She has been a member of her Communal Bank for 13 years. The money from her loan will be invested in the purchase of more animals. Her goal is to grow in her business.

loans.use: Purchase more animals

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra en el Décimo-Primer ciclo, se llama "Las divinas".
La Sra. Maria R. de 46 años de edad tiene 1 hijo estudiante del nivel terciario, Maria trabaja fuera de su casa  pero los fines de semana ella prepara comestibles y los vende en frente de su casa.
La señora es muy sacrificada y tiene un día a día muy pesado.
Tiene una casita pequeña y desea ampliarla para abrir una despensa y dar buenos ingresos a su hogar; por ello agradece de antemano la ayuda recibida de la  Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva, desea refraccionar su pequeña tienda y comprar más comestibles de buena calidad, abasteciendo mejor de esa manera las necesidades de sus clientes, pues además ella es el sostén de la casa.
texts.en:
This existing committee is in its eleventh loan cycle and goes by the name “Las Divinas” (The Divine Ones).

Sra. Maria R. is 46 years old and has one son who is a student at the college preparatory level. Maria works outside of the home, but on the weekends she prepares food and sells it in front of her house. She has made many sacrifices and gets extremely fatigued day after day.

Maria has a small house, but she wants to expand it so that she can open a food pantry and generate a good household income. She expresses her thanks in advance for the assistance she will receive from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva. Maria wants to remodel her small store and buy more high quality food products. This will help her do a better job of meeting the needs of her customers since she is the breadwinner in her household.

loans.use: To restock with fruits, vegetables, flour, corn, sugar, baked goods, beverages, and other products.

loans.name: Rosario Esther

texts.es: Solicitante, tiene 38 años, es madre soltera, vive en casa familiar,  se dedica al transporte,  cuenta con una moto taxi que es alquilada. Tiene la meta de tener otra unidad de transporte, y tener negocio propio cumpliendo  sus sueños y objetivos  asi solucionando sus problemas se propone el credito por ser una persona emprendedora , solicita credito para gastos personales y mejoras para su vehiculo
texts.en:
Rosario, age 38, is a single mother who lives in the family home. She engages in the transportation sector and has a motorcycle taxi that she makes available for rent. Her goal is to obtain another vehicle. Having her own business has enabled her to fulfill her dreams and goals, as well as solve her problems.

Rosario is being recommended for this loan because she is an enterprising person. The loan she is requesting will be used for personal expenses and upgrades to her vehicle.

loans.use: To pay for upgrades to her motorcycle taxi and cover some personal expenses.

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS AMISTOSAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosaura; ella tiene 21 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de bar, ella vende gaseosas y cervezas, la socia trabaja desde las 10:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m y junto con su hermana y mama trabajan juntas, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de bar. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar gaseosas y cervezas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rosaura, 21, is a member of the “LAS AMISTOSAS” (The Friendly Ones) communal bank which is located in Urcos District belonging to Quispicanchis Province, Cusco Department.

She is single and alternates her daily chores with running a bar; she sells soft drinks and beer from 10am until 10pm.  She works alongside her sister and mother.  She wants to improve the bar business and is asking for a loan to buy soft drinks and beer.  She is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and beer.

loans.name: Anara's Group

texts.en:
Anara A., 54, is the leader of this group. She is married to a farmer and has five grown children. Her children chose various paths in life; for instance, one is a teacher and another is a customs service officer. Left together with her husband they keep running the business that was started ten years ago. Anara feeds, waters and pastures the cattle.

The couple is very thankful to micro-crediting firms for providing such opportunities for small businesses to survive in the market and prosper. The credit of 4,000 KGS taken in 2000 from a local firm has helped her business take its first humble steps. Since then the monthly income is about $43, which allows covering all operating costs. The purpose of this loan is to purchase a bull-calf for further fattening and reselling. 

          --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a bull-calf.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo M. is from the village of Sebasi Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 48 years old. Ricardo is married and has three adult children. 

To make a living, Ricardo operates a motorcycle transport service. Ricardo has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ricardo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Ricardo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Ricardo is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to repair his vehicle for better service. This will be the second loan taken out by Ricardo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle for better service.

loans.name: 5 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
El comité “5 de Mayo” tiene más de  2 años de formación y trabajo con la Fundación Paraguaya. La mayoría de sus integrantes ya realiza actividades productivas. Entre dichas actividades se encuentran la venta de frutas y verduras, venta de comestibles como empanadas de carne, empanadas de pollo, empanadas de jamón y queso, venta de mercaderías varias como: fideo, azúcar, harina, aceite, jabón, entre otros artículos, venta de ropas, venta de remedios etc.
La Sra. Cirila específicamente desea el crédito para contar con su propio local en el cual se dedique al servicio de comidas y bebidas en general. Anhela un futuro mejor para sus hijos es por eso que se esfuerza el doble para facilitarles los materiales para su desarrollo y formación.
texts.en:
The committee "May 5th" has been around for 2 years and has worked with the Paraguayan Foundation. The majority of the members already work. The activities they participate in include selling fruits and vegetables, snacks such as meat pies, chicken pies, cheese and ham pies, products such as: noodles, sugar, flour, oil, ham, including others, clothes, remedies, etc.

Mrs. Cirila specifically is requesting the loan to have her own locale to sell meals and beverages. She wants a better future for her children so she doubles her efforts to provide for their development and growth.

loans.use: buy beverages and products to prepare fast food.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes, vive con su esposo, no tienen hijos, administra una tienda, que la posee desD. hace 15 años, esta es su propia fuente D. ingreso, el horario D. venta es D. 4:00am a 8:00pm.
Ella quiere reforzar el inventario del negocio, comprando productos básicos, por lo que solicita un préstamo e invertirlo en frijoles, arroz, azúcar, pan, huevos y detergentes, surtiendo el negocio, considera que tendrá mejores ventas y atenderá mejor a los clientes.
El objetivo D. ella es trabajar fuertemente y con el apoyo D. financiamientos alcanzar el desarrollo en el comercio, así mismo cubrir todos sus gastos.
texts.en:
Mercedes lives with her husband.  They do not have any children.  Mercedes runs a store which she has owned for 15 years.  This is her own source of income.  She works from 4.00am to 8.00pm.

Mercedes would like to strengthen her business inventory, buying basic household products.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan that she will invest in beans, rice, sugar, bread, eggs and detergents in order to stock her business.  She believes that she will be able to make better sales and better serve her customers.

Mercedes' goal is to work hard and, with the support of loans, make progress in her business.  She would like to be able to cover all her expenses.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, sugar, bread, eggs and detergents

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.
 
Elsa has a retail shop that sells green and yellow bananas and coconuts for drying into copra. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy bananas and coconuts to sell.

Elsa has been a member of HSPFI since 2007.  In the future, Elsa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and coconuts to sell

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco “CRISTO ASENCION DE RUMICHACA”; el Banco Comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, Provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rafaela; la socia tiene 54 años de edad y es casada, la socia tiene 3 hijos de 38,37,12 años de edad; la socia se dedica a la elaboración de chicha y ella tiene en su propia casa un espacio destinado a la venta de la tradicional chicha de jora elaborado a base de maíz amarillo macerado, la socia también tiene un terreno de cultivo en el cual siembra verduras, y las lleva a vender los días domingos en el mercado de Urubamba, la socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de maíz amarillo y semillas de diferentes tipos de verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz amarillo para la elaboración de chicha y semillas de verduras.

La socia agradece el préstamo que se le otorgara y se compromete en cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas de manera disciplinada.
texts.en:
Sra. Rafaela is a member of the Communal Bank “Cristo Asencion de Rumichaca”. This Communal Bank is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

She is 54 years old, married, and has three children (ages 38, 37, and 12). Rafaela prepares “chicha” (a traditional Peruvian beverage). She has a space in her own home that is set aside for selling traditional “chicha de jora”, which is made from ground yellow corn. Rafaela also has her own land for growing vegetables, which she brings on Sundays to the market in Urubamba to sell. She is seeking a loan to invest in the purchase of yellow corn and different types of vegetable seeds. Therefore, she is requesting a loan in order to buy these items.

Rafaela is grateful for the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase yellow corn for making "chicha" and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Catalina Santos

texts.es: Catalina Santos vive con su compañero de vida; ella posee un taller de confección que es muy conocido en la localidad pues tiene mucha experiencia en el ámbito elabora prendas al gusto del cliente, se encuentra a la vanguardia y esta adelante de su competencia; además tiene precios accesibles  y calidad de trabajo excelente. Catalina piensa que cuando tiene su vida enfocada en un propósito y da lo mejor de si, este se vuelve prospero, es por eso que le solicita  a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar telas para la confección de nuevas prendas. Catalina tiene fe que con su trabajo podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una mejor vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Catalina Santos lives with her common-law husband.  She has a sewing workshop that is well known in her town because of her vast experience making garments that are pleasing to her customers.  She is in the vanguard and ahead of her competitors, offering reasonable prices and excellent work quality.

Catalina believes that when she focuses on something in life and gives it her all, it becomes prosperous.  Therefore she is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL to buy fabric to make new clothes.  She has faith that through her work she will be able to provide financial stability and a better lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Ibtihal

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 44 years old, married and has three children. 

Ibtihal has been a tailor since 2005; she makes and repairs women's clothing. She has a deep understanding of local consumers, a lot of experience, and is  well known in her area. 

She is requesting a $2000 loan to buy two tailoring machines and to add more inventory like tissues and buttons. She is optimistic about her business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring her positive growth.

loans.use: To buy two tailoring machines and to add more inventory like tissues and buttons

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and four children. For the last five years, she has made a living by running a retail shop where she sells chicken and hotdogs. Elsie is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional frozen foods to sell to her customers. She is a new member of HSPFI and is committed to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 33-year-old married Lebanese man living with his wife and two school-aged children. He has 12 years of experience working as a car painter.  

In 2003, Ali was able to open his own car repair shop. His business went well during the past years and he was even able to hire three full-time employees. But he was also affected badly by unpleasant conditions. And today, he is asking to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy an electric generator needed for his work. He states that this purchase will positively impact his business growth.

loans.use: to buy an electric generator needed for his work

loans.name: Vilma Isidra

texts.es:
En  la ciudad de Managua la señora Vilma Isidra  se dedica a laborar como docente  en una universidad de la capital dedicándose  a esta labor desde hace 25 años .es casada  y con tres personas a su cargo a las que  tiene que proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen. 
Una de las necesidades que el señor atraviesa hoy en día es que debe mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda debido a que ha estado en malas condiciones por lo que ha tomado la decisión de iniciar la obra de mejora. es por este motivo que acude a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como zinc, , perlines .para iniciar el cambio de techo de su vivienda por medio de esta  obra brindara mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos y esposa .
Es importante destacar que por medio de la realización de esta obra le proporciona a su familia un techo digno donde vivir y con todas las condiciones necesarias
texts.en:
Vilma Isidra works hard as a university professor in a university in the capital city of Managua; she’s been in this profession for 25 years.  She’s married and has three people in her care that she has to provide proper conditions to for them to develop.

One of her current needs is to improve her house because it’s somewhat deteriorated so she’s decided to start a home improvement project.  Because of this she’s called upon Ceprodel to request a loan to buy building materials and supplies like zinc metal sheeting and purlines to start a roof replacement home improvement project.  Through this work she’ll provide her children and her husband with better living conditions.

It’s important to point out that through this project she will provide her family with a proper home with all necessary conditions to live in.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey (in the photo) and her husband, Pon, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1990 and have one daughter who is in school. 

Srey grows vegetables. Her husband is a fisherman and he also assists in his wife’s farming business. Srey is requesting her second loan of $700 to repair her kitchen where she cooks, because it’s old and broken.

loans.use: To repair her kitchen

loans.name: Nisrine

texts.en:
Nisrine is a 28-year-old single lady from Lebanon. She started a women's beauty business eight years ago. Nisrine is a hard worker. She is loved by most of her customers who are mainly her relatives, friends and neighbors. 

Nisrine works hard to improve her business. She previously requested a loan form Al Majmoua, Kiva's partner, in order to buy new machines, tools and products for her business. This is Nisrine's third cycle as a Al Majmoua borrower. Her previous loans were a perfect investment. This time the loan is to be used for her wedding needs and preparations and to pay for her wedding organizer. She hopes to expand her beauty salon more and more in the future, by opening a special treatment sector dealing with all facial and special skin medications.

loans.use: to pay for her wedding organizer

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel is married and has three children. She is 43 years old and lives in Bunawan, Calamba, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. Maribel has a vegetable garden in her backyard. To earn a living, she trades vegetables with a contract buyer. She has been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns 3000 PHP doing this type of work. Maribel has requested a loan for 9000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seeds for her garden. Maribel has been a member of GDMPC for one year. She is now on the third cycle. In the future, Maribel hopes to expand her vegetable garden in order to produce supplementary vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her garden.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Felicitas: es soltera y la socia tiene 51 años de edad y tiene 3 hijos,la socia sigue teniendo el negocio de elaboracion y venta de panes,la socia sigue vendiendo en forma ambulatoria,ella elabora todos los dias panes y los vende en el distrito de Oropesa,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de elaboracion y venta de panes . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como harina,manteca y aceite al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Felicitas, 51, is the borrower.  She’s single and has three children.  She continues with her bakery business making and selling bread.  She’s still a street vendor.  She bakes bread every day and sells it in Oropesa District.  She works from 8am until 5pm and supports her children through this business.  She wants to expand and improve her bread baking and selling business and is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like flour, shortening and oil at wholesale.  She is happy with the loan and pledges to meet her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies like flour, shortening and oil at wholesale.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 42-year-old married woman form Madaba, Jordan and a mother of five children.

Fatima is producing milk and other dairy products from her home. She is requesting a loan of 600 JD to purchase goats and sheep.

Fatima is looking to improve her family's living conditions and increase their living income.

loans.use: to purchase goats and sheep

loans.name: Julia Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE TETE CACA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Julia Marina; ella tiene 62 años de edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de manualidades, ella tiene una tienda donde vende todo tipo de manualidades como muñecas, portavasos y adornos, la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de manualidades. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como lana, cartulinas, hilos y palitos de tejer.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “SEÑOR DE TETE CACA” communal bank.  The bank is located in Cusco district, which is part of the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Señora Julia Marina. She is 62 years old, and is married with five children.  The member combines her daily activities with her business selling handicrafts.  She has a store where she sells all kinds of handicrafts, such as dolls, coasters, and decorations.  The member works from 9 a.m. through 6 p.m, and by means of this business the member has been able to move her children ahead in life. 

The member would like to expand and improve her business selling handicrafts.  She is requesting the loan to purchase materials such as wool, card, yarn, and knitting needles.

The member is happy about the loan and commits to complying with her repayments.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as wool, card, yarn and knitting needles.

loans.name: Geneveve

texts.en:
Geneveve is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Geneveve has a shop that sells electronic loads (prepaid phone cards) from several networks like GLOBE & SMART. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy stocks of electronic loads. Geneveve has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. 

In the future, Geneveve hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of electronic loads (prepaid phone cards)

loans.name: Flor Alba

texts.es:
Destacada como una mujer muy emprendedora Flor Alba, desde hace año y medio se dedicó a vender en un pequeño local calzado, camisas, camisetas, pantalones y ropa para niño. Con el crédito espera comprar mucho más surtido para tener un negocio más llamativo y lleno de mercancía y se pueda ver mejor para toda su clientela.

Su sueño es conseguir un local más grande donde pueda prestar un mejor servicio a todos sus clientes y darle empleo a sus hijos mayores y algunos familiares que están desempleados. Sus hijos son su mayor motivación y por eso buscará como sea salir delante de la mano de ellos.
texts.en:
Well-known as a very enterprising woman, Flor Alba has sold footwear, shorts, t-shirts, pants and children’s clothing in a small shop for the past year and a half.  She wants to use the loan to buy much more stock so she will have a more attractive business full of merchandise that will be more appealing to all her clientele.

Her dream is to obtain a larger shop where she can offer better service to all her customers and provide employment for her older children and several relatives who are unemployed. Her children are her greatest motivation and therefore she will look for a way to give them a hand up and a path forward.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.ru: Мунаввар женщина средних лет, мать 4-х детей, замужем и на данный момент на пенсии. Всю жизнь подрабатывала откармливая скот и кормила свою семью этим делом. Постоянно на  скотный рынок выходит сама,продаёт свой скот и заново закупает его на откорм. Вместе с ней в бизнесе участвуют сын и невестки. Мунаввар постоянно трудится несмотря на свои года и после каждого полученного кредита улучшает свои жизненные условия. Она намерена с нами сотрудничать и на очередной кредит хочет немного отремонтировать свой хлев.
texts.en: Munavvar is a middle-age woman and is a mother of four children.  She is married and is currently retired.  All her life, she worked part-time to fatten up livestock and provided for her family with this business.  She regularly goes to a livestock market herself, sells her livestock and buys livestock again for fattening up.  Her son and daughters-in-law participate in this business with her.  Munavvar constantly works, despite her age, and improves her living conditions with each obtained loan.  She intends to partner with us and wants to use this loan to make some repairs to her cowshed.

loans.use: to make repairs to a cowshed

loans.name: Mamadou Maguette

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune célibataire qui a arrêté ses études au collège faute de moyens pour les payer.Il s'est alors lancé dans la pêche. Il vit avec ses 4 frères et ses 3 sœurs chez son oncle. Son père vit à l'étranger et sa mère est décédée depuis 2008.Il a acquis une pirogue de pêche et passe souvent deux mois en mer pour se reposer deux semaine avant de repartir. Son activité lui procure des revenus assez importants avec lesquels il entretient sa famille et soutient aussi son oncle.Afin de renouveler son matériel , il sollicite un prêt de 450000frs pour acheter 30 balles de filets. Son ambition est de construire sa propre maison pour y loger sa famille.
texts.en:
The borrower is a young, single man who discontinued his studies in middle school due to an inability to pay for them.  Therefore, he started fishing.

He lives with his four brothers and three sisters in the house of his uncle.  His father lives abroad and his mother passed away in 2008.  He acquired a fishing boat, and often spends two months at sea with only two weeks to rest in between trips.

His business brings him important profits with which he takes care of his family while supporting his uncle.  In order to update his material, he is asking for a loan of 450,000 Frs. [XOF] in order to purchase thirty bails of netting. His goal is to build his own home in which to house his family.

loans.use: acheter 30 balles de filets

loans.name: Lydie

texts.fr:
Cliente de 41 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 12 et 18 ans. Elle arrête ses etudes en première année d'université quand elle rencontre son mari et met au monde son premier enfant.
 ne pouvant pas seulement s'occuper de son foyer et du ménage, pour être plus active, elle ouvre un restaurant pour subvenir a ses besoins et aider son mari dans les charges de la famille.

Elle a deja beneficiee de plusieurs crédits auprès de Hope, elle a toujours rembourse avec succès et fait constamment des épargnes et avec ses benefices, elle prend en charge la scolarité d'un de son  enfant qui est deja a l'université.
A l'octroi de son prêt, elle compte s'approvisionner en produits de première nécessité comme des bidons d'huile de palme et d'arachide, des vivres frais, tel que cartons de viande, de poulets,du poisson sale et fume, un sac de 50kg haricot. 
Son restaurant est très connu, son succès est du par le fait qu'elle prépare des plats congolais, sénégalaises et européennes, et des 6h , le restaurant est deja ouvert.
Pour l'avenir , elle tient a continuer a amélioré les conditions de travail , ajouter les chaises et tables en plastique , acheter un nouveau congélateur et frigidaire un groupe électrogène pour pallier aux problèmes de coupures d'électricité.
texts.en:
Lydie, age 41, is married and the mother of three children, who are between 12 and 18 years old. She dropped out of university during the first year, when she met her husband and gave birth to her first child.

Unwilling to only take care of her household, and to remain busy, she opened a restaurant to provide for herself and help her husband with the family expenses.

She already benefited from several loans from Kiva's partner, Hope, which she always repaid with success. She's able to constantly put money away and, with her profits, she takes care of the schooling expenses of one of her children, who is already at the university.

Once she gets her new loan, she intends to purchase supplies of food staples, such as cans of palm and peanut oil, fresh food products, such as boxes of meat, chicken, salted and smoked fish, and 50kg of beans.

Her restaurant is very well known. Her success arises from the fact that she prepares congolese, senegalese, and european dishes. Her restaurant is open from six o'clock.

In the future, she wants to continue improving her working conditions, add chairs and plastic tables, buy a new freezer and fridge, and buy a diesel generator to cope with power outages.

loans.use: to buy cans of oil, meat, chicken, fish, and beans

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: La señor Rocio es una mujer muy trabajadora que con la ayuda de su esposo tiene dos negocios uno es de abarrotes y el otro de ropa usada. Pero el que más sustenta los gasto del hogar es el negocio de abarrotes donde ofrece variedad de mercancía como lo es refrescos, botanas, comida de lata, lácteos, dulces y más. En este momento requiere de un préstamo para surtirlo ya que en la temporada de de Diciembre sus ventas incrementaron por lo que se quedo con muy poco producto.
texts.en: Rocio is a very hard-working woman who, with the help of her husband, runs two businesses.  One of her businesses is a grocery store and the other is a used-clothing business.  The business that contributes the most towards her household expenses is the grocery store, where she offers a wide range of merchandise such as soft drinks, snacks, canned food, dairy products, sweet treats, etc.  Right now, Rocio needs a loan to stock her business because her sales increased during the December season and so she has few products left.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Yamily Nayu

texts.es:
Yamaly es un joven de 20 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Mala, al lado de sus padres a quienes quiere muchísimo, Yamaly es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, ella logro estudiar la carrera técnica  de contabilidad, pero debido a que no pudo encontrar empleo ella con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro logro iniciar su negocio de venta de abarrotes, con el fruto de su trabajo puede apoyar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque ofrece productos de calidad a precios cómodos.

Yamaly está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como arroz, conservas, fideos, entre otros; de esta manera ella podra tener mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño: Tener un minimarket y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Yamaly is a young 20-year-old woman who lives in the city of Mala with her parents whom she loves very much. Yamaly is a young woman with a great desire to get ahead. She was able to study toward a technical career in accounting. However, due to the fact that she was not able to find work, she started her own business selling groceries with a lot of effort and her savings. With the income from her work, she is able to support her parents with the household expenses. She believes that her work is going well because she is very friendly with her customers and, above all, because she offers quality products at good prices. 

Yamaly is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help offered that has been offered she will be able to purchase merchandise for her business like rice, jams, noodles, and other things. In this way she will be able to have a greater variety of products to offer and continue struggling to realize her greatest dream: to have a mini market and support her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (rice, jams, noodles, and others)

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Although Ekua has received no prior formal education, she is a fruit vendor at Ayensudu in Elmina. She specializes in selling watermelon. She has been involved in this enterprise for some years. Ekua is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. She will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of watermelon for supply, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of watermelon for supply, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en: Mrs. Anh, 30 years old, is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children. She runs a fishing business and requested a loan through QB WDF in order to buy fishing nets and other equipment.She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like her general store.She dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and other equipment

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
L. Irene is an active member of Life in Africa working in the invisible Bracelet project as a bracelet maker. Before coming to LIA, she earned her living working in the stone quarry near the Acholi quarters.

She was forced to flee Northern Uganda because of the war and, as most displaced Acholi, she settled in the displaced persons camp. Life there is very hard and basic needs are hard to come by. One such need is water. There are few tap water supplies and this makes it very expensive for the people to get water and they have to walk very far.

Her plan is to install a water tap in the part of the quarter where she lives. She will be able to provide the water at a less expensive rate and it will also benefit the community by shortening the distance they have to travel to get water. There has recently been another installation of a successful water tap but the quarters are very large and one tap will not fill the needs of so many people. This will give her a strong customer base and make it a profitable business venture. For this she is seeking a loan in the amount of 800,000/=. She will be able to repay the loan in 12 months at a rate of 66,667/= per month. Once cash is at hand, the whole processes to have tap water is only one to two weeks.

Below is her break down:

35 pieces of metallic pipes @ 10,000 =350,000/=

Labor charges ……………………… 300,000/=

Construction of shelter against wastages….100,000/=

Charges from national water authority ……30,000/=

Transport……………………………………10,000/=

Other ……………………………………….10,000/=

The total amount is 800,000/=

Irene's loan has been reviewed and guaranteed by her peers at the Life in Africa WE Center community in Kampala. She has designated the 25% community impact portion of the interest on her loan to support Life in Africa's talent discovery team. For more about Irene, her life and her worldview, visit http://lifeinafrica.com/4/labongirene

loans.use: community water installation

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor has a tailor shop in his home, where he makes suits and pants. He started out with the help of his father who taught him the business and later left him the business so that he would continue working. In the beginning he only did alterations. He continues to offer that service but now also offers women’s and men’s clothing and suit rental.

Victor aspires to sell all types of clothing. He would use the loan to buy cloth wholesale. He has confidence that with a wider selection of types of cloth his business will grow.

Victor is the father of a daughter. He is 52 years old and separated. His business is the only source of income in the household. Victor has hope that his loan will give him financial security.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran. Kiva volunteer.

Víctor tiene una sastrería en su casa dedicándose a la confección de ternos y pantalones. Víctor empezó con la ayuda de su padre quien le enseño y le dejo el negocio para que siguiera trabajando. Al principio el solo hacia arreglos y recibía costuras. Ahora el continúa ofreciendo este servicio junto con ropa de damas y caballeros y alquiler de ternos. Víctor aspira vender todo tipo de ropa. El usara el préstamo para invertir comprando telas al por mayor. El tiene la seguridad de que con estas nuevas variedades de telas su negocio crecerá. Víctor es padre de una hija. El tiene 52 años, separado, su negocio es la única fuente de ingreso en el hogar. Víctor tiene la esperanza que este préstamo le dará seguridad financiera.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy cloths and materials from wholesalers

loans.name: Sia Moi

texts.en: Sia Moi, daughter of Mohammad Omar, was born in 1980. She is single and lives in District 8 of Kabul City. She has studied up to secondary school after which her family didn't give her permission to study further. She wanted to complete her education and after that assist her family financially, but quiting education halted her dreams. Still, she didn't lose hope and started a shared business with her brother who runs a carpentry shop. At the start of her business she and her brother faced lots of problems because they didn't have enough money to purchase all the carpentry materials. Then she heard about AFSG's loan granting and she decided to take a loan for her business improvement. After the 1st and 2nd cycle she bought a carpentry machine which really helped them to operate more quickly in their business and increase their production. Now she is in her 4th loan cycle and wants to continue taking loans.

loans.use: Buying carpentry wood

loans.name: Gulbala

texts.en: Gulbala is a father of 2 children. His wife died and he is raising their children alone. He was born in 1950 and lives in Yenikand village, Salyan region. He has 20 years of experience in this business. Now he would like to apply for a loan of $475 to buy  grass.

loans.use: To buy grass

loans.name: Leyda Flor

texts.es:
Leyda Flor G. S., a widow with two school-aged children, is a member of the Community Bank "Las Amigas Zulmiritas." She sells food in a "maloca," which is a shop constructed without doors or windows that has a dry palm leave roof, in the town of Nueva Requena 38km from the city of Pucallpa.

After the death of her husband, Leyda's economic situation worsened and she saw the need to seek work. As she loves to cook, she got the idea to sell food to the loggers, farmers, teachers and doctors of her town. Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles ( approximately $94). Today the Movimiento Manuela Ramos is administering her a loan of $325 to grow her small store, equipping it with tables so that she can attend her clients as a sit-down restaurante.

The absence of her husband has been very difficult for Leyda, but owning her own small business has helped to push her forward. The earnings from her shop help to cover the needs of others in her life that are not able earn a living, such as her two children's school fees.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer

Leyda Flor G. S., viuda con dos hijos estudiantes, Socia del Banco Comunal Las Amigas Zulmiritas, vende comida en una maloca (tienda construida sin puertas ni ventanas con techo de hojas secas de palma) en el poblado de Nueva Requena a 38Km de la ciudad de Pucallpa.

Después de la muerte de su esposo su situación económica empeoró y se vio en la necesidad de trabajar y como le deleita la cocina surgió la idea de la venta de comida para los madereros, agricultores así como profesores y enfermeras. Su primer prestamo fue de S/. 300.00 (US$ 94.00 aprox.). Hoy se ha prestado US$ 325.00 aprox.para ampliar su pequeña maloca, equipándola con mesas y así atender a mas clientes del poblado.

La ausencia de su esposo le angustia mucho pero este pequeño negocio le anima a seguir adelante y saber que puede cubrir necesidades de otras personas que no pueden hacerlo, así como de cubrir los estudios de sus hijos.

loans.use: For equipment (to purchase tables)

loans.name: Edy

texts.en:
Business Description

Edy has had an audio and video workshop since he was 12. He started his business by going from door to door and offering his services in various parts of the city. He focuses on the reparation and maintenance of domestic products. Nowadays, his development is evident as he already has a shop in his home as well as an employee. His potential clients are from the community he lives in as well as offering his services to numerous businesses and institutions in Guayaquil.

Use of the loan

He would like to use part of his loan to buy replacement parts he needs on a daily basis so that he can build up a stock as well as adapt his shop so that he can pay more attention to his clients.

Personal information

He is 34 years old and lives in a cement house with his three kids. His wife helps him deal with the clients. His goal is to grow in the locality so that he can can have a bigger income and thus progress with his family.

Translated from Spanish by Alex Galimberti, Princeton University Language Project

Descripción del Negocio

Don Edy tiene un taller de audio y video desde hace 12 años, el inicio su negocio con el servicio de puerta a puerta por varios sectores de la ciudad, se dedica a la reparación y mantenimiento de artículos para el hogar, hoy en día su desarrollo ha sido notorio ya que tiene un local en su casa y un empleado, sus clientes potenciales es la comunidad de este sector y también brinda el servicio a varias empresas e instituciones de guayaquil .

Uso del Préstamo

Quiere usar parte de su crédito para comprar varios repuestos de uso diario y de esta manera poder tener en stock y el resto para readecuar su taller ya que siempre esta empeñado a brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes. /p>

Información Personal

Tiene 34 años y tres hijos, su vivienda es de cemento y en la atención a los clientes le ayuda su esposa, su meta es crecer en su local para de esta manera poder tener un mayor ingreso económico y así progresar junto a su familia.

loans.use: Buy replacement audio and video parts

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva is 44 years old, she lives with her parents, has four children and is a single mother. Two of her children are grown and two are still in school.

Elva owns a small store which she opened thanks to some savings that she gathered while she worked with her father raising and selling pigs.

Today, her store generates good income, allowing her to live in her own house which she bought with the earnings generated from her store.

She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as sugar, milk, canned goods, meat, fruit, vegetables, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Elva tiene 44 años de edad, vive con sus padres y tiene cuatro hijos, ella es madre soltera. Dos de sus hijos ya son mayores de edad y los otros están en edad escolar aún.

Elva posee una despensa, lo abrió gracias a unos ahorros que fue juntando cuando trabajaba con su padre, ambos se dedicaban a la cría y venta de cerdos.

Actualmente, su despensa genera buenos ingresos, ellos ahora viven en una casa propia que lograron comprarla con las ganancias que generó la despensa.

Ella solicita el crédito para comprar mercaderías como azúcar, leche, productos enlatados, carne, frutas, verduras, etc.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise such as sugar, milk, canned goods, meat, fruit, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: María Del Pilar

texts.es:
Mrs. G. is a single mom (widowed), working hard to support and raise her 3 children who are in elementary school. She works preparing meat in her home to then send it in the central market to her customers.

Her business started outside of the market, selling with a table and some benches. Right now she is inside the market, in the prepared food section, with a better set-up. She started this business 25 years ago, starting with a sum of C$1,000.00 from a loan given from a central market lender.

With Ceprodel's support she has continued to grow with a total of 19 loans in the past 3 years. These loans have allowed her to improve her family's quality of life by increasing the quantity and quality of the meals she can offer, which is a dish called Carne Baho (meat, yuca, plantain, banana, cabbage salad).

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Gutiérrez es una madre soltera (viuda) luchando para mantener y desarrollar a sus 3 hijos que estudian en la primaria. Se dedica a preparar carne en su hogar para luego vender este alimento en el mercado central y allí poder venderlo a sus clientes.

Su negocio se inicio por fuera del mercado vendiendo en una mesa y sus bancos. Actualmente esta dentro del mercado en el sector de las comidas con mejores condiciones. Inició este negocio hace 25 años comenzando con un monto de C$1.000.00 producto de un préstamo que le otorgó a un prestamista del mercado.

Con Ceprodel de la mano siguió adelante desde hace 3 años con un total de 19 créditos otorgados que le han impactado en mejorar sus condiciones de vida de su familia aumentando la cantidad y calidad de su comida que ofrece que es la llamada Carne Baho. (Carne, yuca, plátano verde, plátano maduro, ensalada de repollo).

loans.use: Buying ingredients to prepare meals (Compra de los ingredientes para  alimento)

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
Eleven years ago, In order to support her two children, Ana Patricia H., a single mother, started a business selling frozen water, soft drinks, carbonated drinks and baked goods outside the Terminal market.

It's important to note that this type of business is very competitive. Ana H. has many competitors located very close to her place of business. She needs to buy her inventory and raw materials in order to later market them. For this reason, Ceprodel has been supporting Mrs. H. for a year. She has received 10 loans which she has used to acquire the soft drinks she needs to satisfy her clients and support her children.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace once años, en la ciudad de León, para poder mantener a sus 2 hijos por ser madre soltera, la señora Ana Patricia H. inicia un negocio de venta de agua helada, gaseosa, bebidas suaves y tortas en las afueras del mercado la Terminal.

Es necesario destacar que este tipo de negocio es muy competitivo por el hecho de que la señora Ana H. tiene muchos competidores que se ubican a su alrededor. Su necesidad es la compra de las gaseosas y la materia prima para luego comercializarlas. Es por esta razón que desde hace un año, Ceprodel ha apoyado a la señora H. con la realización de 10 créditos los cuales los ha utilizado para adquirí las gaseosas y de esta manera poder satisfacer a sus clientes pero principalmente a sus hijos que tanto lo necesitan.

loans.use: Purchase of carbonated beverages and water

loans.name: Santos Alberto

texts.es:
Don Santos is 33 years of age. Since he was very young his father taught him to work in the country, where together they produced pineapple of the variety “Monte Lirio”. This constitutes the economic base of the settlers of Ticuantepe, due to the characteristic botany of the zone. For ten years he has been dedicated to the production of pineapple as his main economic activity, as well as to the plantations of banana and coffee. This activity has permitted his family to move forward. His wife is a housewife. At present the cultivation of pineapple presents certain difficulties. The crop that he is producing is of a low quality, due to the fact that the land needs chemical fertilizers to improve the performance of the soil. The condition of the soil is the most important element in the whole process of production. It consists of preparing the land with supplements that permit the plants to sprout and bear fruit. Thus a quality product will be obtained.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Santos, tiene 33 años de edad, desde muy joven su padre le enseño a trabajar en el campo, en donde juntos producían piña de variedad “Monte Lirio”, éste constituye la base de la economía de los pobladores de Ticuantepe, debido a las características botánicas de la zona. Hace 10 años, se dedica a la producción de piña como su principal actividad económica, así como también a las plantaciones de plátano y café. Esta actividad le han permitido sacar adelante a su familia, su esposa es ama de casa. Actualmente el cultivo de piña presenta ciertas dificultades, se esta produciendo con una baja calidad, debido a que la tierra necesita de fertilizantes químicos que mejore el rendimiento del suelo. El cuido del suelo es el elemento más relevante en todo el proceso de producción, consiste en preparar la tierra con abonos que permitan que el fruto retoñe y de los frutos esperados, y así se obtendrá un producto con calidad.

loans.use: To buy chemical fertilizers to maintain the condition of the soil.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Mrs. Sem Y., 58, of the Chum Teav Village in Banteay Meanchey Province, earns about $3 per day as a grocer selling products from her house. Her husband, Mr. Keo Ton, is 72 years old and has been a farmer and bicycle repairman since 1997. He earns around $2 per day. Mrs. Y. has eight children, seven of whom are married. Another lives with her and earns about $1.50 per day raising pigs.

Mrs. Y. is requesting a loan of $700 to increase her grocery stock and buy small pigs to raise. With her sustainable business and desire to expand for the future, she works hard everyday. She thanks Kiva for support and promises prompt loan repayment.

loans.use: To increase her grocery stock and buy small pigs to raise.

loans.name: Igor

texts.en:
Igor is married with two kids. He’s from Kherson in the southern part of Ukraine. Igor sells groceries in the local central market. His merchandise is assorted and of very good quality. Igor has been in this trade for 7 years. He has promptly repaid 6 previous loans. Currently he has about $4000 in inventory stock. His monthly net profit is about $1600.

Igor is very disciplined and responsible. He is thorough and his mind is very sharp – he can keep all his business details in his head. All these qualities have helped Igor overcome many challenges that have come his way and allowed him to reach success in business. He has always sought to achieve economic freedom and independence. Igor is hoping this loan will help his venture to continue growing and bringing him profit.

loans.use: Igor would like to purchase inventory for his grocery stall.

loans.name: Gam D 2028-6 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Zerpha M.. She is currently in the business of selling charcaol and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Zerpha is 47 years old and is married with a husband who is a teacher. She has three children ranging in age from 1 to 10 and her children go to school.

Each week, Zerpha makes approximately 60 Sudanese pounds in profit; with the extra profits from her loan she hopes to be able to expand her business.

Zerpha is joined in her small group by Ermina I., Anita A., Ludia Y., and Joice E.. Ermina has a business selling charcoal; Anita currently operates a business selling vegetables, as does Ludia. Each of these businesswomen hopes to use her loan to expand her business. The final member of the group, Joice E., sells goods in a shop; she is requesting a loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: For business expansion.

loans.name: Luz Idalia

texts.es:
The preparation of food requires much persistence, dedication and effort, as when a particular dish necessitates cooking at high temperatures. Conscious of this situation, Luz Idalia Yanes has her own food preparation business, which she runs from her own home.

Every day Luz prepares foods to offer to her clients, who visit her at her home. The business requires raw materials for the dishes. For this reason, Luz was motivated to approach Ceprodel for a loan to purchase ingredients that will allow her to make the food specialties she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

La elaboración de alimentos requiere de mucho empeño y dedicación e implica mucho esfuerzo por lo que se debe de estar a altas temperaturas cocinando para ofrecer determinado platillo. Consciente de esta situación la señora Luz Idalia Yanes posee su propio negocio de venta de elaboración de comida atendiéndolo en su propia casa de habitación.

Todos los días ella prepara sus alimentos para ofrecerlos a sus clientes los cuales la visitan en su casa de habitación. La necesidad que el negocio atraviesa es que requiere la materia prima para elaborar los platillos. Por este motivo ella acude a Ceprodel con el objetivo de obtener un crédito para la compra de los ingredientes y así iniciar a preparar sus alimentos para ofertarlos.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is a thirty-eight year old mother with two children. Isabel sells traditional food on Saturdays and Sundays in a regional fair located on a street near the city stadium. Isabel´s specialty is to make mondongo (a soup with corn and meat, broiled overnight) with the help of her partner.

Isabel is a member of the Suni Village Bank. (Suni means “Secure” in Quechua).

Isabel needs a loan of 1500 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($550 US Dollars) to invest in rice, noodles, oil, potatoes, corn, and firewood.

Isabel´s dream is to own the property for her restaurant, have a grocery store, and provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to invest in rice, noodles, oil, potatoes, corn, and firewood.

loans.name: Denise

texts.fr: Née en 1969 à Agomé-Tomégbé, madame D. Denise est mariée à un maçon et a à sa charge six (6) personnes. Son activité principale est la vente de poisson fumée. Avec son revenu, elle arrive à Contribuer aux charges du foyer. Elle sollicite un crédit qui va lui permettre d’augmenter son commerce et acheter les poissons en gros pour  pouvoir gagner plus et subvenir à tous ses besoins.
texts.en:
Born in 1969 in Agomé-Tomégbé, Ms. Denise D. is married to a mason and has six people in her care. Her main work involves selling smoked fish. With her income, she manages to help with household expenses. She is requesting a loan that is going to enable her to increase her business and to buy fish in bulk, so that she may earn more and provide for all her needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell smoked fish

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr:
Née le 31 décembre 1965  à Lomé, elle est revendeuse des produits de premières nécessités à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants qui vont à l’école. Elle est une femme dynamique qui a commencé cette activité depuis l’année 2000 dans son quartier.
Elle n’a jamais bénéficié du crédit auprès de WAGES et sollicite ce premier pour refaire son stock. Ce crédit lui permettra d’acheter 05 bidons d’huile végétale, 06 sacs de riz, 04 sacs de sucre en poudre et 06 cartons de savons. Ainsi avec le revenu de son activité, elle pourra aider son mari dans les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Born on December 31, 1965 in Lomé, she is a re-seller of basic goods in Lomé. She is married and the mother of four (4) children, all attending school. She is an energetic woman who started this activity in her neighborhood in the year 2000.

She has never benefited from a credit from WAGES and is requesting this first one to replenish her stock. This loan will enable her to buy 5 cans of vegetable oil, 6 bags of rice, 4 bags of sugar, and 6 boxes of soap. With the income from her activity, she will be able to help her husband with household expenses.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic goods

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es:
La señorita Janeth pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Libertad”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Bellavista, Centro Poblado Menor de La Libertad. Se dedica a la venta de zapatos y sandalias de manera ambulatoria, visitando las casas de sus amigos, vecinos, familiares y recorriendo los pueblos cercanos, sobre todo en sus fiestas patronales.

Con este crédito de S/. 300, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará zapatos y sandalias de diversos modelos, tallas y colores para surtir más su negocio y satisfacer las exigencias de sus clientes, porque tener surtido le asegura sus ventas.
 
Janeth tiene 22 años, es soltera y vive con sus padres. Es una mujer trabajadora con ganas de salir adelante y de llegar a concretar sus metas, sabe que con esfuerzo y dedicación lo va a conseguir. Más adelante piensa implementar su negocio con la venta de ropa y contar con un local para exhibir sus productos.
texts.en:
Janeth belongs to the La Libertad Communal Bank. She lives in the township of La Libertad in Bellavista district and province, San Martín region. She sells shoes and sandals door to door, to her friends, neighbours, and relatives. She also travels to nearby towns especially during local festivals. With this S/.300 loan, which she will pay back in four months, she will buy shoes and sandals in a range of styles, sizes, and colours, thus increasing her stock and satisfying her customers’ demands. If she manages to do this, she is assured of good sales. Janeth is 22 years old, single, and lives with her parents. She is a hardworking woman with a desire to get ahead and achieve her goals. She knows that with effort and determination she will succeed. She is thinking of expanding into clothing sales and having her own premises from which to sell her products in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shoes and sandals in a range of styles and sizes.

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi: Chị Vũ Thị Tuyết năm nay 51 tuổi, chị mới tham gia Quỹ tình thương được hơn 1 năm.Hiện nay  chị  bán hàng ăn ở chợ còn chồng chị hàng ngày giúp chị chế biến thức ăn và đi lấy hàng về để chị bán. Tuy mới tham gia vào Quỹ, chỉ với mức vốn vay ban đầu  5 triệu đồng nhưng  đã giúp cho gia đình chị có thu nhập cao hơn. Với mức thu nhập 2 triệu đồng/ tháng cũng đủ để gia đình chị  đảm bảo hoàn trả đầy đủ và cải thiện chát lượng cuậc sống. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9 triệu đồng để mua bàn ghế, thực phẩm phục vụ cho công việc bán hàng ăn.
texts.en:
Mrs. T. Thi Vu, 51 years old, has just joined the Fund for a little more than a year. Currently she is running a street food stall at the local market, and her husband helps with preparing the food as well as bringing the raw ingredients home. Although she has just joined the Fund, she borrowed the loan limit of 5 million VND which helped her family increase their income. With an income of 2 million VND/month, the family can guarantee that they will be able to repay the loan as well as improve their standard of living. In this coming round of funding, she would like to borrow 9 million VND to buy chairs and tables and raw foods to use in their food stall business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tables and chairs, foods

loans.name: Marcial Ignacia

texts.es: El señor Marcial Ignacio González,  tiene la edad de 52 años habita en el barrio Los Madrigales ubicado en el kilómetro quince carretera hacia Ticuantepe  , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como asistente en un buffet de abogados para poder ayudarle con los gastos del hogar , , los planes hacia un futuro es logra construir su propia vivienda ya que ellos viven en la casa de la mamá de don Marcial , este señor desde hace Diez años trabaja como agricultor ya que su papá siempre lo ha apoyado . El con este préstamo va invertir en compra de insumos y aplicárselo a la producción para obtener mejor producción y así vender a un muy buen precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
