Mr. Marcial Ignacio G. is 52 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Los Madrigales, located in the 15th kilometer on the highway toward Ticuantepe. He lives with his wife, who works as an assistant at a lawyer’s office in order to help with the household bills. Their plan for the future is to construct their own house, since they now live in Mr. Marcial’s mother’s house. For the past 10 years, he has worked in agriculture like his father had. With the loan he receives, he will invest in supplies and will apply himself in order to obtain a better production, which will sell at a very good price in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Christina Stoddard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies like fertilizer for his crop

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort O. is forty-three years old. She is a married mother of six children. Three of her children have completed high school while three are still in the basic school. Comfort lives with her husband, a farmer, and her children in a mining/farming community called Bibiani in the Western Region. Her husband cultivates palm nuts in the community in which they live.

Comfort works hard to help her husband provide for the family. She sells beef in the local market square. Comfort also roasts some of the meat and sells it in the form of kebab. She says children in her community also come to collect for hawking on commission.

Comfort orders the meat from Burkina Faso where cost is quite economical. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to order beef in bulk. She belongs to a Trust Bank group called Nyame Nhyira (God’s Blessings). The group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy beef in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Ajara

texts.en:
Ajara I. is the 35-year-old mother of three girls and a boy, two currently in junior high and the youngest in elementary school. She lives with her children and husband, a fitting mechanic, in a rented apartment in Offinso, a business and farming community in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Ajara helps her husband provide for the family by working as a textile dealer, selling a variety of fabrics – fancy, java and wax prints - from a shed in the market square as well as door to door, procuring her goods from wholesalers in Kumasi. Ajara has been in the business for six years, with the majority of her customers preferring to buy on credit and paying by installment, thus requiring her to maintain a large working capital to be able to order the textiles in significant quantities.

Ajara hopes to expand her business by trekking to nearby towns to conduct business, and is therefore requesting a loan to purchase more textiles. She hopes to help her husband put up their own house with the small profit she makes.

loans.use: To buy textile fabrics.

loans.name: Alimotu

texts.en:
Alimotu is 37 years old. She is married with two children.

To earn a living, Alimotu sells clothing materials. She carries her goods with a tray on her head as she sells them from street to street within her community. She has no shop in which to display her goods. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of N100,000 so she can rent a shop. She would also like to purchase more clothing materials to sell.

She says thank you to all who will make this loan possible.

loans.use: To rent a shop and purchase more clothing materials to sell

loans.name: Lady Vivian Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Lady Vivian Carolina M. C., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Tesoro Escondido”,  vive en el Jr. Eduardo Peña Meza Nº 294, Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente,  tiene 29 años y es madre de un niño, que todavía depende de ella.
Tiene 07 años trabajando con el Banco. 

Actualmente, se dedica a la venta de uniformes, y lo vende a sus alumnas del Instituto donde también trabaja como secretaria en el mismo lugar, nos cuenta que sus ventas aumentaron, ya que es muy carismática y sonriente, con sus alumnos.

 Con el préstamo de S/3,000.00 que cancelará a plazo de 06  meses,  invirtirá en la compra de 100 juegos de uniformes de damas y varones  para satisfacer la demanda de los alumnos(as) del  Instituto.

Hoy, se siente mas independiente y tranquila, ya que es ella quien tomas sus propias decisiones en su negocio y en los ingresos que genera. 

Lady Vivian, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Lady Vivian Carolina M. C. is a member of the "Tesoro Escondido" community bank. She lives in the district of Juanjui in the department of San Martín. She is in a common-law marriage, is 29 years old and has one son, who is still a dependent. She has been working with the bank for seven years. She currently sells uniforms to the students of the institution where she also works as a secretary. She says that her sales will increase because she is very charismatic and cheerful with her students. With this loan of S/ 3,000 soles which she will repay in six months, she will buy 100 sets of girls' and boys' uniforms to satisfy the demands of the students. She now feels more independent and calm as she is making all her own decisions with respect to the business and to the income it generates. Lady Vivian is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her grow as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 100 sets of girls' and boys' uniforms

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia F. C. lives in an agricultural area in the Municipality of Anta, about an hour outside of the city of Cusco. She has five children, four of whom are also members of the San Pedro de Katañiray Village Bank. Julia and some of her children live in a lovely yellow home with two cows painted on the front, a means to alert passers-by of the milk-selling business she runs from her home. Julia has several cows, which usually yield anywhere from ten to fifteen liters of milk per day. She then sells the milk to an intermediary for 80 centimos (~US 26 cents) per liter. The intermediary then takes the milk to the city of Cusco, where it is resold for 1 nuevo sol (~US 30 cents) per liter. 

Julia is requesting a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles in order to help her sons buy a station wagon to use as a taxi. Her two sons currently share a car, which they take turns driving to and around the city of Cusco. They have some money saved, but need another 3,000 nuevos soles to buy a second car. With two taxis, they can work simultaneously and earn twice as much as they currently do. They will also be able to rent out one of the cars to other drivers as an additional source of income.

loans.use: Help sons buy a station wagon

loans.name: Willy

texts.es: Willy es un joven muy empeñoso que trata de salir adelante día a día para buscarse un mejor porvenir, vive en su casa propia. Desde hace 7 años se dedica a brindar servicio de taxi, comenzó trabajando en diferentes oficios, aunque conducir siempre le gustó mucho, aprendiendo desde joven con carros prestados de familiares y amigos. Es así que hoy en día se dedica a lo que más le gusta, él sigue diferentes rutas, según los clientes lo soliciten, todo el día “se pasa de paseo” como él mismo dice, empezando su labor desde las 7 de la mañana, hora en la que la mayoría de las personas salen a sus trabajos, requiriendo de sus servicios, y termina hasta las 8 o 9 de la noche. La ventaja de su trabajo es que le permite decidir cuándo salir a trabajar, siendo su propio jefe, pero Willy siempre ha sido muy estricto con sus horarios porque sabe que sólo así obtendrá buenas ganancias. Él quiere prosperar, y en el futuro tener una empresa de taxis, pero para esto se requiere mucha dedicación es por eso que necesita trabajar mucho. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y promete ser muy  puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita es para mandar a hacerle un mantenimiento a su auto, para que esté en óptimas condiciones.
texts.en:
Willy is a very hard-working young man who is trying to get ahead in search of a better future. He has held odd jobs in different offices, but he has always liked driving, which he learned to do from a young age with cars borrowed from family members and friends. For the past 7 years, he has offered a taxi service, allowing him to make money doing what he likes most; spending the days "just driving around", as he likes to say. He starts at 7 in the morning, helping his clients get to their jobs on time, and he finishes at 8 or 9 at night. The advantage of his job is that he is his own boss, which allows him to decide when he goes to work, but he has always been very strict with his hours because he knows that's the only way to guarantee a good income. He wants to prosper, and in the future, own a taxi company--but that will require alot of dedication, which is why he needs to work hard. This is his first loan with PRISMA microfinances, and he promises to always be on time with his payments. The money that he is asking for is for the maintenance of his car so that it can be in top condition.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car maintenance

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La  señora Lourdes, es de San Estanislao, tiene casa propia.
Es propietaria de una tienda de ropas, que esta ubicada en el mercado de la ciudad, con 10 años de funcionamiento, con clientela formada y un buenas ventas, ya que tiene buenos precios y calidad sus mercaderìas, tambien el buen trato con los clientes.
Desea ampliar su local para poder tener màs variedad de ropas y otras cosa que los clientes solicitan.
texts.en:
Senora Lourdes is from San Estanislao and lives in her own house. She is the proprietor of a small clothing shop located in the city market. She's had the business for 10 years, and with her high quality merchandise, great customer service and good prices, she has a solid customer base and good sales. She would like to expand her small shop and offer a greater variety of clothing as well as other items her customers are requesting.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her small clothing shop to offer more variety to her customers

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden P., from the city of Dulapo, Oroquieta City, is 31 years old and widowed. To make a living, Eden owns and operates a "sari-sari" store, selling a variety of goods in the local community. Eden has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

Eden joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Eden is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory and increase working capital for a sari-sari store

loans.name: Baye Mor Talla

texts.fr: mr N. est un comptable de profession ;il est marié et est père d'un enfant ,il vit avec sa famille au quartier cité senghor de thiès,il sollicite ce pret pour acheter des meubles pour sa maison
texts.en:
Mr. N. is an accountant by profession. He is married and the father of one child. He lives with his family in the Cité Senghor district of Thiès. He's requesting this loan to buy furniture for his house.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Furnishings

loans.name: Faaae

texts.en: Faaae A., 25, is married with 1 child.  She has 3 years of experience in the grocery shop business.  She sells to the general public 7 days per week.  She has no previous loans with SPBD.  Faaae expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala.  SPBD loans are Faaae’s only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.  Business is doing well.

loans.use: Purchase grocery supplies to sell.

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Pastor Groups 1 & 4

texts.en:
Juana S. is a mother of three and lives in Santiago, a crowded city in the Dominican Republic. She lives in a community called Los Salados, where many women have taken out loans from Esperanza. Seeing these women use their loans to start new businesses has encouraged Juana to get involved as well, and she became a group leader. 

This is Juana’s first loan, and she will use it to start her own small business. Juana plans to sell shoes. She will open a small street stall in her community and sell shoes to people on the streets. This small business will serve as supplementary income for family. 

Juana is excited to embark on her new business venture. She is thankful for the opportunity to take out her micro-loan, because it will provide her with access to capital that she would not have otherwise had. She hopes this will be the first step along a path that will lead to a better life for her family.

loans.use: Buy an inventory of shoes

loans.name: George Njoroge

texts.en:
George N. is a 26-year-old gentleman, married to Diana Wanjiru. He has been operating a taxi business for the last five years from Naivasha town.

This is George's second loan with KADET and he intends to buy a new engine for his taxi for better services and to also add a competitive edge.

He used his first loan to service his taxi and buy spare parts, which enabled him to boost services to his loyal customers. George learned about KADET from a friend who is already a client. 

His future aspiration is to own a fleet of taxis and register a tour and travel company.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy a new engine for his taxi

loans.name: Julio Ulises

texts.es: Don Julio S. tiene la edad de 47 años, es un hombre que desde joven a trabajado en el campo, como agricultor, otras veces de albañil para ganarse el pan de cada día para su familia, casado, su esposa le tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, por falta de trabajo tuvo que emigrar a Costa Rica país vecino para sobresalir adelante  trabajo seis años el cual logro recorrer dinero y compro tierras para sembrar. En este momento el esta trabajando en la alcaldía el villa el Carmen como recolector de basura pero también trabaja sus tierras, con esta solicitud en Afodenic es para terminar de comprar mas tierras para lograr tener cinco manzanas las cuales empezara a sembrar para lograr la independencia y dedicarse a su propio negocio. Se siente sastifecho por lograr poder lograr sus objetivo hojala que sean muchas las familias que puedan salir adelante mediante la oportunidad de los préstamos.
texts.en:
Julio, 47 years old, is a man who has since his youth worked in the countryside, sometimes as a farmer, other times as a mason, to earn his family's daily bread. Julio is married and he and his wife have three grown children. For lack of work, Julio had to immigrate to a neighboring country, Costa Rica, to survive. Then he worked six years before collecting enough money to enable him to buy lands to cultivate. At present, he is working in Villa el Carmen as a garbage collector but he still works the land.

His loan request from AFODENIC is to buy enough land to reach 8.75 acres, which he will then begin to cultivate in order to dedicate himself to his own business and achieve independence. He feels very satisfied to be able to reach his objective, and hopes that many other families can also get ahead by having the opportunity for loans.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUY LAND IN ORDER TO HAVE HIS OWN BUSINESS

loans.name: Jhonny Antonio

texts.es: El joven Jhonny de 29 años de edad, casado, reside en el barrio Riguero en la capital de Managua, el se caso a los 20 años el cual se ha dedicado a trabaja su esposa le tiene una hija de 9 años de edad, comenzó con la venta de ropa, pero luego decidió buscar un trabajo para tener un ingreso seguro y solo en tiempos libres seguir con la venta de ropa, trabaja como guarda de seguridad y las ventas la hace su esposa. Ha crecido en inventario gracias a los prestamos que Afodenic a otorgado es el segundo ciclo y esta sastifecho por lograr incrementar su inventario, con este préstamo comprara ropa, zapatos para aumentar el volumen de venta lo cual le dará mejores ganancias para poder hacer mejora a su vivienda.
texts.en:
El joven Jhonny de 29 años de edad, casado, reside en el barrio Riguero en la capital de Managua, el se caso a los 20 años el cual se ha dedicado a trabaja su esposa le tiene una hija de 9 años de edad, comenzó con la venta de ropa, pero luego decidió buscar un trabajo para tener un ingreso seguro y solo en tiempos libres seguir con la venta de ropa, trabaja como guarda de seguridad y las ventas la hace su esposa. Ha crecido en inventario gracias a los prestamos que Afodenic a otorgado es el segundo ciclo y esta sastifecho por lograr incrementar su inventario, con este préstamo comprara ropa, zapatos para aumentar el volumen de venta lo cual le dará mejores ganancias para poder hacer mejora a su vivienda. Jhonny is a young man of 29 years of age, living in the Riguero neighborhood in the capital, Managua. He married at 20 and began to work with his wife selling clothing. He has a 9-year old daughter. He soon decided to look for work where he would have a more secure income and now he only sells clothing in his spare time. He works as a security guard and his wife does the selling. His inventory has grown thanks to the loan that Afodenic has issued in the second cycle. He is content because with this loan he will buy clothing and shoes to increase sales. With the better earnings they will be able to live better.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes

loans.name: Anatolia

texts.en: A brave mother to her 6 siblings is Mrs. Anatolia L., 57 years of age, widow and a resident of Purok 3 Sta. Cruz, Tangub City. She engaged in sari-sari store business to support her siblings especially she is now the bread winner to her family. She opened this kind of business 4 years ago. Mostly her customers are her neighbors in that area. She is now earning an average net income of not less than P3,000.00. She joined PAGLAUM MPC under the PDP-LP Program last July 2008 because she is interested with our programs and services especially in our insurances and savings. She is now a 4th cycle loaner and applying an amount of P10,000.00 to add her capital to her existing sari-sari store business. She is very happy that she is an active member in our cooperative.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store business

location.town: Tangub-P3 Sta. Cruz, Tangub City, Mindanao

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has been repairing bicycles in Naivasha town for the past year.  Naivasha is a rural town, so bicycles are a popular means of transport. Hence, John saw the market for bicycle repairs. He is 31 years old, married to Eunice Njambi and has 2 school-age children. John was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a client of KADET. This will be his first loan and he is planning to stock his stand with spare parts for bicycle repair. In the near future, he hopes to move into a shop and to stop working from the roadside.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his bicycle repair business.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi de l’association Badenya est composé de femmes mariées de la ville de Tominian, région de Ségou quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles et ont en moyenne 31 ans et au moins  4 enfants.
Les femmes du groupe font la restauration et le petit commerce des produits divers  comme activités génératrices de revenus à Tominian il y’a environ 13 ans. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs activités, les membres du groupe Benkadi de l’association Badenya ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année et sont à leur premier prêt de groupe. 
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour la restauration et l’achat de produits divers.  Ces activités sont très rentables pour ces femmes qui effectuent leurs ventes au comptant, en détail et quelques à crédit. 
Les membres du groupe Benkadi comptent réaliser chacun un bénéfice mensuel de 10.000 FCFA à 15 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The group Benkadi of Badenya association is made up of married women of Tominian town, Segou region( fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).They live in traditionnal families and have average age of 31 years and at least 4 children. The women of this group do catering and petty trading of various products as income generating businesses in Tominian for about 13 years. Concerned about making profit on their businesses, the members of group Benkadi of Badenya association decided to be part of the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso this year and are on their first group loan. The current loan will be used for catering and the purchase of various products. These businesses are very profitable for these women who do their sales by retail for cash and sometimes on credit. The members of group Benkadi intend to make a monthly profit of 10 000FCFA to 15 000FCFA each which will be used for the repayment of the interest on the loan and the daily expenses of the family.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various items

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. sells fresh yams and maize in Elmina. Elizabeth has completed senior high school. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a tailor. Elizabeth has been selling fresh yams and maize since 2009. She helps her husband with the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize and yams for resale. She hopes to save and reinvest the new profits from her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize and yams for resale

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad S. is from the village of San Roque, Maramag, Bukidnon. She is 48 years old, single, and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Natividad owns & operates a business making & selling snacks such as hot cakes and bananas in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Natividad joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was very helpful in providing for the needs of her family. Natividad is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in her business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Natividad from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income and pay off her weekly loan obligations to HSPFI. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ndeye Sira

texts.fr:
Madame Ndeye Sira F. habite dans la zone de Yoff plus précisément dans la localité  de Ndeugagne.Elle est âgée  de 56 ans. Elle  est sociétaire de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC depuis Aout 2009.Elle n’a jamais bénéficié  de prêt dans l’institution. Seulement  Madame Ndeye Sira a longtemps séjourné  en Cote D’ivoire à Abidjan et est retournée  depuis quelques temps à Yoff. Actuellement elle est divorcée  et mère  de 4 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 23 et 37 ans. Elle  a choisi  l’activité de commerce par passion et  a démarré  avec la vente de riz à Abidjan. Actuellement elle s’est orientée  dans la vente de bouillie de mil localement appelée Fonde. Elle s’est adonne  a cette activité   surtout dans le but de réaliser  des bénéfices   et d’éviter  la dépendance  financière. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs .Une partie du financement c'est-à-dire  les  100 000 frs  sera destinée  a financer son activité .Son intention est   d’acheter les denrées  de base chez les grossistes a  des prix plus compétitifs  ce qui lui permettra de maximiser ses profits. Avec  l’autre partie du financement elle prévoit de  régler  les frais de scolarité de son enfant. Son  souhait est de parvenir à améliorer  les conditions de vie de sa famille.
Toujours dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les femmes dans l’exercice d’activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique   apprécié
texts.en:
Mrs. Ndeye Sira F. lives in the Yoff zone, more specifically in the town of Ndeugagne. She is 56-years-old. She has been a member of U-IMCEC since August 2009. She has never received a loan from this institution. Mrs. Ndeye Sira travelled to Abidjan on the Ivory Coast for a long time and has returned to Yoff. Now she is divorced and the mother of 4 children ranging from 23 to 37 years of age. She chose the trade industry as her passion and started selling rice in Abidjan. Now she sells porridge from the local mill which is called Fonde. She has devoted her time to this activity above all else with the intention of making profits and avoiding financial dependency.

She is asking for a loan of 200,000 frs. A part of this loan - 100,000 frs - will finance her work. She intends to buy basic foodstuffs from wholesale dealers at more competitive prices which will allow her to maximize her profits. With the other part of the loan, she would pay for her child's school expenses. Her wish is to improve the living conditions of her family.

Always looking to actively participate in the fight against poverty, U-IMCEC - with the positive support of lenders - succeeds in supporting women in revenue-generating activities which promote valuable socioeconomic development.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of Commercial Funds and Investments

loans.name: Jasmina Del Carmen

texts.es: Jasmina Del Carmen tiene 33 años. Ella dio inicio con su venta de refrescos hace más de 10 años. Y con la ayuda de los financiamientos ha logrado obtener nuevos productos para su negocio, ya que es una mujer que le gusta dedicarse a su negocio, ella se levanta muy temprano para realizar las tareas del hogar y dedicarse a sus hijos, es una madre muy responsable que le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que disfruta hablar con sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de frutas, bolsas, pajillas y azúcar. El mayor sueño de Jasmina es obtener un negocio como una pequeña distribuidora en donde ofrezca lo necesario.
texts.en:
Jasmina Del Carmen is 33 years old. She started her business selling beverages more than 10 years ago. With the help of financings, she has managed to obtain new products for her business. She is a woman who likes to pursue her business; she gets up very early to do chores and to care for her children. She is a very responsible mother who enjoys her work and talking to her customers. The loan that she requests is for working capital to buy fruit, bags, straws and sugar. Her biggest dream is to become a small distributor where she can offer all that is necessary for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy fruit, bags, straws and sugar

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta C. is from the village of Guinsiliban , Camiguin Province. She is 59 years old. Vicenta is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Vicenta owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Vicenta has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Vicenta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vicenta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Vicenta is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Vicenta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.en: Ousmane S., aged 29, runs a small metal workshop in the Medina Fall neighborhood of Thies. He has run the small “atelier” (workshop) since 2003, and says he enjoys the work. With the loan of 100,000 FCFA, Mr. S. will be able to purchase the materials to complete the work on five large metal doors currently in progress. These doors can take many weeks to complete, and are quite expensive. Mr. S. is married and the father of a two year old, but also supports his extended family. This is his third loan from U-IMCEC.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his metal workshop.

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
El comité “Santa Librada” se formó con la unión varias vecinas del barrio Santa Librada, de la ciudad de Villa Elisa.
 Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas. Las integrantes formaron un grupo  muy unido y capaz de realizar actividades en forma conjunta, ya que la mayoría de sus integrantes se dedican a la venta, siendo así la mayoría de ellas, colegas entre si..
Todas las integrantes del comité son madres que se dedican a dichas actividades con el fin de fortalecer la economía de la casa y desarrollar sus emprendimientos de manera sustentable. 
Así como la señora Florencia B. quien se dedica a la venta de ropa, esta actividad lo realiza de forma ambulante ya que las ventas no son tan buenas en el salón de su casa, ella visita a cada cliente para ofrecer sus productos. 
Se citan las actividades de cada una de las integrantes.
1
Marilina G.
Venta  de Quiniela

texts.en:
The group “Santa Librada” was formed by a group of neighbors from the Santa Librada neighborhood in the city of Villa Elisa. All the women in the group have their own independent businesses, such as sales. The members have formed a very united group capable of realizing activities together. The majority of the members work in sales as colleagues. All the members of the committee are mothers who work in their respective fields with the goal of strengthening their household budgets and building their businesses in a sustainable manner. Mrs. Florencia B. sells clothes for a living. She does so by traveling around the city. Because sales have not been that well from her home, she visits each customer to offer her products. Here are the activities of each of the members: 1. Marilina G., sports pool/lottery sales 2. Florencia B., clothes sales 3. Visitacion M., clothes sales 4. Ana Rosa C., baking 5. Ramona R., cosmetics sales 6. Nolberta V., sports pool/lottery sales 7. Yenny R., sports pool/lottery sales 8. Limpia C., beverage sales 9. Reina L., snack sales 10. Aurora R., coupon sales 11. Nilza R., baking 12. Hilaria C., clothes sales 13. Sonia L., food sales 14. Maria P., coupon sales 15. Nilda V., fruit sales

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying shirts, blouses, pants, and dresses

loans.name: Juana Cruz

texts.es:
Juana tiene 51 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el distrito D. Monsefú, ubicado a veinte minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. sombreros D. palma desD. hace 30 años. Ella compra la palma (un tipo D. junco) importada D. la ciudad D. Ecuador en el mismo distrito, y con ella teje los sombreros que después venD. en el mercado D. artesanía D. la ciudad D. Monsefú. El proceso D. elaboración es meticuloso y demora D. una a dos semanas.

Estos productos gozan D. mucha aceptación en la zona. No sólo los pobladores los compran sino que también son adquiridos por turistas nacionales e internacionales. La ciudad D. Monsefú es conocida por tener a los mejores artesanos D. la región.

Juana desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. más palma para elaborar más sombreros, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro D. su objetivo.

Ella es una madre D. familia trabajadora y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es hacer mejoras en su casa, ya que las lluvias que asolaron la zona norte hace algunas semanas han debilitado sus estructuras.
texts.en:
Juana is 51 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two children in the District of Monsefú, located 20 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

She has been manufacturing and selling palm leaf hats for 30 years. Juana buys imported palm leaf (a type of straw) in the city of Ecuador in the same district. She weaves the hats and sells them at the craft market in the city of Monsefú. The manufacturing process is meticulous and requires between 1-2 weeks. The products have become very popular in the area. Not only do residents buy them, but many are purchased by domestic and international tourists. The city of Monsefú is known for having the best craftspeople in the region.

Juana wants to expand her business buy purchasing more palm leaf for making hats. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN so that she can achieve her goal. She is a hardworking and responsible mother. Juana’s greatest wish is to make improvements to her home since the rains that have hit the northern part of the country a few weeks ago have weakened its structure.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase palm leaf for making hats

loans.name: Mfano Group

texts.en: Zainabu  C., 45, is  married with three children aged 22, 17 and 13. She has had a clothes shop for six years where she works from 6.30 am to 6pm daily, earning a monthly profit of about $104. This will be Zainabu’s first loan from Tujijenge, Tanzania. With it she hopes to open a general store. Zainabu will share the loan with her 17-member loan group, Mfano. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. Zainabu is second from the left in the first row, wearing a green dress.

loans.use: To  buy more clothing for her store

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna Y. is from the village of Southwestern Pob. Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Lorna is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Lorna owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lorna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lorna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Jessica Patricia

texts.es:
la sra. Jessica Patricia L. se dedica al comercio, tiene una pulperia la cual opera bajo el nombre de pulperia Marbely, tiene 1 año de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio, Jessica atiende personalmente a sus clientes, al igual ella misma lo administra y durante todo este tiempo se ve que lo ha manejado muy bien,  dicho negocio esta ubicado en la Aldea de Cifuentes Las Trojes carretera principal frente a bodega Cifuentes.                                                                     
En la actualidad, ella no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente para abastecer su negocio, y este negocio día a día va creciendo e igual el numero de clientes. es para eso que utilizara el credito para comprar mercaderia y surtir su pulperia.
texts.en:
Jessica Patricia L. is a businesswoman, she owns a local store which operates under the name Marbely Store. Jessica has been running the store for 1 year; she attends personally to her customers and manages the store well. The store is located in the village of Cifuentes Las Trojes, on the main road across from Cifuentes winery. Currently, Jessica doesn't have enough working capital to fully stock her business, which is growing day after day with new customers. She will use the loan to buy merchandise for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, lard, dairy products, sausages and meat.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 34-year-old farmer.  He has had experience in dairy farming for four years.  He is a member of Githiruini B self-help group whose members are farmers.  He is dedicated to the group because he gets an opportunity to share ideas with fellow members and save money on weekly basis.  In addition, the group members also guarantee each other's loans.  He has requested a loan of Kes. 20,000 from Faulu Kenya. He wants to use this loan to buy a dairy cow.  He hopes to stabilize his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Avelino's Group

texts.en:
Avelino B. is from the village of Ballacong and is the group leader of a six member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Avelino B..

Avelino is 47 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Avelino owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling rice in the local community. Avelino has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 25000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Avelino joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Avelino has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from ASKI. Avelino is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Avelino from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy T. D. was born in 1965. She lives in Luong Quy village with her two daughters. She raises four hundred chickens and 20 pigs. Now, she copes with many difficulties because the price of food for poultry is expensive and her profits are low. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND). She has participaid in SEDA since 2005 and repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 2,834,000 VND to buy food for chicken and pigs.

loans.use: chicken and pig feed

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
El   Sr. Edgar   está acompañado, el   se dedica a la venta de repuestos para motos, cubierta de auto para  moto  y llantas cuya venta le genera  un buen ingreso.
Con la ayuda de su esposa  están  saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y dedicación.
Hoy día el es una microempresario exitoso con  mucha  clientela, debido a su buen trato.
Ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta en sus compromisos, y solicita el préstamo para la compra de cubiertas y respuestas para motos.
texts.en:
Sr. Edgar is married. He is engaged in the sale of spare parts and covers for motorcycles and tires. This business generates a good income. With the help of his wife they are getting ahead with a lot of sacrifice and dedication.

At present, due to his hard work, he is a successful small businessperson with a lot of customers. He has shown himself to be a responsible and honest person who meets his obligations. He is applying for the loan in order to buy covers and spare parts for motorcycles.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of covers and spare parts for motorcycles.

loans.name: Gloria Luzmila

texts.es:
Gloria Luzmila R. R. tiene 20 años.  Es soltera y vive con sus padres, en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

Gloria es una socia de la ventanilla rural Patrón San Juan, que está ubicada a media hora de Guaranda. Son 16 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a cultivos de papas y maíz. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Gloria trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando papas. Realiza sus compras y sus ventas cada 2 meses en Guaranda.
Solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas, abonos y fertilizantes para cultivar papas. Piensa que este crédito le ayudara a trabajar bien. Quisiera trabajar más y ayudar a su familia. 

Le gusta limpiar la casa.
texts.en:
Gloria Luzmila R. R., 20, is single and lives with her parents in Guaranda canton, Bolívar province. Gloria is a member of the Patrón San Juan communal bank located half an hour from Guaranda. It has a total of 16 members most of whom are potato and corn farmers. This is their first loan request from Cooperativa San José. Gloria farms potatoes. She makes her purchases and her sales every two months in Guaranda. She is asking for funds to buy seed, manure and fertilizers for her potato crops. She feels the loan will help her work well. She’d like to work more and help her family. She enjoys cleaning the house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed, manure and fertilizers for her potato crops.

loans.name: Mateo Luis

texts.es: Mateo es de 29 años de edad, es soltero, se dedica a la carpintería fabricación de muebles, lo que le ha ayudado para sufragar sus gastos familiares, en la actividad tiene aproximadamente seis años de experiencia, solicita su primer crédito para incrementar su capital de trabajo, compra de madera, sus referencias personales indican que es una persona responsable y trabajador.
texts.en:
Mateo is 29 years old and single. He works as a carpenter and manufactures furniture in order to help his family cover their expenses. Mateo has approximately six years of experience in this business.

He is requesting his first loan so that he can increase his operating capital for purchasing wood. His personal references indicate that he is a responsible and hardworking person.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo M. is from the town of Villa Marzo, Cordon. He is 34 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, he plants and harvests rice to sell. He has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately $580 per harvest for these activities.

In 2009, Romeo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Romeo is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be his 3rd loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Meas N., 59, is married and lives with two of her children in Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US $2 each day and are supported by two children working in a garment factory. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Meas N. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase fertilizer and a motorbike for her family’s transportation. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and a motorbike.

loans.name: Aku Justine

texts.fr: A. est une dame mariée et mère de 2 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier de wonyémé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de lomé. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes et de produits cosmétiques. elle a commencé ce commerce en 2000. Sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. son stock de pagnes est en baisse, elle voudrait se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 6 pièces de pagnes hollande et divers autres qualités de pagnes
texts.en:
Mrs. A. is married and the mother of two children. She lives with her family in the Wonyéme district, one of the peripheral areas of the city of Lomé. She makes a living by selling “pagnes” [traditional colorful fabric] and cosmetic person. Her customer base is very diverse. As she is running low on “pagnes”, she would like to restock, which is why she is seeking a loan from WAGES in order to purchase six sets of [high-quality] Holland “pagnes” as well as other "pagnes" of various quality grades

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing traditional "pagnes" fabric

loans.name: Felista Mokami

texts.en:
Felista Mokami M. is 61 years old and she supports seven members of her family.
She has operated a quarry for the last seven years. This business has been successful due to demand from local customers, who buy building stones for building rental houses in the developing estates of Narok.
She learned about KADET LTD from KADET staff marketing awareness efforts in her area. This will be her first loan. She is planning to use the money to hire more people at the quarry in order to increase her output.

Her future dream is to buy modern machines and own a bigger quarry. 
She is a hardworking woman and determined to achieve her set target.

loans.use: To spend Ksh 20,000 to hire more people to increase quarry output.

loans.name: Luzminda Erojo Group

texts.en:
Luzminda E. is from the village of Adorable, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Luzminda is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Luzminda E. Group.

Luzminda is married and has 3 school-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for sale. Luzminda has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Luzminda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Luzminda is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Luzminda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies

loans.name: Selina

texts.en: Selina K. is currently in the business of selling cooking oil and tomatoes at home and is requesting a loan to stock more jerrycans of cooking oil to sell. Selina is 35 years old and is married with a husband that is a police man. She has 6 children and 3 of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a house for her family.

loans.use: To stock more jerrycans of cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Gladys Adjoa Safia

texts.en:
Gladys Adjoa Safia C. sells raw gari and maize at Elmina. Gladys is married and has four children. Her husband is a mechanic. Gladys has been in this trade for some time now. She assists her husband in providing the basic needs of the family, such as food, shelter and clothing. Her loan will be used to buy more gari and maize to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to educate her children.

In this photo, Gladys is displaying the maize she sells.

loans.use: To buy more gari and maize to sell.

loans.name: Good Luck Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Good Luck” group from Waterloo, a small town near Freetown where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are small-businesswomen who have come to SMT – also a partner of Kiva – in order to seek a loan of SLL 600,000 for each member of the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profits, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Salamatu S.. Salamatu was born in Makeni city about fifty-five years ago. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a driver and her children are no longer attending school. Salamatu sells both fresh and dried fish. She has been a businesswoman for twenty years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy cartons of fresh fish to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy cartons of fresh fish to add to her business

loans.name: Hagobe

texts.ar:
هاكوب  اعزب يعمل حدادة وبويا السيارات له في مصلحته اكثر من 5 سنوات هاكوب عمره 
32 سنة طموح ويتميز في محيطه بالعمل الجيد والسمعة الكريمة فهو دائم العمل والتطور له تاريخ مشجع مع المجموعة
وقد استفاد كثيرا من القرض السابق حيث وسع المصلحة يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء عدة جديدة
وشراء سيارة قديمة لللتجارة بها زبائنه هم من جيرانه واصدقائه
texts.en: Hagobe is a 32-year-old single man with more than five years experience working in an automotive bodyshop, his customers coming from friends and neighbors. He is always busy working and pushing himself to improve. Hagobe has an encouraging history with Al Majmoua, and he very much benefited from a previous loan which allowed him to expand his business. He is now seeking another loan to purchase new equipment as well as a used car which he can resell.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment and a used car

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita A., age 32, owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop in the village of Sto. Niño, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon, where she lives. Her shop offers daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, and snack foods. Juanita has been engaged in her business for over five years and it brings her approximately 6,000 PHP a month. Juanita and her husband have three school-aged children.

Earlier this year, Juanita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Juanita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and was employed as working capital. Juanita is requesting a second loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase biscuits, beverages, and other additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase biscuits, beverages, and other additional products to sell

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 51 años, vive en casa de su padre, al lado de  su pareja  y sus 2 hijos;  juntos se esfuerzan cada día para salir adelante.El trabajo de esta laboriosa mujer, es el tejido de tapetes a crochet y también se dedica al  bordado de polos y chompas, que los realiza en su casa luego de terminar con sus labores domésticas, y ya tiene 20 años realizando esta actividad que tanto le apasiona. Asimismo, vende productos de belleza desde hace unos años, y le va muy bien, ya que gracias a las campañas  y las ofertas por navidad  pudo capitalizar mejores ganancias, por lo que se siente muy satisfecha. Pero lo que más le gusta realizar, son sus tejidos y bordados, ya que no le resulta nada trabajoso, además lo realiza  en la comodidad de su casa. Para mas adelante, tiene el anhelo de instalar un bazar en un ambiente de su casa, de ese modo desea mostrar los tejidos y bordados que realiza.Es el  7mo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y se compromete una vez mas de pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues  le han permitido crecer y captar mayores utilidades.Carmen tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de  diversidad de hilos y una vitrina, en donde acomodara  todos sus trabajos, de esta manera espera seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Carmen, aged 51, lives in her father's house, along with her husband and her 2 children. Together they struggle daily to get ahead. The efforts of this hard-working woman involve embroidering tablecloths and crocheting, and she also embroiders polo shirts and sweaters in her home, after completing her domestic chores. For 20 years she has done this work which she passionately loves.

At the same time, for several years, Carmen has sold  beauty products and it's going very well. Thanks to the campaigns and offers of the Christmas season, she was able to capture better earnings for which she feels very content. But what she most likes to do is her sewing and embroidery which are not so labor-intensive and can be done at home.

In the future, Carmen hopes to install a store in her home, enabling her to display her creations and embroidery.

This is Carmen's 7th loan with MFP, and she promises once again to make her payments punctually, since past loans have permitted her business to grow and capture greater profits.  Carmen plans to invest the money in the purchase of diverse threads and a glass showcase that can hold all her work.  In this manner, she hopes to continue progressing.

loans.use: TO BUY MATERIALS AND A DISPLAY CASE FOR HER EMBROIDERY BUSINESS

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo S. is from the village of Aurora. He is 47 years old. Pablo is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Pablo plants and harvests rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $158 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Pablo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his 1st loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Roger Antonio

texts.es: Este señor es maestro del instituto señor de esquipulas de telica, donde labora desde el año 2007, con 4 años de desempeñar dicha labor, es casado , originario del poblado de san jacinto a unos 6 kilometros del poblado de telica, sus padres son agricultores de la zona, esfuerzos que le dieron para la superacion academica que hoy obstenta y que le permite tener otro nivel de vida, ya que con la empresa es el Segundo financiamientio que recibe, y que le han ayudado a mejorar las condiciones de vida, fruto ya  de su esfuerzo, y que lo esta aprovechando con el apoyo de los financiamientos  pequeños de acuerdo a su capacidad de pago.
texts.en:
This gentleman is a teacher at Señor de Esquipulas School in Telica.  He has been in his job for 4 years, since 2007.  He is married and from the town of San Jacinto, 6 kilometers from the town of Telica.  His parents are local farmers who worked hard so that he could improve himself academically.  This has enabled him to enjoy a better standard of living.

This is his second loan.  Through his previous loan, and his hard work, he has been able to improve his living conditions.  He is taking advantage of the support of these small loans which are given in accordance with his ability to repay.

loans.use: To buy beams, bricks and cement

loans.name: Yenni

texts.en: Yenni is 32 years old and has a live-in partner and two children at home. She has been selling groceries from her home for the past 10 years. She will be using her loan of 1,500 PEN to purchase supplies for her store, such as rice, sugar, oil and milk. Yenni has been a member of FINCA Peru for 4 years and is a member of the communal bank "Nobleza".

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, oil, milk for grocery store

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo B. is from the village of Luyang Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 55 years old. Danilo is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Danilo owns & operates a business selling fruits and vegetables. Danilo has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Danilo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Danilo is requesting a loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand his product offering. This loan will be his 1st loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios P. is from the village of Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Mis. Occ. She is 58 years old. Remedios is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Remedios owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling food products in the local community. Remedios is just starting this business. In 2008, Remedios joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remedios has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Remedios is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase canned goods, noodles, sugar, milk, and coffee to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Remedios from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, sugar, milk, and coffee to sell

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca, de 53 años, es una madre de familia que ama los cultivos, ella está casada con Luis de 64 años, ambos tienen un hijo Jarol de 33 años, con quien vive en su casa propia ubicada a las afueras de la ciudad de San Ramón (selva central peruana). Mientras que su esposo labora como mecánico de aviación, ella, desde hace 16 años cuida con mucho amor sus cultivos de frutas cítricas, café y plátanos, con la contratación de operarios, quienes dejan limpios sus plantaciones.  A Francisca, le gusta cosechar sus productos porque en ellos observa que valió la pena los esfuerzos realizados, además como algunos terrenos están cerca cosecha principalmente sus naranjas para consumo, por otro lado, cuenta que le resulta difícil encajonarlos para comercializarlos a los acopiadores de su ciudad o a los mayoristas del mercado, porque le conviene venderlos en las mismas chacras, asegura que gracias a la agricultura tiene su casa propia, terrenos y puede vivir sin preocupaciones, pero también , es conciente de que más adelante se limitará a arrendar sus tierras, por eso como cuenta con un espacio en su domicilio, piensa instalar una bodega muy bien surtida de productos comestibles. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las brisas”, y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, y como presidente de la junta directiva de su grupo, hace respetar los acuerdos tomados en las reuniones, de igual manera las normas de su reglamento interno, y como todos los socios son responsables, le agrada laborar con ellos. Francisca, muy pronto comenzará la cosecha de café, por ello con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico, que esparcirá sobre sus cultivos para nivelar la producción, y así pueda obtener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Francisca is 53 years old and a mother who loves to farm.  She is married to 64 year old, Luis and they have one son, 33 year old Jarol, who lives in his own home in San Ramón (central jungle of Peru).  Meanwhile, while her husband does his job as an aviation mechanic, she cares for her crops, as she has been doing for 16 years.  These include citrus fruits, coffee, and bananas and she works with the help of paid farmhands.  She likes to harvest because it’s there where she can see the value of her efforts.  Some of the farmland is close by and she primarily harvests her oranges to eat.  It doesn’t pay for her to harvest them, package them up sell them to the distributers in the market, it’s better for her to sell them right from the orchard.

She tells us that she has her own home and land because of her farming.  She is able to live without any concerns, but she knows that she will eventually not be able to care for her land anymore, so she has set aside some space in her home to set up a little grocery store.  She is a member of the “Las Brisas” communal bank and this will be her eighth loan through MFP.  As the group’s president, she ensures that the members meet their commitments.  Like the others, she is very responsible and she likes working with everyone.  Francisca will soon begin harvesting the coffee and she will use the money from this loan to buy sacks of organic fertilizer that she will spread to even out her production and be able to have a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Emmalyn

texts.en:
Emmalyn A. is from the village of Taglimao, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 33 years old. Emmalyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Emmalyn owns & operates a business venture in the food sector butchering and selling meat in the market. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from butchering & selling pork and poultry meat in the market. Emmalyn has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month for these activities.

In 2010, Emmalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Emmalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional meat & working capital. Emmalyn is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional pork and poultry meat. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Emmalyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional pork and poultry meat.

location.town: Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Melchora C. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 47 years old. Melchora is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Melchora owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling seafood products  including fish like sardines, mackerel & milkfish in the local community. Melchora has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Melchora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melchora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Melchora is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish like sardines & milkfish. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Melchora from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish like sardines & milkfish.

loans.name: Cristo El Salvador Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Ana María es una emprendedora innata y posee un carisma que hace fácil su trato con ella. Por ello las socias de su grupo la eligieron como presidenta. Ella pertenece a la Alcancía Comunal “Cristo el Salvador” y precisamente fue Ana María quien sugirió el nombre por tratarse de una persona creyente.
Ana María se dedica a la confección de mochilas y maletas para hombres y mujeres, cuenta con varios trabajadores que le permiten cubrir el stock de pedidos. Inicialmente Ana María vendía mochilas en una galería, allí conoció a su esposo quien se dedicaba a la fabricación de armazones para mochila y de allí nació la idea. Ana maría era confeccionista y tenía una gran capacidad para la venta. Su esposo fabricaría los armazones y ella elaboraría las mochilas. Fue una idea de conjunto y les es muy rentable. Son muy conocidos en su zona como “la que hace mochilas”. 
Ana María tiene un sueño, y es abrir una tienda propia donde pueda ofrecer sus propias marcas y expandirse en otro tipo de confección.
texts.en:
Ana María is a born entrepreneur and has charisma which makes her easy to get on with.  For this reason, the members of her group chose her as their group president.  She belongs to the "Cristo el Salvador" (Christ the Savior) community bank and it was Ana María herself who suggested the group's name because she is a believer.

Ana María's business is making backpacks and suitcases for men and women.  She has several workers who make it possible to complete all her orders.  Initially, Ana María sold backpacks in a shopping mall.  There she met her husband who made backpack frames and that was how the idea came about.  Ana María was a seamstress with a great ability for making sales.  Her husband would make the frames and she would make the backpacks.  It was a joint idea and a very profitable one.  Ana María and her husband are very well known in their area as "the couple that makes backpacks".

Ana María has a dream which is to open her own store where she can sell her own brands and expand into another type of production.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making backpacks

loans.name: Ana Elba

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 25 y 16 años de edad, Ana se dedica a la sastrería, ella ingreso a una escuela de corte y confección luego decidió instalar su propio taller de sastrería, lo atiende desde las 6:00am a 7:00pm.
Actualmente ella necesita dar mantenimiento a las maquinas de costura, para lo que solicita un préstamo que le cubra el gasto y poder tener las maquinas en perfectas condiciones.
El objetivo de Ana es tener todo su taller en buenas condiciones, las maquinas y demás herramientas, para ofrecer un buen servicio a los clientes.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband and their two children, who are 25 and 16 years old. Ana is a seamstress. She studied tailoring and then decided to set up her own business, which she runs from 6 in the morning till 7 in the evening.
Ana currently needs to do some maintenance on her sewing machines, and she's requesting a loan to cover the expense so her machines will be in perfect working order.
Ana's goal is to have her whole workshop in good condition, the machines and all her other tools, so she can offer her customers great service.

loans.use: to pay for maintaining her sewing machines.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 48-year-old married woman with five children between the ages of 9 and 31.  She earns a living by selling cereals, a business she has been operating for only one year.  Lucy gets some of the cereals she sells from her farm.  Previously, she operated a cafeteria for a living.  

Lucy has learned how to save her money through Faulu Kenya.  This has helped her to manage her finances well.  She has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy rice and beans.  In the future, Lucy hopes to become a major supplier of cereals in her local community.

loans.use: To buy rice and beans.

loans.name: Jose Donato

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CRISTO ASENCION DE RUMICHACA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de URUBAMBA, perteneciente a la provincia de URUBAMBA y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Jose Donato; el tiene 29 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, el hace servicio de taxi en las  diferentes calles de la ciudad de Urubamba, el socio trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m y también el socio quiere abrir un negocio de tienda de abarrotes para que su esposa atienda este negocio, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de transporte y también implementar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, leche y fideos.  
                                              
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Jose Donato belongs to the Cristo Asencion de Rumichaca Communal Bank.  The bank is in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Jose Donato is 29, married, and has one child.  He alternates his daily activities with his transportation business.  He drives a taxi on the different streets in the city of Urubamba.  He works from 6:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m.  He also wants to open a grocery store business.  His wife will attend to this business.

He wants to expand and improve his transportation business.  He also wants to set up the grocery store business.

He is requesting a loan to buy products like rice, sugar, milk, and noodles for the grocery store.

He is happy about the loan, and he pledges to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy products like rice, sugar, milk, and noodles for the grocery store.

loans.name: 84 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuỷ operates a food stall selling vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables to resell.

Thuỷ is 41 years old and married with two children. Thuỷ is the group leader of the 84 Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of three members. Thuỷ lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thuỷ's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Thuỷ has been involved in this business for three years. The main hardship that Thuỷ faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Thuỷ hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Felistar

texts.en:
Felistar, 36, is a hardworking and ambitious business woman. She is single and has no children. Since 2004, she has been operating a salon to make a living. She makes extra income by engaging in farming activities. Previously, she sold groceries. In the next five years, she would like to have a big salon. Her dream is to own a beauty and therapy school.

Felistar is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a dairy cow. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.
