loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with four children. Three of her children attend school while one is still young for school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is competition from other tailors in the area. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials, zip, buttons and threads. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth, zippers, buttons and thread.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty, who lives in Kampala, Uganda, is a married mother of six children, five of whom go to school. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expense includes school fees.

For the last 10 years, Resty has been selling tomatoes and matooke (plantains) seven days a week in a shop. Her other source of income is the selling of piped water from home.

Resty has requested a loan of 200000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bananas and boxes of tomatoes. Her business challenges includes the rainy season and defaulters, and her goals are to educate her children to university level and expand her business into a wholesale operation.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and boxes of tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: William Alonso

texts.es:
William, tiene cincuenta y dos años de edad, es casado y con tres  hijos pero solo dos  dependen actualmente de el y estos se encuentran en edad escolar.
William acude a las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un préstamo para el mejoramiento de  su vivienda, por lo  que este préstamo será utilizado en la compra de materiales de construcción para reparar el techo de su casa de habitación ya que este se encuentra en mal estado y para la compra de cinco metros de cerámica para ponerle al baño.
Todo esto es para que su familia goce de mejores condiciones de una vivienda.
texts.en:
Wiliam is fifty-two years old and married with three children but only two currently depend on him as they are at school age.

William came to the offices of Ceprodel to request a loan to improve his home. This loan will be used to buy building materials to repair the roof of one of the rooms in his house since it is in bad shape. It will also be used to buy five meters of tiles to add to his bathroom.

This is all so that his family enjoys a better home.

loans.use: to buy building materials to improve the roof of his home and to buy five meters of tiles.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a grocery selling business, selling at retail to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. Her major dream is to expand and meet her customers' needs. 

With the 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of vegetables, fruits, tomatoes and potatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of vegetables, fruits, tomatoes and potatoes

loans.name: Adel

texts.en: Adel is a 30-year-old single man from Lebanon living with his parents. He has been working at the Internal Security Forces since 2004. In parallel, since 2005, he has been working in computer repair in order to get a higher income and better support his family. With the requested loan of $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to purchase a car which will help him with transportation to facilitate his work especially since he serves customers located in different places and areas. In the future, Adel hopes to open his own computer shop.

loans.use: to purchase a car which will help him with transportation to customers

loans.name: Vasya

texts.ru: Вася просит выдать ему кредит на приобретение дополнительных рыбацких снастей для приближающегося зимнего сезона. Он хочет приобрести снасти, необходимые для зимней рыбалки, чтобы удовлетворить возрастающий спрос рыбаков. Предыдущий кредит был потрачен на увеличение товарного запаса и помог Васе открыть еще одну торговую точку на рынке. Вася - сам заядлый рыбак, поэтому ему очень нравится его бизнес и он намерен развивать его дальше.
texts.en: Vasya is requesting this loan for the purchase of additional fishing gear for the upcoming winter season.  He wants to buy gear, necessary for the winter fishing, in order to satisfy the increasing demand of fishermen.  The previous loan was spent on increasing merchandise inventories and helped Vasya to open one more retail outlet at the market.  Vasya himself is an avid fisherman, and this is why he loves his business very much, and intends to develop it further.

loans.use: to expand an assortment of gear for winter fishing

loans.name: Jose Octavio

texts.es:
José de 38 años, un hombre que empezó como comerciante por necesidad y falta de estudios que le impide conseguir trabajo en empresas.
Es comerciante minorista, vende artículos según la temperada.
Su actividad lo realiza solo, trabajaba de todos los días de la semana, inicia a las 8:00am hasta las 18:00pm.
Su dificultad es la delincuencia. Está casado, su esposa es ama de casa.
Tiene 4 hijos, uno de 3, 14, 18, 21, los dos adultos trabajan y los dos menores estudian en pública.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería como: papel higiénico, cepillos, lavacaras, etc.
Ya que con el préstamo anterior pudo invertir en el negocio y también pido hacer las paredes de su vivienda. 
Su sueño es terminar la construcción de su vivienda, le falta el piso y el portal.
texts.en:
When he was 38 years old, José started working as a merchant out of necessity because his lack of education prevented him from getting a company job. He is an informal merchant, selling products based on the season. José works alone every day of the week. He starts at 8am and finishes at 6pm.

The difficulty he must face is crime. José is married and his wife is a homemaker. They have four children (ages 3, 14, 18, and 21). The two adult children are working and the two younger children are in school.

José is requesting a loan to buy toilet paper, toothbrushes, wash basins, and other items. His previous loan was invested in his business, but he was also able to put up the walls in his house.

His dream is to finish the construction of his house, which lacks a floor and an entryway.

loans.use: to buy toilet paper, toothbrushes, wash basins, and other items.

loans.name: Philgone

texts.en: Philgone is 37 years old, married, and blessed with five children.  She runs a pharmacy so as to earn a living.  She has been in the business for six years.  She has employed one person in the business.  She also relies on her husband for financial support. Her desire is to expand her business in five years.  She has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy medicine.

loans.use: To buy medicine.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Juana Maria comenta que necesita remodelar dos cuartos de madera que tiene y están en malas condiciones, quiere anticipar con la remodelación antes de que llegue la temporada de inverno.
Doña Juana Maria es empleada desde hace dos años en una maquiladora desempeñándose como trabajadora de producción, con el ingreso que recibe ha podido apoyar a sus papas con los gastos familiares y con el cual planea pagar el crédito. 
Desea la seguridad y protección de sus padres y que puedan evitar enfermedades.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana Maria says that she needs to renovate two rooms in her wooden house that are in bad condition. She wants to complete the renovations before the winter season arrives.

Doña Juana Maria has been employed for two years at a factory, where she works on a production line. The income that she earns enables her to help her parents with the family expenses and she will use some of that money to repay this loan.

Juana Maria desires to have security and protection for her parents so that they can avoid getting sick.

loans.use: to replace the ceiling on two rooms of her house.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 3 children.

Rogelio has a shop that makes and sells bamboo sun breakers (blinds). He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy materials needed in making bamboo sun breakers.

Rogelio has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rogelio hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed in making bamboo sun breakers

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es:
Dedicada a la venta de mercancía tal como jeans, camisetas y ropa interior para dama y caballero, por su necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos y darle estudio a sus tres hijos, Luz Dary confía en que consiguiendo mucha más mercancía con el crédito obtenido podrá ampliar sus ganancias y mejorar su condición de vida y la de sus hijos. 

Sueña con tener su propio local para vender mercancía en su vereda y en lo posible poder ir a los municipios cercanos para hacer negocios más grandes con algunos almacenes que compren la mercancía más barata y así aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Luz Dary works selling jeans, shirts, and ladies and men's underwear out of her need to generate her own income and pay for her three children's education.  Luz Dary trusts that she will be able to get much more merchandise with the loan, and will be able to increase her earnings and improve her living conditions and those of her children.

She dreams of having her own premises where she can sell merchandise on her own sidewalk, and where possible, to be able to go to the nearby towns to do bigger business with some of the stores that purchase cheap merchandise, and in this way grow her income.

loans.use: to purchase clothes like men and women's underwear

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is a 40-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in farming for 15 years. Florita primarily grows rice crops to sell. She has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Florita hopes that this loan will help to increase her harvest.

In the future, Florita hopes to own a bigger farm. She also desires for her family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa sells kenkey (maize dumplings often used in soups) at Efutu. She has been selling kenkey for five years.  

Adjoa is a widow who has four children. As a single parent, she uses her income to feed, cloth and pay the school fees of her children. 

Adjoa needs this loan to purchase bulk maize to prepare the kenkey for sale. 

With the new profit, Adjoa wishes to give her children the best education.

loans.use: purchase bulk maize to prepare the kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 27 years old.  He is married to Leah and together they have two children.  He has been operating a barber shop for two years and earns a monthly income of 6,000 KES.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET in the amount of 15,000 KES, which he will use to buy another shaving machine.  With the anticipated profit, he plans to expand his business and educate his children.

His hopes and dreams are to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy a new shaving machine.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en: Genoveva is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. Genoveva has operated a shop for 2 years, selling clothing such as t-shirts and blouses. She has requested a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy clothing to sell. In the future, Genoveva hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Djekafo I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe DJEKAFO I sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et  en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Zanfina, un des villages de la commune de Konobougou,  préfecture de Barouéli, région de Ségou, 4ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le mil, l’arachide et le fonio. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, DAYE première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana,  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 125 000F CFA environs par campagne.

loans.use: Labour, semence, engrais, herbicide, sarclage et petits équipements

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of five group leader of farmers in Kakamega North district, with Grace selected as the Kiva representative. Grace has volunteered to be the Kiva's group representative, and is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her and the 56 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here, but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.
							
Grace is a reliable member of the community. She is married with nine children. Grace is 53 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last two years to support her family. In addition to this, Grace is very active in her community and involved in the women's group and savings group. She described her harvest last year as excellent. She hopes as a One Acre Fund farmer, to be able to join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers who have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program!

Grace joined One Acre Fund in 2012, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader. Grace joined One Acre Fund so that she can get the best seed prices, new farming methods, and fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and earn enough to feed her family. Because she likes being a leader and an active community member, she wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. Grace has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva's representative. Working with One Acre Fund has improved Grace's life because she has more profits from harvest and more farm group support, and was able to save money and feed the family. In the future, Grace hopes that her profits from 2014 can be used to send children to school, save for the future, and invest in a business.
  							
Grace and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay Kiva's loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizers when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.
							
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizers for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 28 años, está casada y tiene un hijo con quien vive en su casa propia. Nancy se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 9 años cultivando cacao orgánico siendo su principal fuente de ingreso. Posee un terreno en el cual trabaja con bastante esmero. Alrededor de sus terrenos podemos hallar plantaciones de cacao orgánico y barbasco los cuales vende a los compradores zonales por ser productos  con mucha demanda. Para desempeñar las tareas complicadas contrata a  trabajadores del lugar logrando recuperar su inversión a fin de campaña.
En ocasiones a tenido que lidiar con inconvenientes por parte de enfermedades que afectan sus plantaciones así como plagas que perjudican su producción e incrementando el capital necesario para realizar su trabajo.
Se siente muy orgullosa por brindarle a su hijo una buena educación esperando lograr que sea una persona exitosa con el futuro. Es el tercer préstamo que solicita a su entidad financiera y se agrada por la oportunidad que le brindan. Desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles e invertirlos en el mantenimiento de su terreno con la compra de abono orgánico y adquisición de herramientas.

loans.use: Compra de abono orgánico y herramientas de cultivo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to have an eye surgery

loans.name: Put's Group

texts.en: Put, 48, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province and a mother of five children. Nowadays, she needs to support on four children and three of whom are still in school. She is growing rice and works as a labor for others to get income to support on her living condition for 10 years. She did not get good yield from her rice farm because it have destroyed from insects. This is first time for Put with VisionFund and she leads a group of three to apply this new loan. As the group leader, she will manage her entire loan portion to purchase fertilizer and rice seed to improve on her rice farming. She hopes that her farmland can produce her more yields than last year, so she can earn more income to upgrade her living condition and support on her children’s education as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and rice seed to improve on her rice farming.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: I am 26 years old, married with three children. I have been selling vegetables in Mukuyu Market for the last four years. As i worked, i faced different challeges in raising enough money to support my family. Also, the little that i saved, it could not last long.I joined a women group which assisted me to save some money with it, which later would be lent to some one. I have used three small loans from this group, the first one was USD.60, then,USD 165 and USD 225. I paid all these loans promptly and i hope to get another to push me forward. I have been able to send my children to school and look forward to a better life.

loans.use: She wants to include a variety of vegetables and rice to her current stock.Currenly she sells tomatoes,spinnach and onions,thus she hopes if she adds others and rice,she will be able to tap more customers who bypass her stall because of not having these food stuffs.

loans.name: Nijat

texts.en:
Nijat is n Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli. He is 32 years old and has one child. He is a driver on public transport. He began his business 19 years ago and it has allowed him to support his family. In 2004 he borrowed $800 from Normicro to repair the motor of his car. His minibus is old and he plans to sell it and to buy a new minibus.
Nijat has applied for a loan amount of $1000 to buy a new minibus.

loans.use: To buy a new minibus

loans.name: Thuo

texts.en: Thuo N. is 28 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 3 children.  Her husband is a mechanic and earns nearly $7/day.  This loan will be used to purchase a motorbike for taking their children to school, as well as to rent out when they are not in need of it.  Thuo N. hopes to build a concrete home and see her children finish high school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for transportation and rental

loans.name: Benito

texts.en:
Benito lives in the Las Lomas neighborhood in the west side of La Paz. He produces men's shoes with a partner, which he sells to wholesalers that subsequently export them to Perú.

In the year 2002, Benito was one of the victims of a landslide on his property, which caused him to lose his existing house. Only a single room was left standing, and Mr. M. was forced to live rented during this time. Currently, the local government has given him permission to rebuild.

The loan that he requests is to do the basic construction of three rooms using brick.

This is the fourth time that he requests a loan. His payment history with IMPRO shows that the payments were made on time and in their entirety, which indicates that he can honor his credit obligations. This loan will be extended by through our program for housing and home improvement, under the section "construction".

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Benito es vecino de la zona de las Lomas, ladera Oeste de la Ciudad de la Paz. El se dedica a la elaboración de calzados de varón y tiene un socio; el producto se vende a comerciantes mayoristas que luego lo exportan al Perú.

Benito en el año 2002 fue uno de los damnificados de deslizamiento en el terreno de su propiedad y perdió la construcción existente, quedando solo una habitación y obligando al señor M. a vivir en alquiler durante ese tiempo; actualmente el gobierno municipal le dio la autorización para poder construir nuevamente.

El crédito que solicita es para la construcción en obra gruesa de tres habitaciones de ladrillo.

Esta es la cuarta ocasión que solicita un crédito y los antecedentes históricos con Impro demuestran que los pagos fueron realizados en su totalidad y puntualmente, lo cual indica que puede honrar sus obligaciones crediticias. Este crédito se canaliza a través de nuestra línea de vivienda y mejora de hábitat, dentro del rubro de construcción.

loans.use: construction of 3 rooms

loans.name: Miriam Michelle

texts.en: Miriam Michelle S.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy all his raw material

loans.name: Bisi

texts.en: Bisi O. is 31 years old, married, and has 2 children. She has a store in the market where she sells kitchen equipment and has been in business since 1997. She needs the loan of US$800 to buy more kitchen equipment for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more kitchen equipment for sale

loans.name: Xiomara

texts.es:
Xiomara works buying and selling lottery tickets. She has her regular clients but does most of her sales selling from her sales post. She has worked in her lottery business for 21 years. She started out with $1000 borrowed from a local money lender at a monthly interest rate of 20%, which was a very expensive way to start her business.

She started her business on the corner of Banco in León with a basket of sweets. At the same time she sold lottery tickets out of doors throughout the city. Currently her sales post is located on the principal street of León in a visible location.

Xiomara is an enterprising single mother who fights to get ahead. She has 3 children, all of whom are currently in school, 2 in secondary school, thanks to Xiomara's daily sacrifice to support the family on her own.

Ceprodel has given Xiomara wonderful support with financial help for 3 years with 16 loans. The loans have given Xiomara the opportunity to buy a larger quantity of lottery tickets to sell and as a result, to provide the necessities to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica la señora Xiomara es a la actividad económica de la compra y venta de lotería teniendo sus clientes fijos pero siendo su mejor anhelo vender en su puesto de venta.

La señora Xiomara Tiene 21 años de tener el negocio iniciando con un capital de C$1.000.00 producto de un préstamo a un prestamista al 20% mensual, que por cierto fue muy costoso.

Comenzó su negocio en la esquina del Banco en León con una canasta de caramelos y a la vez vendía lotería a la intemperie por todos los sectores del mercado. Actualmente está ubicada en la calle principal en un punto de venta visible.

Es madre soltera, luchadora, emprendedora con 3 hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando teniendo 2 en la secundaria, producto del sacrificio que ella hace a diario.

Ceprodel le ha brindado un gran apoyo con ayuda financiera desde hace 3 años y con 16 créditos las que le han beneficiado en la compra de mayor cantidad de lotería y sustento para su hogar.

loans.use: Buy lottery tickets to sell

loans.name: Kawsara Group

texts.fr:
Our project consists in the resale of market gardening produce and fruits, depending on the season. We would like to be the suppliers in the markets of the town of Dakar, because it is difficult to get a supply at a good price. We believe we can guaranty a regular supply of produce to our clients if we can obtain a loan from Kiva through its partner SEM. This financing will allow us to create employment for the young people of our ecovillage and insure a continual supply of market gardening produce, which sell very well in our local market. This loan will also allow us to resolve our financial problems by enabling us to cope with our household responsibilities.
Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Notre projet consiste à la revente de produits maraîchers et de fruits selon la saison. Nous voulons être des fournisseurs dans les marchés de la ville de Dakar, car il est difficile de se ravitailler à bon prix et nous pensons pouvoir garantir un ravitaillement régulier des produits à nos clients si nous arrivons à obtenir un ptêt de Kiva à travers son partenaire SEM. Ce financement nous permettra de créer des emplois pour les jeunes de notre écovillage et assurer une fourniture continue de produits maraîchers qui sont très bien consommés dans le marché local. Ce prêt nous permettra aussi de résoudre nos, problèmes d'ordre pécunière en faisant face à nos obligations domestiques.

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables , site outfitting, transportation and various costs

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: Mrs. Chhun C., 37, is a vendor of grocery products making on average $30 of income. To contribute to the household income, her husband, Mr. Srive Sran, 42, owns a plot of farmland upon which he grows rice, normally earning $1.43 a day of profit. They have five children. This couple requests a loan of $1000 from Kiva to expand their business. Half of  the money will be used to buy more grocery products and the rest will finance house renovations.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products and renovate the house.

loans.name: Thai

texts.en:
Mrs. Thai N., 46, is a widow with five children and sells porridge and biscuits for income. She earns approximately three dollars a day. However, two of her children are employed as garment workers with salaries of $50 each per month. Another child works in China and two others are married and live away from home.

To increase the family’s income, Mrs. N. is requesting a loan to purchase two buffaloes. She will rent the buffalos to residents in her village to gain additional income.

loans.use: To purchase two buffaloes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 15 cows

loans.name: Javharsho

texts.ru:
Javharsho A. lives in the town of Vahdat. He is married and has 3 children. He has secondary education and was trained as salesman. He started his own business by opening a grocery store close to his home. He imports his inventory. However, he would like to offer not only food, but also a number of other products needed in households. To increase the assortment of his goods and purchase additional inventory he needs funds. Expansion of his store will also help local residents purchase all of the necessities in their town without leaving it. For this reason, he decided to apply for a loan, which will help him achieve his goals. He plans to pay off the credit within the next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Амробеков Джавхаршо житель города Вахдат. Женат , имеет 3 детей. Имеет средне-специальное образование . По профессии продавец. Так и сейчас окрыл небольшой продуктовый магазин рядом с домом. Привозит товар первой необходимости. Но хочет из магазина сделать универмаг. Для этого нужны средства , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Завести новый товар. Это поможет привлечь новых клиентов и помочь населению делать покупки прямо у себя в кишлаке,не выезжая за его приделы.Поэтому он решил получить кредит , который поможет ему достичь поставленных целей. Погасить кредит он планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Dao

texts.en: Mrs. Dao N. is a farmer in Dem Popel Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a 59 year old widow of four: two of whom are employed in a garment factory;and two others are attending a local school. Her family continues to live in poor conditions and she would like to start a cow breeding business in order to support her family. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy a cow both to breed and to utilize in her field.

loans.use: To start a cow breeding business

loans.name: Danny

texts.es:
Danny, 27 years old, is a talented young man. He learned about textile artisanry from his sister Yenny, who gladly and patiently taught him her useful skills. Danny and Yenny together own a small workshop where they make woven goods. The workshop also provides jobs for three young workers. Together with their employees, they make the perfect team for this work. Recently their output has increased, requiring various wools to fulfill orders placed by their clients, who are always satisfied with their work. This young brother-and-sister team would like to purchase greater quantities of wool and expand their workshop, which will provide their employees with a more comfortable work environment.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Danny es un talentoso joven de 27 años de edad, aprendió la bella labor de la artesanía textil de su querida hermana Yenny, quien gustosa y pacientemente le enseñó sus valiosos conocimientos. Actualmente, Danny y Yenny poseen en sociedad un pequeño taller de tejidos, donde brindan trabajo a otros 3 jóvenes con quienes hacen un equipo perfecto para esta labor, por estas temporadas el volumen de producción de sus trabajos se ha incrementado, requiriendo variedad de lanas para cumplir cada uno de las solicitudes de sus clientes, clientes quienes quedan muy satisfechos con su trabajo. El deseo de estos jóvenes hermanos es adquirir mayor cantidad de lana y ampliar su taller, para brindar mejor comodidad a sus colaboradores.

loans.use: Purchase of wool and expansion of textile workshop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy sewing machines, cloth, and boutique items

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Madame A. Akossiwa est née le 2 février 1958 à Kpalimé l’une des villes touristiques du Togo. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle a pour activité principale la vente du charbon de bois. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis1994 ce qui fait qu’elle est expérimentée dans ce commerce. 
Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour aller s’approvisionner dans les villages d’Amou, localité dans laquelle abonde le charbon de bois. Ce crédit lui permettra d’acheter 14 sacs de charbon de bois.
texts.en:
Mrs. Akossiwa A. was born on February 2, 1958 in Kpalimé, one of the touristic towns in Togo. She is married and the mother of 3 children. Her primary business activity consists in selling charcoal. She has been working at this business since 1994 which means that she is quite experienced in this line of work.

She is asking for this first loan to go to the villages of Amou, a locality that abounds in charcoal, to stock up. This loan will allow her to buy 14 sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 14 sacks of charcoal for re-sale

loans.name: Loymira

texts.es:
La señora Loymira, socia del Grupo de Crédito Mientras Tanto “Las Zamaritanas”, vive en la Región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de pollos eviscerados en una mesa ubicada en una de las calles del mercado Nº 02 de la ciudad, lugar donde acuden a diario a comprar gran cantidad de clientes, también reparte a las señoras que venden comida y a las bodegas de la ciudad. 

Con este crédito de S/.800, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará pollos de diversos tamaños en cantidades para luego sacrificarlos y poder variar sus precios cuando oferta a sus clientes de la ciudad, busca satisfacer sus requerimientos tanto en la atención así como en la calidad de sus pollos.

La señora Loymira es una mujer entusiasta de 32 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 02 hijas. Se siente contenta porque sus ventas y sus clientes han aumentado. Su meta es crecer más en el negocio y para ello quiere contar con un puesto fijo, sobre todo seguro y más amplio para brindar buena atención.
texts.en:
Loymira, Grupo de Crédito Mientras Tanto "Las Zamaritanas" partner, lives in San Martín region and province, Tarapoto district. She is an energetic 32-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two daughters. She sells eviscerated chickens from a rented table in one of the streets of the city’s no. 2 market, where every day she has many customers, including women who sell meals and the city’s shop owners. With this 800 sol loan, which she will repay in six months, Loymira will buy a quantity of various sizes of chickens, which she will then slaughter and offer at different prices to her customers in order to meet their service and quality requirements. Loymira is happy that her sales and number of customers have increased. Her plan is to build up her business by having a fixed location for more security and space in order to provide great service.

Translated from Spanish by ian harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various sizes of chickens

loans.name: Inspiration Group

texts.en:
Emma T. is 44 years old and married with four children, who are between the ages of 2 and 15. Emma also takes care of a 26 year old girl named Pamela.

Emma started his first business selling beverages and cartons of eggs in January 1998. He worked very hard and his business prospered. However, in 2006 thieves broke into his business and took all of his money and goods. He lost approximately $770 as a result of the theft. Due to this traumatic event, Emma closed his business. He and his family went through a hard time as he had neither a job nor anything with which to support his family financially. His life and future became dark.

Emma’s sister Dethy Tshama then gave him $300 as a donation and in 2007 Emma bought a stall and started a new business selling second-hand clothing. He likes this business because it's profitable and helped him stabilize his family economically. Emma sells in a heavily populated area of Eastern Kinshasa. He is now able to provide food and housing for his family, and pay the electricity and water bills and school fees for his children.

This past November, Emma joined a Hope DRC group called Inspiration with 40 members. Emma is very glad to have joined because he wants to enhance his business with a loan. With this loan, he plans to rent a building and move his business indoors in order to avoid the heavy rains during the rainy season. He says that a loan from Hope DRC is his “saviour.”

loans.use: To rent a building and move his business indoors.

loans.name: Matondo Group

texts.en:
Souzane began selling second-hand goods in 1987. Over the years, Souzane has acquired solid experience by selling both kitchen utensils and second-hand clothing, even though it was not her business. After she divorced her husband, Suzanne went through a hard time as she did not have any capital to open her business. Souzane then began to sell kitchen utensils and second-hand clothing and made a small profit in doing so.

By the end of every day, Souzane would pay back the goods’ cost and keep the little bit of profit as agreed with the owner of the items. Through her determination and hard work, she has been able to save enough money to begin her own business and build a loyal customer base that has began to pre-order utensils.

Souzane joined one of Hope’s groups named "M.", which means thanks in English, last June. With the coming loan she plans to increase her working capital and be able to buy 1 bale of second-hand clothing and kitchen utensils. This bale will enable her to generate additional profits that will allow her business to grow and change. Souzane is 53 years old and the mother of four children and she also takes care of one other child. She lives with her family in the northern suburban area of Kinshasa.

loans.use: To be able to buy 1 bale of second-hand clothing and some kitchen utensils for re-sale

loans.name: Liza Marie

texts.es:
La señora Liza Marie E. Ramírez tiene 28 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Emprendedoras II y vive en la calle Trujillo 673 del Puerto Marítimo de Salaverry en la provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió educación secundaria completa, ya no continuó estudiando porque se casó y tiene un hijo y una hija que aun son pequeños.
Su negocio consiste en venta de comida en sociedad con su abuela en un restaurant que se ubica en la calle Libertad 579.
El primer crédito fue de 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas el cual lo invirtió en bebidas; gaseosa y cerveza.
Con este crédito de 1400 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas lo invertirá en; arroz, azúcar, aceite y otros insumos para el restaurant.
Liza sueña con tener su negocio propio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Liza Marie E. Ramírez is 28 years old and belongs to the Enterprising Women II Communal Bank. She lives at 673 Trujillo Street in the seaport of Salaverry, Trujillo province, department of La Libertad, Peru. She completed high school but did not continue her education after that because she married and has a son and a daughter who are still young. Her business is selling food in partnership with her grandmother in a restaurant located at 579 Libertad Street. The first loan of 300 soles, which she repaid over 4 months, was used to buy beverages (soft drinks and beer). This loan of 1,400 soles ($475), which will be repaid over 6 months, will be used to buy rice, sugar, oil, and other ingredients for her restaurant. Liza dreams of having her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, oil and other ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr: Madame A. habite Agoè, elle est veuve et travaille très dur pour pouvoir subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de ses 06 enfants, cette dame a pour activité génératrice de revenus la vente de graviers, son quartier étant un quartier en chantier, ce commerce marche et est très florissant pour elle. Ses clients sont des entrepreneurs, la demande a augmentée ces derniers temps, n’ayant jamais eu de crédit à wages, elle demande son premier crédit de 500000F pour se faire livrer 06 camions de graviers.
texts.en:
Ms. A. lives in Agoè. She is a widow and works very hard to provide for the day-to-day needs of her six children. With her district under construction, this woman sells gravel to earn an income. This commerce is active, and business is booming for her. Her customers are entrepreneurs. Recently, the demand has increased. Never having had a WAGES loan, she is asking for her first loan of 500,000 francs to have six truck-loads of gravel delivered to her.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy gravel

loans.name: Ade

texts.en:
Ade T. is a tailor. She makes lovely designs for her customers. She also sells sarongs.

She now needs a loan of N100,000 so she can purchase more sarongs, one sewing machine and a generator. She says that this will help to boost her business.

Ade is 32 years old. She is married with 4 children. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs, a sewing machine and a generator.

loans.name: María

texts.es: La señora María, es muy amigable con las personas, rasgo que refleja el amor que tiene en su hogar, pues su esposo e hijo son su mayor apoyo, lo cual le da más que un motivo para sentirse feliz. Su capacidad por aprovechar las oportunidades la llevó a instalar su propio negocio en la esquina de su casa, pues se dio cuenta que con la conglomeración de personas en esa zona, era un área perfecta para el comercio, y así hace 10 años vende desayuno todas las mañanas desde las 6 hasta el medio día. Pero su actividad no termina allí porque al llegar a casa prepara algunos aperitivos que también vende desde ahí. Esta actividad es muy cansada, sobretodo por las mañanas, pues el frío o el calor la desaniman, pero al ver a sus comensales y saber que al final del día tendrá las ganancias suficientes para satisfacer las necesidades de sus seres queridos, la motivan en salir con mucho esmero y con una gran sonrisa en el rostro. Para el futuro María desea acabar de construir su casa para instalar un restaurante y dejar de salir todas las mañanas a la calle. Con MFP María tiene tres años, este es su sexto préstamo y hasta ahora está muy a gusto con el trabajo que viene desempeñando como parte de la junta directiva de su banco comunal, aprendiendo a desarrollar sus capacidades. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de utensilios y de algunos accesorios para mejorar la atención a sus clientes y hacer que se sientan muy a gusto en su puesto de comida.
texts.en:
María is very kind with people, with a face that reflects the love she has in her home, as her husband and son are her biggest supporters, and give her more than enough reason to be happy. Her ability to take advantage of opportunities led her to create her own business in the corner of her home, as she realized that with the amount of people in her area, it was the perfect place for her business. For the last 10 years, she has sold breakfast foods each morning from 6 a.m. until mid-day. But her activities don't end then, because upon her return to her home she prepares snacks that she also sells in her area.

This activity is very tiring, above all during her early mornings, as the cold or the heat will tire her. But upon seeing her clients and knowing that at the end of the day she will have sufficient earnings to fulfill the needs of her loved ones, she is motivated to put forth much effort and do it with a big smile. For the future, María would like to finish construction on her home to install a restaurant and leave behind all those early mornings in the street.

María has been with MFP (a Kiva Partner) for 3 years. This is her sixth loan and she has been very pleased with the work and her post as part of the directorial committee of her communal bank, and learning how to develop her skills. The money she seeks she will invest in the purchase of utensils and of a few accessories to improve her service to her clients and to make sure they enjoy her food stand.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils

loans.name: Djimba Labo

texts.fr: Madame T. Djimba Labo-pou  est une résidente du quartier de hedzranawoé, un quartier de Lomé, elle a pour activité la vente de casse croûte faite à base de farine de blé, de sucre, d'arachide, d'huile et de beurre, ensuite mise à chaud dans un four puis mise en bouteille et en sachets, elle a commencé ce commerce depuis 2004 les gens viennent acheter les casses croûtes chez elle pour leur occasion de fête ou d’événements heureux, elle a aussi la chance de vendre à côté d’une école, à la sortie les écoliers viennent acheter les casses croûtes en sachets chez elle. Voulant agrandir son stock elle sollicite un crédit pour l’achat de produits de première nécessité entrant dans la préparation des casses croûtes notamment 4 bols de farine de blé, 2 bols et demi de sucre,  1 sachets de beurre et 3 litres d’huile. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants
texts.en:
Ms. T. Djimba Labo-Pou is a resident of Hedzranawoé, a district of Lomé. Her work involves selling snacks made from wheat flour, sugar, peanuts, oil, and butter. It’s baked and then put into bottles and bags. She started this business in 2004. People come to buy the snacks from her for holidays and happy events. She also has the opportunity to make sales next to a school. There, at the exit, the students come to her to buy the packaged snacks.

Wanting to expand her stock of goods, she’s requesting a loan to buy the necessary ingredients for making snacks, particularly four bowls of flour, two and a half bowls of sugar, one bag of butter, and three liters of oil. She is married and the mother of three.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, peanuts, butter, oil, etc.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac A. is married and has 5 dependents. He has received schooling through junior high. Isaac is a blacksmith who uses metals to do a variety of things like making springs for sale at Siwdo near Cape Coast, which he has done since about 20 years ago. His wife is a trader. Isaac uses his income to pay for utility bills.

Isaac will use the loan as additional capital to buy more metals for the production of springs and other items to meet the demand of his customers. He plans to reinvest his new profits in the business to expand his trade.

loans.use: Metal for blacksmithing

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel  N. vive en el pueblito de Armenia, en el departamento de Sonsonate en el occidente del país.  Hace ya cinco años, empezó con su proyecto de  negocio propio, una tienda y abarrotería que monto en su propia casa, pues era incapaz de cubrir los costos de un local aparte. Su esposa Josefina vive con él, y le ayuda en el manejo de la tienda. Además de administrar el negocio, Daniel también se encarga de toda la casa, y cubre los gastos económicos mensuales. 
Daniel N. solicita un préstamo  para comprar nuevas mercaderías como cereal, bebidas y detergentes, con el fin de enriquecer su inventario y ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor gama de productos.
texts.en:
Daniel lives in the village of Armenia in Sonsonate, in the west of the country. 5 years ago he set up his own business. He now runs a shop and general store from his own home, which is more cost effective than a separate location. His wife, Josefina, helps him manage the business. In addition to running the store, Daniel is also in charge of the house, and he covers the monthly costs for the family. He is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise such as cereals, drinks and detergents, to expand his inventory and offer his customers a greater variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store and offer his customers a greater variety of products

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa Y., 37, is married and a mother. She is a food vendor who sells Kenkey in her neighborhood, and she has done so for four years. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize, cooked and taken with hot pepper, gravy stew or any kind of soup, fried fish or meat. She has many customers who enjoy Kenkey for breakfast, lunch and supper.

She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to raise more income to support her husband and provide a quality education for the children. She would be grateful for your assistance. She belongs to the village bank called ‘God First.’

loans.use: Buy raw materials like maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama K. est une femme de 50 ans, veuve avec 6 enfants en charge. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour s’activer dans la vente d’huile de palme et de divers produits alimentaires. Elle souhaiterait améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mariama K. is a 50-year-old woman, a widow, with six children in her care. She's requesting this loan to become active in selling palm oil and various food items. She would like to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell palm oil and various foods

loans.name: Tino

texts.en: Tino L., 65, is married with 8 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the pancake business. She sells to villagers and schools 4 days per week.  She has no previous loans with SPBD.  Tino expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~ 120USD).  SPBD loans are Tino’s only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase frying pan, spoon, flour, baking powder, forks,etc.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Lý Nguyễn Thị (1416030881) is a 52-year-old woman living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has three adult children.

Lý owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily raising chickens for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over twenty years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 2003, Lý joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

Lý is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 3rd from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Irenia

texts.en:
Irenia N. is from the village of Alindahaw, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 45 years old. Irenia is married and has one school-age child. To make a living, Irenia owns and operates a sari-sari (general) store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Irenia has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (about $168) a month for these activities.

In 2008, Irenia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Irenia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Irenia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Irenia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Clara Elisa

texts.es:
La señora Clara Elisa P. y el señor José Roberto Cruz tienen poco tiempo casarse, ellos quiere formar un patrimonio segura antes de que tengan hijos.
Es por eso que están solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar la diferencia de  una vivienda por medio del gobierno, ya que ellos no cuentan con el dinero necesario para dar el enganche y les entreguen la casa. 
Clara Elisa trabaja en una compañía de construcción en el departamento de atención al cliente y su esposo en una agencia aduanal como documentador, estos son los ingresos que tiene para salir adelante en su nueva vida como pareja, y con el cual piensan una parte será para pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Clara Elisa P. and Sr. José Roberto Cruz are newlyweds who want to start acquiring assets before they have children.

For this reason, Sra. Clara Elisa is requesting a loan to make the down payment on a house that is being financed through the government. At the moment, they do not have the funds required to secure the house.

She works for a construction company in the customer service department and her husband is a researcher for a customs agency. Their incomes will enable them to get ahead as they start their new life as a couple. They will set aside part of their earnings in order to repay this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make the down payment on a house

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is already 46 years old.  She is married to Delfin and they have three children: Ronie, Alex, and Lorna. Their two eldest children only finished elementary level while their youngest is a high school graduate.   All of their children are already married. 

Adelaida helps her husband earn a living by retailing goods  helps her husband by managing their village store.  They used their income for their daily needs and also for the maintenance of their farm and to provide their farming needs such as fertilizers. The couple is doing their best to cope with the economic crisis that they are now experiencing.  The couple also wanted to help the education of their grandchildren and this is the reason why she would like to improve her business.  Her store is open from 6:00 in the morning until 9:00 in the evening.  Her desire of making the business successful motivated her to request a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP10, 000 that will serve as her additional business capital.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma A. is from the village of Punta. She is 56 years old. Norma is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Norma owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting rice for sale. Norma has been engaged in her business for over 20 years with an approximate average monthly earnings of 6,000 PHP for these activities.

In 2008, Norma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Norma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to venture another business such as selling ready-to-wear clothes and dried fish in addition to her farming activity. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Norma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to venture another business

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul has been a motorbike taxi operator in Naivasha town for over seven years. He also runs a tailoring business on the side. He is 44 years old, married to Lucy Mumbi, and they have four school-age children. Paul was introduced to KADET by his friend. This will be his first loan with the organization and, with this loan, he is planning to buy more clothing material for his tailoring business, which is run by his wife. His future plan is to go into real estate – to buy a piece of land and build rental houses in Naivasha, a fast-growing town.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. KADET provides financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is a micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke/.

loans.use: To buy material for a tailoring business

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.en:
Emiliana G., 63 years old and married to Lorenzo G., is the mother of two children, Rolando, now 37 years old and working as a fish pond operator and Olivia, 36 years old and working as a teacher. Both of them now have their own families, so even though the children now have salary coming from their work, Emiliana does not oblige them to give her money because she knows that they need it for their children. So the couple is working for themselves, although sometimes they receive money from the children. The variety store business they have been operating for the past seven years is their main source of income, and they also sell cell phone loads and some fishing equipment.

Emiliana is now requesting her second loan from Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) which she will use to purchase things needed in her variety store. She wants to improve this business in order to increase the income it provides for their everyday living. Emiliana is also really hoping that her business will grow so that instead of her children helping them, she will be able to help them, especially in the schooling of her grandchildren.

loans.use: To finance her variety store business

loans.name: Lilian Atieno

texts.en:
Lilian O. is 32 years old and married to Ayub. She has been selling clothes for the last five years on the side of the street (not in a physical shop) in the heart of Kisumu City.

This business has enabled her to pay her living expenses. She began the business using capital she had been offered by her husband, who is a marketer.

This is Lilian’s fourth loan from KADET. Lilian learned about KADET through a friend who is an existing client of KADET. She intends to use these funds to purchase more clothes, specifically expanding into men's clothing as she currently only deals in ladies' clothing.

She also intends to purchase mobile phone airtime to sell to customers, in order to take advantage of the current market opportunity as the industry is experiencing massive growth in Kenya.

Lilian aspires to move her business to a permanent stall where she can also accommodate a salon business.

About KADET

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their families across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell (men's clothes and ladies' dresses)

loans.name: Nasaret A2 Group

texts.en:
Leon A. is a 41 year old man. He is a farmer who lives in Nenas Village, Fatumnasi Subdistrict, Kapan – in the South Central Region of Timor in East Nusa Tenggara Province. Leon is the leader of Nasaret A2 Group. The group consists of 10 farmers. Leon is married to Agatha Sila. They have four lovely children. They are: Arianto A., 17, who has dropped out of Junior High School since his parents were unable to finance his education. He often helps Leon in farming. Yusti A., 14, who is in the 6th Grade of Elementary School.  Sardiman A., 8, who is in Kindergarten. Sardiman was late to enter Kindergarten as Leon couldn’t afford it.  Nifron A., 5, is also in Kindergarten.

Leon has been working as a farmer since he was young. He is happy to be a farmer. He is grateful that he has his own fertile land that can be utilized as a farm. Leon plants carrots, corns, bananas, cassavas and king grass. He always tries to do the best that he can to fulfill his family's daily needs. Leon and the group members are lucky as they don’t have to sell their agricultural products at the market since the traders will come to buy directly from them.  

Leon is a keen farmer and usually works at the farm from 7 am to 4 pm. His wife and his son Arianto help him to water the plants and harvest the agricultural products. Fortunately, Leon has a well at the farm so he never faces difficulty in watering his plants.
  
Leon has dreams to renovate his house and finance his children’s education. He feels regret that he was unable to finance Arianto’s education. He does not want it happen to the rest of his children. 

Leon heard about TLM Cattle Fattening Program from the clergyman in the village. He is interested in joining the program so he can make his dreams come true. Together with his neighbors, they formed Nasaret A2 Group in order to get loans to buy young cattle to be fattened in twelve months. They hope that the loan will help them in improving their lives in the future.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer con mucho empuje para salir adelante, tiene 35 años y vive con su esposo Orlando de 39 años; producto de su amor tuvieron 2 hijos: David de 10 y Jeferson de 4 años. Ellos viven en una pequeña casa en una zona céntrica ubicada en la selva peruana.

Esta familia se dedica a la siembra de plátanos y paltas, en su propia chacra, además tienen una tienda de productos comestibles y bebidas, pero Luz también aprovecha el espacio de la tienda para vender los frutos que su esposo trae de la chacra.
Esta trabajadora mujer se las ingenia para vender a muy buen precio sus productos, que debido a su calidad son muy buscados en la zona a pesar de la competencia. Y como si fuera poco también se dedica a la cajonería, es decir, compra troncos de madera y arma los cajones para las frutas, y así armados los vende, generándose más ganancias económicas. Esta labor  la realiza sola porque su esposo se dedica por entero a la chacra, además ella tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante para asegurarles un buen futuro a sus hijos, que es su máxima preocupación y motivo de su sacrificio diario, pues las labores que realiza son bastante cansadas.

Este es el quinto préstamo que tiene con MFP y le agrada mucho trabajar con esta institución, además está muy satisfecha con la labor de su banco comunal porque son muy unidos y responsables. Luz tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en abastecer su tienda y comprar mayor cantidad de productos para ofrecer variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luz is a woman with plenty of drive to succeed. She is 35 years old and lives with her husband Orlando, who is 39. Out of their love they have produced two children: David, who is 10, and Jeferson, who is 4. They live in a little house in a central area of the Peruvian jungle.

This family grows bananas and avocados on their own farm, and they also have a store that sells food and drink, but Luz also takes advantage of the store space to sell the fruits that her husband brings from the farm.

This hardworking woman manages to sell her products at a very good price thanks because they are high quality and highly sought after in the areas despite the competition. As if this wasn't enough, she also works as a crate maker, that is to say: she buys wood and assembles crates for the fruits, she then sells the crates and so increases her profits. She undertakes this work alone because her husband works entirely on the farm, and what is more she very much wants to make a go of things and secure a good future for her sons - this is her main preoccupation and the motive for her daily sacrifices, for the work that she does is quite tiring.

This is the fifth loan that she will have taken out with MFP and she is very pleased to work with this institution. In addition, she is very satisfied with the work of the communal bank because they are very united and responsible. Luz has decide to invest the money that she is requesting in stocking her store and buying a greater quanity of products so that she can offer her customers more choice.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 48 años, vive con su pareja y sus tres hijos en su casa propia.
Ella se dedica al alquiler de su motocarro, el cual compró a base a mucho sacrificio, pues tuvo que ahorrar y privarse de muchas comodidades. Felizmente, hoy en día, obtiene buenas ganancias mensuales. Sin embargo, debido a que este vehículo trabaja durante todo el día, necesita de un constante mantenimiento y reparación de algunas averías, gastos que ella debe asumir.
En un futuro, Elizabeth desea tener más motocarros para mejorar sus ingresos y convertirse en una próspera empresaria del transporte.

Este es su noveno préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual con el pago de todas sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a refaccionar su motocarro, ya está presentando algunas problemas de funcionamiento.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 48 years old, and lives with her partner and three children in her own home. She rents out her car, which she bought at great sacrifice, having saved money and done without many conveniences. Fortunately, she shows a healthy profit each month. Her car operates throughout the day, and requires constant maintenance, as well as repair of damage, expenses she must assume. Elizabeth would like to have additional cars to thus increase her income and become a prosperous transportation business owner. This is her ninth loan with MFP; she has always been very punctual with her payments. She would use the money requested to have her car overhauled, as it doesn’t always run well.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car repairs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase equipment for her restaurant.

loans.name: Gana

texts.fr: Madame Gana T.  demeurant à Médina Fall Thiès est commerçante de divers produits (jujubes, beurre de karité, encens…etc)  depuis sa jeunesse. Elle est mariée et est mère de 4 enfants tous majeurs. Née en 1957, Madame Fall est membre à U-IMCEC et elle est à sa septième demande de crédit. Ainsi, elle sollicite un montant de 50 000 FCFA pour compléter son budget d’approvisionnement afin de profiter du Magal de Touba  (Cérémonie religieuse commémorant l’anniversaire du retour en exil de Cheikh Ahmadou Bamba fondateur du mouridisme  confrérie  très développée au Sénégal)  pour écouler ses marchandises aisément.  Cependant elle compte avec les revenus gagnés se réapprovisionner pour préparer le Maouloud  (Gamou) à Tivaouane une cérémonie religieuse qui rassemble beaucoup de fidèles venus de   partout dans le monde  où on fête l’anniversaire du prophète Mouhamed  Paix et Salut sur Lui.
texts.en:
Madame Gana T. who lives in Médina Fall, Thiès, has been selling various items: jujubes, karité (shea) butter, incense, etc., since she was a young woman. She is married and the mother of four children, all of whom are adults.

Born in 1957, Mrs. Gana T. is a member of U-IMCEC and she is on her seventh loan request. She is asking for the amount of 50,000 F CFA so as to have the funds to buy more inventory and take advantage of 'Magal de Touba' (a religious ceremony commemorating the anniversary of the return from exile of Cheikh Ahmadou Bamba, the founder of the Mouride brotherhood which is widespread in Senegal) to sell her wares with ease. She will then restock with the income earned so as to prepare for the 'Maouloud' ('Gamou') in Tivaouane, a religious ceremony which gathers many of the faithful from all over the world to celebrate the birthday of the Prophet Mohamed, Peace and Grace be upon Him.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: add to her budget for restocking her shop

loans.name: Mirsa Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Mirsa, es una mujer emprendedora, desde hace mas de ocho años logro poner un pequeño negocio de ventas de cosméticos, en donde vende una variedad de productos , así como eskimo, frescos y gaseosa. Tiene 31 años de edad, casada, procreo dos hijos los cuales es un par de gemelos de 7 años, ya cursan su primaria, su esposo trabaja como conductor de transporte pesado, y junto trabajan para poder ayudarse y poder apoyar a sus hijos. Inicio este pequeño negocio con ayuda económica que su mama dio, luego con financiamiento que Afodenic ha otorgado ha ido creciendo en venta como en la captación de clientes. Con este préstamo comprara: perfumenes, cremas para cuerpo, cutis, vanidades, pinturas de labios, maquillajes, talcos, body, deseorantes, tintes de cabellos, así como sus clientes le hacen encargos ya que trabaja con catálogos y con productos de la  Avon. También   comprara  más eskimo, gaseosas, repostería para aumentar las ventas y poder a futuro comprar otra vitrina en donde pueda seguir ofertando sus productos. Todo esto ha sido posible con la ayuda de la institución por sus plazos de pagos y ayuda al pequeño comerciante.
texts.en:
Mirsa is a hard-working woman. Over eight years ago she was able to set up a small business selling cosmetics. She sells a variety of products like ice cream, smoothie like fruit drinks, and soft drinks. She is 31, married, and has two children. The children are seven year old twins who are in primary school. Her husband works as a driver of heavy transport. They work together to be able help each other and to be able to support their children. She started this small business with the economic help that her mother gave her. Then, she got a loan with Afodenic. Sales have been growing, and she has gotten more customers. With this loan she will buy perfume, body and face cream, beauty products, lipstick, make-up, powder, deodorant, and hair coloring. Her customers place orders because she works with catalogs and with Avon products. She will also buy more ice cream, soft drinks, and pastry. She will do this to increase sales and be able to buy another display case in the future where she can continue offering her products. All of this has been possible with the help of the institution through their payment installments and help to small business people.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perfume, body and face cream, beauty products, lipstick, make-up, powder, deodorant, and hair coloring

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie A. is from the village of Tierra Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro. She is 45 years old. Rosemarie is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Rosemarie owns & operates a specialized retail store selling flowers in the local community. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosemarie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used as additional working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosemarie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional working capital

location.town: Tierra Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misa

loans.name: Janeffer

texts.en:
Janeffer is 29 years old and married with three children, ages 4, 7, and 9. The two oldest currently attend school. She owns and operates a farm in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale, where she has been farming for over five years. Her primary income comes from the sale of maize and beans. She also sells vegetables at her small stand in town. She says that the main challenge right now is competition with selling her goods and at times some of her produce spoils.

Janeffer has a successful history with Juhudi Kilimo, previously completing two loans of KES 10,000 and KES 20,000. She is requesting this loan for KES 35,000 to further diversify her farming operations and expand her poultry project. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her meet her family's basic needs and also enable her to see her children through school. In the future, Janneffer would like to purchase more land and also open her own grocery store so she can earn more money.

loans.use: diversify her farm and expand her poultry project

loans.name: Julie - Ann

texts.en:
Julie-Ann A. is from the village of Sto. Niño in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 29 years old. Julie-Ann is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Julie-Ann sells seafood, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Julie-Ann has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Julie-Ann joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julie-Ann has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Julie-Ann is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Julie-Ann's third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Obo

texts.en: Obo A. sells provisions and disposable spoons and containers at Akotokyire.  Obo has received junior high education.  She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a petty trader. Obo has been selling provisions for some time now. She helps her husband in the general welfare of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to further her dependents' education.

loans.use: to buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham N. is from the village of Brgy. Quezon, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 29 years old, married, and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Abraham owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Abraham has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Abraham joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be his first from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Mabelle Lanticse Group

texts.en:
Mabelle is 23 years old and the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Mabelle is married and has two very young children. Mabelle owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Mabelle has been involved in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Mabelle joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mabelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase new items to expand product offering. Mabelle is requesting a new loan, her 5th, of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital

loans.name: Oyuntuya

texts.en:
Oyuntuya D., age 41, lives in a traditional housing tent called a 'ger' with her family in Zavhan province, western Mongolia. She has been operating a felt manufacture business since 1995 as well as paying for four people. Her business is sustainable now. Regarding her family's attendance and help, the quality of her life has been increasing. 

Oyuntuya is modest and energetic. She wants to create her own workplace. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase wool-scribbling machine and construction materials for a workplace.

loans.use: To purchase wool scribbling machine and construction materials for a workplace.

loans.name: Marichi

texts.en:
