Marichi M. is from the village of Looc, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 33 years old. Marichi is married and has 5 children. To make a living, Marichi owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Marichi has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marichi joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marichi has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marichi is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Marichi from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Merla

texts.en:
Merla C., age 48, is from the village of Gata Diot Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Merla and her husband have four grown children. To make a living, Merla runs a general store, where she sells a variety of different products such as sugar, shampoo, juice packs, milo, milk, and soft drinks in the local community. Merla has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 7,200 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Merla joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Merla has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Merla is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Merla from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago Gaitán R.    es un señor de 52 años de edad el cual vive con su esposa y tres hijos en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Desde hace varios años Don Santiago trabaja como peón de una Empresa exportadora de pina  de la Zona. Su espíritu emprendedor lo ha llevado a tomar la decisión de iniciar su propio negocio; venta de ropa a domicilio,  con el cual podrá mejorar sus ingresos y así compartir más tiempo con su familia.

El necesita un préstamo de ¢619.000 (seiscientos diecinueve mil colones) para comprar todo tipo de prendas y así poder venderlas en la comunidad. Asegura que su negocio  tendrá mucho éxito ya que no hay tiendas cerca de la comunidad.

Santiago es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer   préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. Asegura que este crédito ha sido una gran motivación y trabajara fuertemente para seguir teniendo acceso a ellos y convertirse en un microempresario exitoso.
texts.en:
Santiago Gaitán R. is a 52 year old man who lives with his wife and 3 children in a community called Santa Fe, in Los Chiles in the province of Alajuela; this community is known for its mountains and for being very close to the northern border of our country. The main economic activities there are livestock and arable farming, specifically growing grains, sugar cane and oranges. For several years, Santiago has worked as a labourer for a company that exports pineapples. However, his entrepreneurial spirit has led him to decide that he will start his own business, selling clothes from his home. This will enable him to increase his income and also spend more time with his family. He needs the loan of ¢619.000 colones ($1,200) to buy all types of clothing that he will sell in the local community. He is sure that his business will be successful because there is no similar shop nearby. Santiago is a member of the Communal Bank of Santa Fe, one of 100 such organisations under the auspices of EDESA in Costa Rica. This is his first loan and with it he hopes to reach a new level of personal and financial success. He says that this loan is a great motivator and that he will work hard to ensure he can continue to access credit and to become a successful micro-entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing that he will sell from home

loans.name: Michil

texts.en: Michil is a 36 year old man from Lebanon who is married with 3 kids. Michil owns a restaurant in his village which is popular in its tasty food and cleanliness. This is the second time Michil requests a loan from Al Majmoua.  Michil is requesting a Loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy a chicken roasted machine. Michil seeks perfection in his work. He has used his saved money to repair his restaurant after a big fire took place in it and ruined everything he had. Michil hopes to own a big restaurant in a tourist area since Lebanon is a touristic country, which everyone likes to visit.

loans.use: To buy a chicken roasting machine

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina G. is from the village of Cabisera 8. She is 36 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Marina owns and operates a business venture raising lifestock, mainly pigs, for fattening and sale. Marina has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4000 PHP when she sells a raised animal.

In 2007, Marina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from ASKI which she used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Marina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP to again purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Marina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Papa Kouly

texts.fr: Monsieur Papa Kouly T. est un jeune commerçant célibataire en son état est un boutiquier vendeur d'alimentation générale dans la communauté rurale de FISSEl située à quelque 50 km de Mbour .Monsieur T. a une expérience de plus de 3ans dans le secteur . Ainsi il sollicite ce prêt pour accroitre son commerce dans sa localité également étant soutien de sa famille il pourra générer plus de bénéfice pour aider ses parents
texts.en:
Mr. Papa Kouly T., a young unmarried trader, is a grocery shopkeeper in the rural community of Fissel located about 50 km from Mbour. Mr. T. has more than 3 years experience in the business. He is requesting this loan to increase his trade in his community. As he is supporting his family, he will also be able to generate more profit to help his parents.

Translated from French by viviane reignier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COMMERCE

loans.name: Tsunday

texts.en:
Tsunday is the chairman of Omwando group in Kisii town, western Kenya which is being funded by Juhudi Kilimo. He has been farming for the last 5 years. His mixed farm produces maize, kale, bananas, nappier grass, and milk which he sells locally. He is also a taxi driver in the same town. Tsunday is 32 years old and married with two children, two and four. His eldest child attends school. 

Tsunday has requested this loan of 40,000KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help improve the livelihood of his family. He faces the challenge of lack of finance that delays his business operations, and pests and diseases which affect his crops and animals. He hopes that in future, he will be able to increase the number of his dairy cows and start poultry farming.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Elita

texts.en:
Elita L. is from the village of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old, married, and has 3 grown children. To make a living, Elita owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling fruits (like bananas) and vegetables in the market. She has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used as additional capital for her business. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be Elita’s third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the her family’s general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Espoir Group

texts.fr: Masika M.  est  présidente du groupe Espoir, âgée de 60 ans, divorcée, mère de 7 enfants, parmi ces naissances, il ya des jumeaux. Tous ses enfants ont déjà leurs propres foyers. Elle  fait le commerce de boisson locale Mandale. Elle commence cette activité dans  sa petite jeunesse.  Plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$, vers les années 2008. Dit-elle,  cette activité a fait grandir ses enfants. Elle vend à son domicile. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir d’approvisionner des matières premières de production boisson Mandale (3sacs de maïs, sorgho, etc.). En plus, elle ambitionne acheter d’autres parcelles pour ces enfants. La cliente Masika M. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique.  Il sied de signaler que ce groupe Espoir est  composé de 19 membres.
texts.en: Masika M. is the president of the Espoir group. She is 60 years old, divorced, and has 7 children, some of whom are twins. All of her children have their own families. She runs a business selling a local drink called Mandale. She began this activity when she was very young, and later benefited from a loan of $50 through the microfinance institution Hekima (one of Kiva's field partners) around 2008. She says that this business has helped her raise her children. She sells her products at her home. This new loan will serve to obtain supplies of the raw ingredients to produce Mandale (3 bags of maize, sorghum, etc.). Furthermore, she aspires to buy additional plots of land for her children. Masika is grateful to Hekima for its actions on behalf of the poor who are excluded from mainstream banking. It should be noted that the Espoir group is composed of 19 members.

loans.use: To buy 3 bags of maize, sorghum, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase fabrics

loans.name: Dusman

texts.en: Dusman J. sells sugar, coffee, salt, etc. and is requesting a loan to stock more goods to sell. Dusman is 24 years old and married to a peasant. She has three children; two go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: Stock more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Kevork

texts.ar:
كيفورك له من العمر 54 سنة يعمل في حدادة البويا للسيارات له في عمله اكثر من 30 سنة 
يحب عمله ويريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجوعة الى شراء معدات جديدة وماكنة لرش البويا له تاريخ ممتاز مع المجموعة
يلقى الدعم الدائم من عائلته له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه يتميز عمله بالدقة والنشاط والصدق في المعاملة لكن ما ينقصه هو المادة لدعم مصلحته لكي تتطور ومن خلالها يطور نفسه واولاده
texts.en: Kevork is a 54-year-old who has three decades experience working in automotive body repair and painting. He is very passionate about his work, to which he brings a lot of thoroughness and enthusiasm. He is very upfront and honest in dealing with his customers, who come from his neighbors and wider community. Kevork has an excellent credit history with Al Majmoua and would like to once again request a loan to purchase a spray painter and other new equipment. He wants to build up his business to be able to advance his children, who are of great support to him.

loans.use: To purchase a spray painter and other equipment for automotive bodyshop

loans.name: Erlima

texts.en:
Erlima M. is from the village of Panghiawan, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 40 years old. Erlima is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Erlima owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling home products like casseroles, blankets and plates in the local community. Erlima has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Erlima joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Erlima is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like forks and spoons. This will be the first loan taken out by Erlima from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like forks and spoons

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es: Maria Concepcion G. tiene 34 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos, y junto a su familia reside en el barrio La Soledad en la ciudad de Juticalpa, Olancho. Desde hace 10 años Maria se dedica a la elaboracion de tortillas de maiz de forma artesanal, ella comenzò a hacerlo porque su esposo quedò sin trabajo y solamente èl aportaba dinero para el hogar, asi que se vieron en una dificil situacion economica. Maria pensò en muchas formas de como ayudarlo pero finalmente recordò que su abuela le habia enseñado hacer tortillas de maiz, y asi fue como ella instalò al frente de su casa una venta de tortillas que atiende desde las 6:00 am hasta las 12:00 del mediodia. Maria solicita el prestamo para comprar varios sacos de maseca y un tanque de gas domestico. Con el apoyo del prestamo podra seguir teniendo una entrada de dinero que le permitira ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento del hogar. Gracias a Dios Maria por los momentos no atraviesa dificultades ni problemas. Su meta es tener una tortilleria industrial y contar con varios empleados para asi seguir apoyando a sus hijos con el estudio. Es su primer ciclo en FAMA y espera cumplir con puntualidad el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Maria Concepcion G. is 34 years old, married and has two children.  She lives with her family in La Soledad neighborhood, in the city of Juticalpa, Olancho.

For the past ten years, Maria has been making corn tortillas by hand.  She started in this business because her husband lost his job.  He had been the only one who supported their household so they found themselves in a difficult financial situation.  Maria thought of many ways in which to help but she finally remembered that her grandmother had taught her how to make corn tortillas and so set up a tortilla stand outside the front of home and she serves there from 6.00am to 12.00pm.

Maria is requesting this loan to buy several sacks of Maseca corn flour and a canister of gas.  The support of this loan will enable her to continue making money which will allow her to help her husband to support their household.  Thanks to God, Maria currently has no difficulties of problems.  Her goal is to own an industrial tortilla bakery with several employees so that she can continue supporting her children in their studies.  This is her first loan cycle with FAMA and she hopes to be punctual in making her loan repayments.

loans.use: To buy Maseca corn flour and a canister of gas

loans.name: Demna

texts.en:
48-year-old Demna Y. is from the town of Banga.  She is married.  To make a living, Demna owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale.  Demna said she wants to be a good mother to her kids and also a good neighbor.

Demna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Demna has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI.  Demna is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, chemicals and fertilizers.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, chemicals and fertilizers.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Mrs. Phan S. is a 24-year-old married woman who lives in the Spean Daek village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Cheoum Vichay, earn their living by fishing.  They have one child who is 6 years old and not in school. Mrs. S.'s husband is in the picture with her.   

Mrs. S. would like to request a loan to support her fishing.  Aside from farmer, she also earns a living by selling groceries. With their carriers, they are able to earn a little income to support their family.

loans.use: To support her fishing.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel, de 53 años; es una mujer trabajadora que enviudó hace 20 años. Sola cuidó de sus 2 hijos, y sus 3 nietos en su casa propia ubicada en el Puente Paucartambo (selva central peruana). Sus trabajadoras manos y su exquisita sazón producen los ricos tamales que vende a los comerciantes de que salen todas las mañanas en las orillas del puente. Diariamente vende un promedio de 300 tamales. En los 30 años que viene dedicándose a este negocio, adquirió buenos clientes, e incluso los pobladores de la ciudad viajan en las festividades que se realiza durante el año para comprar los ricos tamales que prepara Maribel. Pero como ella posee terrenos agrícolas donde siembra plátanos; está pensando sembrar conjuntamente maíz, y de esa manera minimizar los costos de harina para la elaboración de tamales. Ya compró una máquina de moler y con esto está segura que podrá obtener mayores ganancias. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “comerciantes”, y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, donde es una de las pioneras que fundó su asociación. Maribel, constantemente compra insumos para la preparación de sus tamales; por ello con el crédito comprará semillas de maíz para esparcirlos en sus cultivos y así minimizar costos, ya que comprando maíz gasta más dinero.
texts.en:
Maribel, age 53, is a hardworking woman who has been widowed for twenty years. She has taken care of her two children and her three grandchildren from her own home in Puente Paucartambo (which is in the central Peruvian jungle). Her hardworking hands produce the exquisite taste of the rich tamales she sells at the edge of a bridge that merchants must cross every morning. She sells an average of 300 tamales each day. Maribel has been in this business for thirty years and acquired good customers, which include residents of the city. They travel to the festivals held throughout the year just to buy the rich tamales that Maribel prepares. In addition, she owns farmland on which she grows bananas. She plans to grow corn as well so that she can minimize the cost of cornmeal used for making tamales. Maribel has already purchased a milling machine to help her secure better earnings.

She belongs to the Communal Bank “Comerciantes” (Merchants) and is taking her eighth loan from MFP. Maribel is one of the pioneers who founded her group. She is always buying supplies for preparing her tamales, so she will use the loan to buy seeds for planting corn. This will minimize her costs since she currently spends a great deal of money when buying corn.

loans.use: Purchase seeds for planting corn

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en:
Ludy S. is from the village of Olango, Mallig, Isabela. She is 44 years-old. Ludy is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Ludy owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ludy has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 35,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2011, Ludy joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ludy is requesting a new loan of 27,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ludy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Merly

texts.en: Merly is a married woman who lives in Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a sari-sari store. Her husband Rey, who is 41 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have two children who are 9 and 15 years old. Merly joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Merly has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to purchase stock for her store so that she can continue to save up for the future. Merly is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.fr:
Marie Claire est âgée de 52ans, mère de 2grands enfants qui sont âgés de 33 et 34ans.
Elle détient un restaurant  à son domicile  depuis 2ans ou elle fait des plats quotidiens pour attirer ses client.
 Ses ventes journalières sont de 25.000F et 45.000F quand les temps sont bons.
Avec le prêt  actuel, elle achètera 1carton de poissons salés, un panier de poissons fumé, du poisson d’eau douce, 1sac de riz, 1bidon d’huile, 1filet d’oignons, 1sac de charbon.
 
Son soucis majeur est de  persévérer dans l’alimentaire pour accroitre ses revenus afin d’avoir un prêt très important dans les cycles suivants.
Très rigoureuse, elle tient que son deuxième fils aille se spécialiser en médecine dans un pays plus structuré en la matière.
texts.en: Marie Claire is 52 years old and the mother of two grown children, 33 and 34 years old.  For two years, she has been keeping a restaurant at her home, preparing everyday dishes for her clients. Her daily receipts range between 25,000 and 45,000 West African Francs, when things are going well. With this loan, she will purchase a box of salted fish, a basket of smoked fish, some freshwater fish, one bag of rice, one jug of oil, one string of onions, one bag of charcoal. Her main concern is to be able to grow her food business to increase her revenues and be able to take out larger loans in subsequent cycles. Very serious, she insists that her second son  should do his medical training in a country with better infrastructure.

loans.use: to purchase a box of salted fish, a basket of smoked fish, some freshwater fish, one bag of rice, one jug of oil, etc.

loans.name: Doru

texts.en: Doru C. is 30 years old. Currently she is in a business selling food. Married to a businessman, they have three children all of them in school. Her future goal is to open a big shop.

loans.use: to stock more food.

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en:
Nhem S. is a low-income entrepreneur who earns a living by planting and harvesting rice crops on her farmland. She is able to earn about $2.50 per day from her farming business to help provide for the needs of the family. Nhem S.’s husband is a fisherman who catches and sells fish from  the river near his village. 

Nhem S. will use her loan to purchase a piece of fertile farmland, which will allow her to enlarge her crop-growing endeavors during the time that her existing land is fallow. 

She and her husband have a baby (shown in the picture) and two children enrolled in school.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of fertile farmland in order to expand her farming business

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
La Sra. Blanca tiene 48 años y  esta casada con el Sr. Fabian de 44  años, cuentan con 3 hijos, 2 mujeres y un varón, una de ellas de 30 años está trabajando y otra de 17 se encuentra en la Universidad, el varon de 23 años trabaja también.
Siempre se dedicaron a la venta de frutas y verduras, su marido es constructor, lo cual genera también ingresos para la familia, pero principalmente cuentan con un puesto en el mercado de Luque con varios clientes.
Le gustaría que sus hijos estudien y que terminen su carrera en la universidad, por ello solicita este préstamo a modo de poder invertirlo en la compra de mayores cantidades de frutas y verduras, a fin de producir un mayor ingreso económico.
Ella espera poder contar con esta ayuda que solicita a Kiva.
texts.en:
Señora Blanca, aged 48, is married to Señor Fabián, aged 44. They have three children, two daughters and one son. Her 30-year-old daughter has a job, her 17-year old daughter studies at the University and her 23-year-old son is also working.

Blanca has always been selling fruits and vegetables. Her husband is a builder, whose salary helps providing for the family. However, to earn their living they rely mostly on Blanca's market stall in Luque and her many customers.

She would like to see her children study and complete their university studies. Therefore, she applies for this loan to invest in her business and buy large quantities of fruits and vegetables, so as to get a higher income. She hopes that she can count on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Maria Ermelinda

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, se dedica a la venta D. sopa D. puya, chilate y tamales, este negocio lo realiza en su propia casa, ofreciendo a sus amigos y vecinos, el negocio lo realiza desD. hace 12 años.
Ella necesita un préstamo e invertirlo en materiales para la preparación D. la venta como por ejemplo, verduras, condimentos, maíz, pollo, aceite, con esta compra mejorara la calidad D. su negocio, manteniendo todo lo necesario para continuar produciendo y vendiendo alimentos.
Lo que María espera es que su negocio aumente, sea más rentable para ayudar D. una mejor manera a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband and two children and works selling tripe soup, ‘chilate’ (a Central American drink maD. from peppers, corn and cocoa) and tamales. She works from her house, selling to her friends and neighbors, and has been in this business for 12 years.

She needs a loan to invest in materials for preparing the food to sell, such as vegetables, condiments, corn, chicken and oil. She will improve the quality of her business with this purchase, having everything necessary to continue making and selling food.

María hopes that her business will increase and will be more profitable so that she can better help her children.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, corn, chicken and oil.

loans.name: Aida's Group

texts.en:
Aida, 21, is the leader of this group. She is married and has a young son. In 2008 she started a cattle breeding business with the purchase of a calf. With the generated revenue she has purchased furniture for her house. She plans to do further work in this business and therefore needs to broaden it. The purpose of the loan is to purchase additional heads of cattle. Aida’s dream is to purchase her own house. 

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit:  www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at  www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE HUANCA”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Calca en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alicia; la socia tiene 31 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, La socia tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 1 años y 6 meses de edad; La socia se dedica al comercio minorista, la socia cría animales menores como cuyes, gallinas, pollos, chanchos tiernos y cuando logran la madurez y la procreación de alguno de ellos la socia los lleva a vender en el mercado central en Calca, la socia abastece de cuyes a los restaurantes típicos en la zona del valle sagrado y ahora ella requiere el crédito para poder comprar cuyes al por mayor y un par de chanchos, la socia desea invertir en su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar cuyes al por mayor y un par de chanchos tiernos.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the SEÑOR DE HUANCA communal bank located in the Calca district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

She is Alicia, 31, in a common-law marriage and she has 2 children of 5 and 1 and ½.  She sells retail and raises small animals such as guinea pigs, hens, chickens, and piglets.  When they are grown and some have given birth, the member takes them to the central market in Calca to sell.  She supplies the guinea pigs to “typical” restaurants in the sacred valley and she now needs a loan to buy guinea pigs wholesale and a pair of piglets.  She would like to invest in the business and she is requesting the financing to buy the guinea pigs and piglets.

She is grateful for the support offered her and promises to make the payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and a pair of piglets wholesale

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Sang and her husband earn an income by making bamboo beaded curtains at their house. Sang is 45 years old, married and has a son. She lives with her husband and son in Ho Chi Minh City.

Sang intends to use her loan to buy materials such as bamboo beads and silk thread to produce a greater number of different kinds of curtains. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve the family's living conditions and send her son to school.

loans.use: to buy materials such as bamboo beads and silk thread.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Bonifacia has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Bonifacia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Bonifacia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Saheb

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 44 years old, married and has three children, one of whom works.

Saheb has been an owner of a coffee shop since 2005. He has a good experience in this field and has a good reputation. His coffee shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $2,900 loan in order to renovate and fix his shop’s furniture and to purchase a generator. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to renovate and fix his shop’s furniture and to purchase a generator.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 50 years old.  He is a mixed crop farmer, and is married to Judy, who is also a farmer. They are blessed with two children, aged 25 and 23 years, respectively.  He has been a farmer for the past ten years, with a monthly income of KES 12,000, which he uses to support his family members.


He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer.  Samuel will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.  With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children up to university level. 


His hopes and dreams are to venture into greenhouse farming and keep dairy cows, which will improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Lesbia Maria

texts.es:
En  la cuidad de Managua, la señora Lesbia María  trabaja desde hace 3 años en su negocio de venta de frutas y verduras.Es casada y con dos pequeños hijos a los que tiene que proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen.

La señora  visitó nuestra oficina  para solicitar un crédito ya que quiere invertirlo  en el negocio de frutas y verduras que tiene en su casa de habitación. Es importante destacar que por medio  de este préstamo la señora va a poder incrementar su negocio y así obtener mejores ganancia en sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lesbia Maria has been working in the city of Managua for 3 years on her fruit and vegetable business. She is married with two small children, and needs to provide her children with the necessary living conditions in order for them to develop. 

She visited the CEPRODEL office to request a loan that she will invest in her fruit and vegetable business that she runs out of her home. It is important to highlight that through this loan, Lesbia Maria will be able to grow her business and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Rimando

texts.en:
This is Rimando, 54, resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. He is married to Elizabeth, the mother of their children. Rimando, together with his wife and children, manage their household while operating a business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Rimando operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They sell these to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries, factories, and others of the like. Rimando's regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of 1000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. He will be incorporating the loan into his current revolving fund used to buy trash from collectors. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Rimando hopes to be able to expand soon, just as he fervently hopes that his children will be able to graduate one day and finish their studies. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for scrap materials for his business.

loans.name: Kisiwa Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Kisiwa SHG in Western Kenya! Irine is the facilitator of the Kisiwa SHG group. Irine and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Irine takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Irine had an very good maize yield harvesting eight bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Irine was only able to harvest three bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Irine and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Irine will pay school fees for her kids, and possibly buy livestock. 

In 2012, the members of Kisiwa SHG group will each plant between ½ and one acre of maize. 

In the photograph above, Irine is pictured with her group members. Note that of the five women in this group, four are present, as one (Jackline) was being represented by her husband (far right) at the meeting during which this photograph was taken. On the far left is Irine's field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Simana Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Simana Group in Western Kenya! Rosemary is the facilitator of the group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Rosemary takes care of 10 children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to feed her family and access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Rosemary had an excellent maize yield harvesting 8 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Rosemary was only able to harvest 2 1/2 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rosemary and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Rosemary will ensure food security and educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Simana group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Rosemary is pictured in the photograph with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Nelly Margarita

texts.es:
Nelly de 56 años, ha seguido con su negocio de gabinete, en la cual le ha ido muy bien con el préstamo anterior y  con la ayuda de Dios ha salido adelante.

Ahora ella solícita un nuevo préstamo para el incremento de su negocio comprando cemento, arena y comprar tintes  donde quiere poner otro local del mismo negocio pero en otra parte de la urbe.

Su sueño es q sus negocios crezcan en donde ella pueda brindar empleo, también  en donde ella pueda tener ingresos económicos muy bueno.
texts.en:
Nelly is 56 years old.  She has continued with her small business, which has been going very well for her.  With her previous loan and the help of God, she has been able to make progress.

She is now requesting a new loan to extend her business by buying cement and sand, and purchasing hair dye.  She wants to open a second premises in the same line of business, but in a different part of the city.

Her dream is that her businesses will grow to the extent that she can provide employment to others, and also so that she will have a very good income.

loans.use: para incrementar su negocio comprando cemento, arena y comprar tintes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sherly

texts.es: Sherly, de 27 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Luis, su esposo desde hace 6 años. Ambos esperan la llegada de su próximo hijo quien tiene 6 meses en la barriguita de su mamá. Y juntos vive en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Pilcomayo. Desde joven comenzó a trabajar por si sola. Pues su lema es “progresar”.  Su principal actividad es la venta de comida, en sus inicios tenía un restaurante, donde vendía comida casera. Con el tiempo adquirió un lugar más atractivo, pues se ubicaba en una zona céntrica; ahí comenzó a vender tamales, café, jugos y bebidas diversas. Ella trabaja sin descanso de lunes a domingo sin parar, ya que de esa manera obtendrá buenos resultados. A la par con su crecimiento, afrontó un nuevo reto, se casó y conformo una familia, la que ahora se fortaleza con la llegado de su primer hijo. Luis, aparte de ser un esposo ejemplar es un policía responsable que vela por el bienestar de la sociedad. Su objetivo ahora, es invertir en su restaurante y hacerlo conocido. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores crédito. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Sherly de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de materiales de calidad, para revestir el cuarto de su próximo bebe, “ya le falta poco” menciona.
texts.en: Sherly is 27 years old and is a hardworking woman. She has lived with Luis, her husband, for 6 years. They are both awaiting the arrival of their next child, as she is six months pregnant. They live together in their own home, located in the community of Pilcomayo. Since she was young, she has worked for herself, since her motto is "progress". Her main activity is selling food. At first she had a restaurant where she sold homemade food. Over time she acquired a more attractive place, located in a central area. There she started to sell tamales, coffee, juice and different beverages. She works tirelessly Monday through Sunday without stopping, since that's the only way to get results. As she experienced her growth, she faced a new challenge. She married and joined a family, which gives her strength now that she is awaiting her first child. Luis, besides being an exemplary husband, is a responsible police officer who watches out for society's wellbeing. Her goal now is to invest in her restaurant and make it known. This is her fourth loan with MFP, where she hopes to have your cooperation to cement her plans. She also promises to make her payments on time, as she did with previous loans. She also likes being a part of the association because all of its members are responsible people and very supportive. Upon receiving your help, Sherly will invest the money she has asked for in buying quality materials to remodel her new baby's room. 'It's almost done", she remarks.

loans.use: to improve the infrastructure in her baby's room.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en: Phally, 31, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Phally is employed at the factory, and her husband is a construction worker. Phally is requesting a loan of USD 300 to purchase fertilizers and rice seeds to do farming. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds to farm

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime es un hombre de 30 años que vive en la Ciudadela 20 de Julio, sector del sur de la ciudad de Barranquilla,  que combina empresas, centros comerciales, actividades formales e informales, conjuntos residenciales y viviendas populares, que forman parte de la selecta clientela que compra en el restaurante de Jaime, donde vende desayunos, almuerzos y comidas, típicas, rápidas y corrientes desde el año 2009, cuando dio inicio a esta actividad. Su clientela principal son empleados oficinistas, operarios, vecinos, amigos, familiares y referidos;  tiene dos empleados, maneja una competencia alta, pero se sostiene por calidad, higiene, precios justos y amabilidad en el trato a sus clientes ,  además de estar ubicado en su casa familiar, de esquina, y cerca de grandes superficies comerciales, donde tiene como clientes a empleados.  Sus ventas las realiza de contado y a crédito, con plazos hasta de 15 días. Vive en la casa de su señora madre (quien está en Venezuela), con su esposa, actualmente  con  ocho meses de embarazo y su hijo de cuatro años.
Su sueño de crecimiento empresarial es inagotable y es esta es la razón por la cual está aplicando a un credikiva, su primer crédito en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, pues desea impactar a su clientela en este fin de año. Con su financiamiento comprará insumos para elaborar comidas especiales, en estas fechas especiales como la Navidad y Año Nuevo.
texts.en:
Jaime is a 30-year-old man living in Ciudadela 20 de Julio in the south part of the city of Barranquilla which combines firms, shopping centers, formal and informal activities, residential complexes and low-cost housing which form part of the select clientele that patronizes Jaime’s restaurant.  He has been selling breakfasts, lunches, dinners, traditional meals, fast food and daily menus since 2009 when he started the business.

His main customers are office workers, employees, neighbors, friends, family members and referred customers.  He has two employees and a high level of competition but he stays in business because of quality, cleanliness, fair prices and the kind customer service he provides.  Besides, it’s located in a family home, on a corner and near large commercial expanses where he has the employees there as customers.  His sales are both cash and credit; he gives up to 15 days to pay.  He lives in his mother’s house (she’s in Venezuela) with his wife who is currently in her eighth month of pregnancy and their four-year-old son.

His dream of business growth is inexhaustible and this is the reason he’s applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, because he wants to impact his clientele this end of year.  He will use the loan to buy ingredients to prepare special meals for the special dates that are Christmas and New Year.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make special meals for special end-of-year festivities.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Cidade de Maputo, Provincia do mesmo nome, Sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 5 filhos que frequentam a Escola. Fez a 6ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

É negociante ha mais de 6 anos e vende produtos diversos tem um rendimento de cerca de 6.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 18.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar fardos de roupa usada para revenda. O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 12.000.00mt.   
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende fazer crescer o seu negocio , para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the town of Maputo, in the province of the same name, in southern Mozambique. She is single and has five children who attend school. She completed 6th grade and stopped for lack of financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and does not support anyone else.
She has been a businesswoman for over six years. She sells various products and earns an income of about 6.000mt a month. She uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in her bank account.
She has never had loans in other banks. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her second loan with Hluvuku. It is for 18.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase loads of used clothing for reselling. The first loan was for 12.000mt.
She pledges to repay as scheduled. In the future she plans to expand her business and for that purpose she intends to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase loads of used clothing for reselling.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres luchadoras nace mediante la gestión de una de las miembros del grupo, quien motivaba en la idea de un bien para sus vecinas al incentivo y de allí surge el comité. Actualmente está integrado por 17 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad, se encuentran en el octavo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya.
Una de las miembros es la señora Maria, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo. Ella comenta que con mucho sacrificio empezó, pero que  gracias a su esfuerzo y su trabajo, además de la ayuda de fundación pudo crecer y seguir adelante. Una de sus metas es tener una gran tienda donde vender sus prendas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de verano, con lo cual podrá surtirse y de esa forma ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
These fighting women formed a group at the suggestion of one of the members who put forth the idea for the good of her neighbors, and this was their encouragement, and from there this communal bank came about. There are currently 17 women, all of them friends and neighbors, who are in the 8th cycle of the program for women entrepreneurs of the Fundación Paraguaya (Paraguayan Foundation).

One of the members is Maria, who works selling all kinds of clothing. She comments that she began with a lot of sacrifice, but thanks to her efforts and work and the help of the foundation she could grow and get ahead.

One of her goals is to have a big store where she can sell her garments.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy summer clothing, with which she can stock up and be able to offer a greater variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Stephanie

texts.en:
Stephanie is 35 years old and married. She has two children aged twelve and five.

For the past fifteen years Stephanie has sold food such as chips in order to earn a living. She has three employees.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya Stephanie has been able to expand her business. She is applying for a 100,000 KES loan to buy a beef fryer, forks, knifes and a juice machine.

Stephanie hopes to own a big hotel someday.

loans.use: to buy a beef fryer, forks, knifes and a juice machine.

loans.name: Artemio

texts.en:
Artemio is 33 years old, married and has three children.  He lives in the Philippines.  Artemio has a shop that sells firewood and fish such as sardines and trout. He has had this business for 10 years. 

Artemio is requesting a loan for 9,000 PHP, which he will use to buy fish and firewood to sell.  In the future, Artemio hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase fish and firewood.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora  se dedica a la producción de quesos, su esposo trabaja como maestro albañil en la ciudad de la Paz, vive con uno solo de sus hijos puesto que los demás ya conformaron su familia propia, los quesos que Ella elabora los vende directamente el publico en días de feria de  de Viacha, considerada ya una ciudad intermedia.
Actualmente vive en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Achica Baja del municipio de Viacha a dos   horas de viaje de la ciudad de La Paz, cuenta con  algunas cabezas de ganado  las cuales le proporcionan leche, con la que elabora su producción de queso en condiciones sumamente higiénicas de tal manera que sus quesos son muy limpios y de mejor calidad.
El crédito  requiere para comprar una vaca lechera y así incrementar su producción de queso

El sueño de Flora es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado.
Es la tercera  vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Flora works producing cheese and her husband’s a master builder in the city of La Paz.  She lives just with one of her children for the rest have already formed their own families.  She sells the cheese she make directly to the public on market days in Viacha which is now considered to be a medium-size city.

She currently lives in her own house located in the community of Achica Baja in Viacha municipality, a two-hour trip from the city of La Paz.  She owns a few head of cattle that produce the milk she uses to make the cheese in highly hygienic conditions to guarantee the cleanliness and high quality of the cheese.  

She needs the loan to buy a dairy cow to increase cheese production.  Flor’s dream is to buy a dairy cow to increase cheese production.  This is her third IMPRO loan request and second with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en: Scovia is a 43 year old married woman. She has a duty of taking care of her 6 children of whom 5 are school going. She is a farmer who deals in produce where she buys and sells maize and coffee mostly as her main source of income and has been in the business for the previous 6 years. She has applied for her first loan of UGX 2,000,000 from Kiva through Hofokam Limited, Uganda to obtain more maize and coffee for her produce business so that she can give her family the best standards of living with the proceeds.

loans.use: to buy more maize and coffee for her produce shop.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en: Carmen H. is a mother of 3 and is 42 years old. Although she lives in Duran, her dental office is located in Guayaquil. She has just a little less than 20 years of experience in the field and is interested in investing in new tools that will help her be more efficient and offer better service to her clients. She currently opens at 6 AM and works diligently until 8 PM. She seems to be very responsible and highly dedicated to her work.

loans.use: Dental tools

loans.name: Ezathullah

texts.en:
Ezatullah was born in 1981 and lives in a household of 4 in district 1 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Ezatullah, who has a 4 years' experience in this business, has a shop near his house selling ice creams and soft drinks. He took a 2nd cycle loan through AFSG to buy more materials for his shop. His family also helps him with his business by cleaning apples and bananas and picking up soft drink bottles. Then he sells them in the bazaar and with the process he makes more money.

loans.use: To buy apples, bananas and soft drinks

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Nkurankan, Ghana is a large market centre for the people of the Yilo Krobo District of Ghana. Madame Juliana is a resident of this town and cooks palm kernel oil and sells it at the market. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation, and is seeking a Kiva loan of $750.00 to help her improve her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Muzafar

texts.en: Muzafar A. has been in the trading business for 10 years. He is married and has three children. He started his business from one small booth with $80 worth of goods. In 2002 he became a client of Microinvest. Today his revenue is $1400. His little shop is located in one of the central markets of Pandjshanbe. Since he has been in the business a long time, he has many clients. He is intuitive and responds quickly to customers demands. He would like to reopen his shop in a new location where he can store a larger inventory of goods.

loans.use: To purchase his own shop

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
For the past seven years, Nataliya has sold cosmetic items and household cleaning products from her kiosk in the central market of Melitopol. A mother of two sons, Nataliya uses her income to support her children, her elderly parents, and her brother. Hard working and sacrificial, Nataliya is committed to improving her family’s future by ensuring the ongoing success of her business. She is communicative and polite, focused on serving the needs of her clients.

Currently, Nataliya is seeking a loan of $600 to purchase additional inventory and expand her variety of merchandise. With the additional profits, Nataliya plans to develop her business further and expand her clientele base. With a perfect credit history, a commitment to the success of her business, and a strong dedication to the welfare of her family, Nataliya represents the ideal client to invest in with micro-finance.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Maria Asunción

texts.es:
My name is Maria Asunción,. I am a business woman and I've been running a grocery store out of my home for several years now. I have gained a lot of experience in business, and thanks to this store I have been able to generate income and take care of my family. I am very happy with my business because I have improved my home life and and have given my children the opportunity to have an education - right now they are studying.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Mi nombre es Maria Asunción, soy comerciante y tengo una pulperia, ubicada en mi casa de habitación desde hace varios años, cuento con mucha experiencia en este tipo de actividad, gracias a este negocio puedo generar ingresos y cuidar de mi familia, me siento muy contenta con mi negocio ya que he mejorado mi vivienda y mis hijos tiene la oportunidad de preparase, actualmente ellos estan estudiando.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, lard, rice, eggs, soaps, pastas and dairy items to sell in the grocery store.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús lives in his parent's house on Tacagua Avenue in the Tacagua neighborhood of La Paz. He sells candles, incense, buttons, etc. With this activity, he supports his children. Two years ago he was separated from his wife. The loan that he is asking for will be used to increase his inventory of merchandise in order to continue selling to his customers. He hasn't taken a loan with our institution (IMPRO) before; this will be his first. But the socioeconomic evaluation shows his capacity to pay off the debt, endorsed by his extensive experience in this business.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Jesús vive en casa de sus padres en la av. Tacagua de la zona Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz. La actividad que realiza es la venta de velas, sahumerios, botones etc. Con esta actividad el mantiene a sus hijos ya que hace dos años esta separado de la esposa; el crédito que solicita es para aumentar su mercadería y continuar con sus ventas a sus clientes. No tiene antecedente con nuestra Institución; este será su primer crédito, pero la evaluación socio-económica muestra su capacidad de pago de la deuda, avalada por su amplia experiencia en su actividad.

loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise.

loans.name: Laura's Group

texts.es:
This group is an extension of an older group. The contact for this group is one of the women who used to work for the Municipality of Asunción. She held an informational meeting about Fundación Paraguaya, which various women attended.

They then decided to form the group, and today they all work and they pay their loans jointly. They all do different types of business such as the sale of wallets, shoes, fast food and jewelry and others have general stores and kiosks.

Today they hope to receive a loan to buy different types of merchandise depending on each of their businesses, among other products they would like to purchase sugar, flour, meat, vegetables, fruits, wallets, jewelry, shoes and cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Este Comité es un desprendimiento de un grupo antiguo. El contacto con este grupo una de las señoras que en ese entonces trabajaba en la Municipalidad de Asunción. Ella invito a la reunión informativa acerca de la Fundación Paraguaya, donde asistieron varias señoras.

Decidieron entonces conformar su grupo, y hoy día todas trabajan y pagan de forma solidaria sus créditos. Ellas se dedican a distintos tipos de actividades como ventas de carteras, zapatos, comidas rápidas, joyas, otras poseen despensa y, kioscos.

Hoy día desean adquirir un préstamo para comprar diferentes tipos de mercaderías dependiendo de la actividad de cada una, entre otros podemos citar: azúcar, harina, carne, vegetales, frutas, carteras, joyas, zapatos, cosméticos, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, flour, meat, vegetables, fruits, wallets, jewelry, shoes, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Ana Maria's Group

texts.en:
Ambrosia and Ana Maria are members of the community bank “Señor de Huarca”. They have been members for eight months and two years respectively. In that time they have learned to save and to be punctual.

Ambrosia is 43 years old and has three children. She has owned a bakery for the past four years. She gets up early in the morning and makes “chapla,” a traditional bread, as well as other types of bread. She must travel to different markets to buy grain but prefers not to travel too much.

Ana Maria is 23 years old and has three children. She is also a baker and has owned her bakery for two years. Before that she sold grains and operated a small farm. However, her farm was not producing enough.

Ambrosia and Ana Maria need loans of 600 and 1600 soles (3 soles = $1) respectively, which they will invest in buying flour, butter, yeast, and other things needed to make bread. The community bank emphasizes the importance of saving and each associate has an interest earning account. Ambrosia and Ana Maria are saving so that they have greater freedom and do not have to worry about unexpected expenses. Their dreams are to continue their progress, develop their businesses, and move out of poverty.

loans.use: The group will invest in buying flour, butter, yeast, and other things needed to make bread.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Mrs. Chan L., 52, is a mother of three children and works as a vegetables seller, making about $5 profit daiL.. Her husband, Mr. Leng Krei, 54, is a police officer and earns about $2 a day. One of their children earns about $100 a month and the other two are students. To expand their business, this couple is requesting a loan from Kiva of $300 to purchase more vegetables to sell in bulk.

loans.use: This couple will use the loan to purchase more vegetables to sell in bulk.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Mrs. Meas S. is a 47-year-old widow living in Dam Dek Commune of Siem Reap Province. She resides with her four children, one of whom is married. Her family responsibilities require her to work hard everyday making food for and raising pigs,  which earns her $4 per day. However, this income is not enough to support her children’s education, so she seeks a $300 loan to purchase more pigs, as well as wood to renovate her home so she can raise pigs more efficiently. Through this loan, S. hopes to generate additional business income and provide for her children’s future.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and wood.

loans.name: Sandra Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Sandra is 38 years old, she lives in an area close to the capital known as Ticuantepe, she is married, has two children, one goes to school and the other is still a baby. Her husband is a security guard and also dedicated to farming on a small piece of land that they own. Doña Sandra works at the “Ministerio de Salud” (health ministry) of Ticuantepe and she is also dedicated to farming. One of her big dreams is to increase production of her crops and thus increase her income to be able to improve the living conditions of her family. The loan requested by doña Sandra will be spent on buying fertilizer and other farming supplies needed to obtain a good production.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Sandra tiene 38 años, vive en una zona cercana a nuestra capital conocida como Ticuantepe, ella es casada, tiene dos hijos uno en edad escolar y otro que esta tierno. Su esposo es guarda de seguridad y también se dedica a la agricultura en una pequeña parcela de tierra que poseen. Doña Sandra trabaja en el Ministerio de Salud de Ticuantepe y a la vez se dedica a la Agricultura, uno de sus grandes anhelos es aumentar la producción en sus cultivos y por ende aumentar sus ingresos, que son los que le van a ayudar a vivir en mejores condiciones de vida a ella y a su familia. El préstamo doña Sandra lo esta solicitando para invertir el dinero en compra de abono y otros insumos agrícolas que se necesitan para lograr una buena producción.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and farming supplies to improve crops.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa N. sells bowls, towels, and plastics. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a fisherman and his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. Business is going very well, so Adjoa wishes to increase sales and improve her income. But she is running out of stock.

She is asking for a loan to buy more goods for sale

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Chhon

texts.en: Chhon S., 29, is a garment worker and earns $2 each day. Her husband is a member of stage performance in the village. They have a young child. Even though both husband and wife are profitable they still cannot support their family. So right now Chhon and her husband would like a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike to run their business. This will give them extra profit to provide for their family.

loans.use: Chhon would like to purchase a motorbike to run her business.

loans.name: Angela María

texts.es:
Ms. Angela B. has many years of experience in the business. At this time, she has two businesses: a stationery store and a snack bar in which she sells sandwiches, nachos, corn, and other types of fast food. She has previously obtained two loans with FVP, which she has promptly repaid.

Ms. B. is requesting a loan with Kiva so that she can purchase merchandise for her stationery store and kitchen essentials for her snack bar. She is the only one who runs the businesses.

Ms. B. is married and has two children. The businesses are the family’s main sources of income, along with her husband’s salary.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Angela María tiene muchos años de experiencia en el negocio. Al momento cuenta con dos negocios uno de papelería y otro de venta de lonches, nachos, elotes y otros tipos de comida. Ella ya ha tenido dos préstamos con FVP los cuales los pago puntualmente.

La Sra. Angela está solicitando un préstamo a Kiva para la compra de mercancía para la papelería y artículos de cocina para la lonchería. Ella es la única que atiende los negocios.

La Sra. Angela está casada y tiene dos hijos. Los negocios son la fuente principal de ingresos de la familia, además del sueldo que recibe el esposo por su trabajo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for stationery store and items for snack bar

loans.name: Houndjénouko

texts.fr:
Née en 1967 à Tokplitomé, Madame A. Houndjénouko vit aujourd’hui auprès de son mari dans le village de Tékponou II. Mère de cinq enfants, elle mène le commerce de béliers. 

Elle achète ces béliers et les revend de marché en marché. Selon elle, cette activité est très rentable mais à condition que les fonds soient disponibles. Ainsi, cette dame sollicite un crédit pour faire face valablement à cette activité et améliorer son revenu.

Ceci aura un impact positif sur la vie de tous les jours de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1967 in Tokplitomé, Mrs Houndjénouko A. currently lives with her husband in the villge of Tékponou II. The mother of five children, she manages a business of rams (buying and selling). She purchases rams and re-sells them at the saturday market. According to her, this activity is very profitable but only if funds are available. Thus, this woman is asking for a loan in order to continue to take part in this activity and increase her revenues. This would have a positive impact on the every day life of her family.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying and selling rams

loans.name: Hindou

texts.fr:
Dame S. Hindou est née le 31 décembre 1979 à Badou, localité dans laquelle abonde la banane. Actuellement elle réside à Agoè et s’est mariée à monsieur WADJANA qui est un chauffeur. Elle a deux enfants qui font le cours primaire. Elle fait le commerce de cola et de gingembre au grand marché de Lomé, activité qu’elle a commencé depuis 2004.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 04 sacs de cola et de 06 sacs de gingembre.
texts.en:
Ms. Hindou S. was born on December 31, 1979 in Badou, a town where bananas abound. She currently resides in Agoè and is married to Mr. WADJANA, who is a driver. She has two children attending primary school. She has been doing commerce in cola nuts and ginger at the grand marketplace of Lomé since 2004. This initial loan that she is requesting will allow her to buy four sacks of cola nuts and six sacks of ginger.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cola nuts and ginger

loans.name: Koy

texts.en: Koy V., 39, has a business taking care the public toilets and gets a commission from her work. She also sells some stuff, such as ice-cream and soft drinks, there to earn an approximately US $10 in revenue. Her husband is a guard who takes care of the public garden in front of the Royal Palace, Phnom Penh city. He makes US $2 each day as well. This couple has two children, all of whom are students. Koy V. would like to take out a loan of US $1000 to buy more stuff to sell in front of the toilets. In the future, if she has enough money, she wants to become a grocery dealer. (She is pictured on the left hand.)

loans.use: Purchasing more stuff for sale

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es:
Felicidad  vive en el manzano “D” patio 1   de la zona Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Es una joven madre soltera que tiene una hija de 5 años, vive junto a su madre.
 
 Se dedica a la elaboración de pan especial en el horno de su propia casa, los cuales los vende en diferentes negocios de la zona comercial de la ciudad y con cuyas ventas solventa sus estudios superiores y mantiene su hogar.

El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de harina e insumos para su negocio.
 
 
Es el segundo  crédito con Impro, y el segundo vía KIVA; la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Felicidad lives on manzano “D”, patio 1, of the Rio Seco zone in the city of El Alto.

She is a young single mother with a 5-year old daughter, and lives with her mother.

She dedicates herself to making specialty breads in an oven situated in her own home, which she sells to different businesses in the commercial zone of the city. These sales allow her to settle her educational expenses and help support the household.

The loan would be destined for the purchase of flour and ingredients for her business.

This is her second loan with Impro, and the second through Kiva; the evaluation conducted qualifies her to be granted the credit.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase flour and other supplies for her business making specialty breads.

loans.name: Lane Kuru Group

texts.en:
This is Isatu K., Mayeteh K. and Masiray T.. They named their group "Lane Kuru," a Temne word that  means “Trust in God”. They are local entrepreneurs from the town of Makeni. This is the fourth time that they’ve received a Kiva loan through SMT. Previously, each one of the group members received a loan of Le 600,000.00. That loan was a great help to members of this group. The proceeds they earned from the previous loan enabled them to educate, feed, clothe, and provide medical care to their children. Having repaid their previous loan successfully, they are now requesting a new loan for Le 800,000 to further strengthen their businesses and improve their living standards.

Isatu (right) is the leader of the group. She is twenty-eight years of age. She was born in Makeni and she is married with three children. Her husband is a teacher in one of the primary schools in Makeni. Two of their children are in secondary school and the other is in primary school. While social standards in Sierra Leone may call for the husband to bear the responsibility of feeding, clothing and educating the wife and kids, this is not feasible in Isatu’s household.  Isatu’s husband can not afford all this on his measly teaching salary. Isatu must work to support her family. Isatu sells palm-oil (the most popular and most abundant cooking oil in Sierra Leone) and rice in the town’s main market.

With this new loan, Isatu will expand on her business by buying about six “barters” of palm oil (five gallons make a barter). She will also buy a big bag of rice with the loan. A barter of palm oil costs her Le 80,000 in Makeni and a bag of rice cost her Le 108,000. 

With the extra profit the she will generate from this loan after providing for her family’s needs, Isatu plans to buy a plot of land and dreams of building a house.

loans.use: Buy six barters (30 gallons) of palm-oil

loans.name: Mercedes Adela

texts.es:
La señora  Mercedes Adela Z. Manrique, tiene 43 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Emprendedoras II y vive en la calle Sucre 664  del Puerto Marítimo Salaverry de la provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Mercedes es auxiliar de enfermería, trabajaba en el Centro de Salud de su sector, pero aun no comprende porque motivo la despidieron. Desde 22 años vive con su actual pareja, con quien tienen 4  hijos que aun son estudiantes.
Su negocio consiste en la venta de cerveza a domicilio y los fines de semana, prepara caldo de gallina, que vende en la casa de su suegra.
Hace algún tiempo se dedicó a la venta de ropa por lo que su primer crédito que fue de 200 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas lo invirtió en la compra de ropa para volver a vender.
Con este crédito de 1200 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas invertirá en compra de cerveza.
Mercedes sueña con tener un buen restaurant.
texts.en:
Mercedes Adela Z. Manrique is 43 years old, belongs to the “Enterprising Women II” cooperative bank, and lives in the Trujillo province located in La Libertad, Perú. Mercedes is a nursing assistant who worked at the Health Center of her area, and still does not understand the reason why she was dismissed. She has lived with her partner for 22 years, with whom she has four children who are still students. Her business consists of selling beer and, on weekends, she makes chicken soup which she sells in her mother-in-law’s house. Some time ago, she dedicated herself to clothing sales. With her first loan of 200.00 Peruvian soles, which she paid in four installments, she invested in clothing that she could turn around and sell. With this loan of 1,200.00 Peruvian soles, to be repaid in six installments, she will invest in the purchase of beer. Mercedes dreams of owning a good restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of beer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Additional capital for dress making

loans.name: Speranza's Group

texts.en:
N. Speranza is the chairperson of Mukisa group in Mubende. She is thirty-two years old and has been a teacher in the Tiger Barracks primary school in Mubende for 6 years.
