Currently she teaches Primary one single-handedly since each teacher is assigned to a class for all subjects. Through hard work, she is thankful that she is managing.

Speranza has managed a canteen at her primary school for 4 years where she sells snacks like chapattis, samosas, biscuits, and stationery like books, pencils, pens, erasers and reams of paper. During the holidays, Speranza switches to farming where she has banana plantations, sweet potatoes and cassava. She is married with 5 children, the youngest being 1 week old and she cares for 3 brothers and 3 sisters. She has benefited by building her own house, has a piggery business and rears local chickens.

She is grateful to the credit officer that when he took them on, they were many in the group, taking very little money with many defaulters. Now they are doing so well with the same number of members, taking more money with more successful businesses. She now needs a loan to help with restocking her canteen with more snacks as well as to employ manpower on her farm since most of the day she is at the school or attending to her baby.

loans.use: Restocking her canteen and labor on the farm.

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.es:
Pelagia es socia del Banco Comunal Los Sauces de Compañía, Paulina vive en la comunidad de Compañía que se encuentra a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Pelagia es casada, tiene 45 años y 4 hijos, Pelagia compra ladrillos de los productores de su comunidad y los comercializa en la ciudad de Ayacucho, para lo cual alquila carros. Además vende leña en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Pelagia necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña.
Los sueños de Pelagia son tener capital propio, construir una casa para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Pelagia lives in Compañía, about 40 minutes from Ayacucho city, and is a member of the Los Sauces de Compañía Communal Bank. She is 45, married, and has 4 children. Pelagia buys bricks from local producers and sells them in Ayacucho, transporting them in rented trucks. She also sells firewood in Ayacucho's markets, and needs a loan of 900 soles to buy more firewood to sell. Pelagia dreams of having the resources to build a house for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Juana Elizabeth

texts.en:
Juana is 38 years old and a widow with two children: a 20-year-old son and a 15-year old daughter. Juana is a member of the Santo Domingo Village Bank in Cusco, Peru. She has an auto accessory/car parts store in Wanchaq, a commercial district of Cusco. She has been running the store for the past 11 or 12 years. It belonged to her husband, and when he passed away, she took it over. She sells replacement parts and accessories like lights, seatbelts and fan belts.

Juana is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy more accessories to sell in her store. She has pledged to repay her Kiva loan in full and on time.

Juana’s dream for the future is to buy a plot of land to build her own house on and to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: Buy car parts/accessories

loans.name: Santu

texts.en:
Santu M. lives with her husband and two sons in Thecho, Lalitpur. Thecho is one of the developing villages of the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming.

Mrs. Santu M. and her sons are engaged in making different types of traditional brass religious statues. They make the figures as per the demand of customer.

Now Mrs. Santu M. is requesting a loan of Rs 20000.00 to buy the necessary raw material for her statue-making work. She wants to use her increased income to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Hushbahtchon

texts.ru:
Хушбахтчон Гадойбоев водитель. Он управляет маршрутным такси, развозит людей по маршруту Истаравшан-Зафарабад.
 Хушбахтчону 34 года,сам он проживает в Истаравшане со своей семьей. Женат на Сайере Махсумовой, имеет 2 детей. 
 Он запрашивает займ в размере 1300 сомони, и хочет потратить его на ремонт автомобиля, так как ежедневно развозит людей, и отвечает за их безопасность.
texts.en:
Hushbahtchon G. is a driver. He drives a passenger van on the Istaravshan to Zafarabad route. Hushbahtchon is 34 years old, and lives with his family in Istaravshan. He is married to Sayera Mahsumova and has two children. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 1300 somoni and wants to spend it on vehicle repairs, since he drives people on a daily basis and is responsible for their safety.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs

loans.name: Nemecia

texts.es: La señora Nemecia L. V. es una persona jóven y dinámica, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en una pequeña tienda de barrio que no esta muy surtida, el crédito le ayudará a comprara más productos para su negocio, en la misma casa tiene una  cabina de teléfonos desde hace dos años, es conocida en su barrio como una persona solidaria. Ella es casada y su esposo se dedica a la venta de celulares los cuales los vende ambulando, tienen 2 hijos y viven en casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nemecia L. V is a young and dynamic person. She makes a living selling groceries in a small store in the neighborhood, a store that is not very well stocked. The loan will help her to buy more products for her business. In the same house, for the last two years she has had a telephone booth. She is known in the area as a very supportive person. She is married and her husband sells cell phones door to door. They have 2 children and live in their own home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of groceries for resale (Rice, noodles and others)

loans.name: San Silvestre Group

texts.es: El grupo “San Silvestre” esta conformada por 16 miembros representados por el señor Leonidas. Una mayoría D. los miembros del grupo se dedican a la agricultura D. arroz y caña, el resto D. los socios se dedican a la venta D. repuestos, empanadas, abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio y al tejido D. chompas D. lana. A pesar D. los altos niveles competitivos los socios creen en la calidad D. sus productos pero necesitan capital para invertir en herramientas D. trabajo y materia prima para incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calida D. vida D. sus familias. El grupo es relativamente nuevo pero cuentan con la experiencia D. créditos anteriores en entidades similares a la fundación Agrocapital quien les brinda un apoyo económico para crecer y mejorar sus pequeños negocios.
texts.en:
The San Silvestre group is maD. up of sixteen members who are represented by Leonidas. The majority of the group members are farmers who grow rice and sugar cane. The rest of the members sell replacement parts, empanadas, and groceries in neighborhood stores. Some members knit wool sweaters. In spite of the great number of competitors, the members believe in the quality of their products. But, they need capital to invest in work tools and raw materials to increase their income and improve their families’ quality of life. The group is relatively new, but they have experience with previous loan from entities that are similar to the Agrocapital foundation. Agrocapital offers them economic support to expand and improve their small businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Sheullah Group

texts.en:
Sheullah is the group leader of Sheullah group. There are six members in this group. Each of them wants takes a loan for the progress of her business.

Sheullah wants to take a loan for the business of tailoring. Shafeqa wants to take a loan for her husband who has his fruit and vegetables shop. Aarzho wants to take a loan for her husband who has car parts shop. Aziza wants to take a loan for the business of embroidery. Zhmera wants take a loan for her husband who has a general store. Zhrefa wants to take a loan for her husband who has a leather working shop.

So they are requesting a group loan in the amount of 84000 Afghani and they are very thankful for AFS and for Kiva lenders who support people all over the world.

loans.use: For the progress of their businesses

loans.name: Mame

texts.fr: Mame âgée de 51 ans est mariée et mère de 04 enfants à sa charge. Son activité est la vente de friperie (habits, couvres lit, etc.…) et de chaussures. Elle achète à Dakar pour revendre à Bignona. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mame, 51, is married and raising 4 children. Her business is selling used fabrics (clothing, bedspreads, etc.) and shoes. She buys her merchandise in Dakar and sells in Bignona. Her income allows her to improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and resale of clothing and shoes

loans.name: Nizar

texts.en: Nizar is a 28-year-old single man living with his parents. He has owned a barber shop since 2004 and earns income to help satisfy the needs of the family. Today, Nizar is requesting a loan of $1,200 in order to buy additional supplies for his shop so he can increase his income.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: La señora Esther, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Maria Auxiliadora”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 60 años, 06 hijos 01 que aun dependen de ella y está estudiando.Lleva años dedicándose a este tipo de negocio de venta de ropa y nos cuenta que le va muy bien, es así que logro ahorrar su dinero que le permitió comprar  mas ropa variada, en diferentes modelos y tallas.En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio y cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada,  en su barrio ya es muy conocida y tiene buenas entradas a diario. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00, comprará ropas como pantalones, polos, vestidos y blusas, así como también ropas interiores, para damas, caballeros y niños. Se siente muy contenta, tiene fuerzas aun para seguir adelante, y esto; hasta que Dios lo permita, se esta asegurando una vejes tranquila; por lo que reconoce el gran apoyo que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos le viene brindando a ella y otras mujeres de la región San Martín.
texts.en:
Esther belongs to the "Maria Auxiliadora" community bank in the Tarapoto district, San Martin province and department. She is married, is 60 years old and has six children, of whom one depends on her and is a student. For years she has been dedicated to this type of business selling clothing, and she tells us that it has been going well. It is in this manner that she managed to save money that allowed her to purchase more varied clothing, in different styles and sizes. Currently, she is continuing with the same business and she has a faithful customer base. In her neighborhood, she is well known and has good daily takings. With this loan of S. 1,200, she will purchase clothing such as trousers, polos, dresses and tops, as well as underwear for women, men and children. She feels happy. She still has desires to get ahead and this, as long as God permits it, is reassuring. She recognizes the strong support of the Manuela Ramos Movement that provides for her and other women of the San Martin region.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase clothing such as trousers, polos, dresses and tops.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en: Felipa B., a resident of Gusa, Calatunan, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 33 years of age, married with 4 children. Three of them are already in school. Her husband is a company driver. She admit that depending so much with her husband's income is really not enough. So she thought of raising pigs at her backyard. Her future plan is to raise more pigs and dreams of owning piggery in the future.So that it can help to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy additional pigs to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is about to start her general store business however, she has only a limited capital to utilized. For this reason, she wanted to apply for loan from KIVa lenders amounting to PHP4, 000 as start up capital to further pursue her planned store. She is happily married to Dante and they live happily in Barangay Rizaluna Cordon, Isabela. The couple is blessed with three children namely Edison – nine years old is now in grade-IV; Disyrene - four years old and Devorah - 11 months old. 

Evelyn plans to purchase different merchandise for her store.  She hopes that KIVA lenders will lend her the capital she needed to begin in the business. She really wanted to help for the progress of her family living by doing such business that would be a daily income generating one. Evelyn is praying that soon, lenders will give her the chance.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 40-year-old man who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Ali has been producing and selling coal since 1996. He also works as a farmer. His clients are his friends, neighbors, coal shops and sometimes he also sells to restaurants and cafes. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a cow to start producing dairy products. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan.
Ali is special in his work because he is known for his good work. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Ali decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work.

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: Fayida Group

texts.fr:
Fayida est un groupe de l’association Djekadi composé de sept femmes mariées  de la ville de Tominian, une préfecture de la région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies avec en moyenne 28 ans et  4 enfants.
Les femmes du groupe font la restauration et le commerce d’articles divers. 
Pour rentabiliser leurs activités, les membres du groupe Fayida de l’association Djekadi ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui ils sont à leur premier prêt. 
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour l’achat de condiments alimentaires, du riz et bien d’autres ingrédients qui rentrent dans le cadre de la restauration. 
Cette activité  de restauration leur est très rentable et elles vendent essentiellement au comptant à une clientèle composée de routiers. 
Les membres du groupe Fayida comptent réaliser chacun un bénéfice de 15 000 FCFA à 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
'Fayida' is a group belonging to the Djekadi Association, made up of 7 married women from the town of Tominian, a prefecture of the Ségou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional extended families and have an average age of 28 and on average, 4 children each.

The women of this group sell cooked food and various retail items. In order to make their businesses more productive, the members of this Fayida group decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their first loan.

This loan will be used to buy condiments, rice, and a lot of other ingredients for cooked food. This catering business earns them a good income, and they sell essentially for cash to a clientele composed of transporters.

Each of the members of the Fayida group expects to make a monthly profit of 15,000 to 30,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the interest on the loan and for current family expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of ingredients for making cooked food to sell

loans.name: Emba

texts.en:
Emba M. sells groundnut paste and bread for a living, and she is requesting a loan in order to stock tomatoes and cooking oil for sale. Emba is 42 years old. Her husband is a clerk. They have five children, all attending school. With the extra profits she expects from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to offer for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock tomatoes and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: 36-year-old Janet B. is a rice farmer. She is married and lives in Agusan Del Sur. She harvested her crops and is now preparing the land for planting. She joined CEVI to gain access to financial service that could support her farm. She also wants to improve her family’s living conditions. She asked for a loan of 9,000 Philippine pesos. This loan will be used to buy seed, fertilizer, and other items needed at her farm. This loan will truly be helpful in Janet’s journey to a better life.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es:
Bajo el cálido sol del oriente peruano vive Magaly, una mujer trabajadora de 33 años, elL. comparte sus días con su esposo Roberto que tiene 38 años y se dedica a L. siembra de plátanos; con él tiene 3 hijos, que son el motivo de su esfuerzo diario; ellos son: Roberto de 13, Lady de 10 y Milagros de 6 años.

ElL. se dedica a L. venta de comida durante los fines de semana, prepara diversos platillos que son muy buscados entre sus habituales comensales, como son los obreros o trabajadores que después de una larga jornada buscan con mucho fervor una buena comida. 
A Magaly le gusta cocinar porque lo aprendió desde muy joven y un día se le ocurrió ayudar a su esposo a mejorar L. economía del hogar y decidió a empezar a cocinar para vender sus platillos, pero además de L. venta de comida también vende cervezas, con las que muchas personas acompañan su exquisita comida. Magaly eligió este negocio porque era rentable y además porque con este trabajo no el cuidado de sus hijos. Y como si fuera poco, Magaly también le ayuda a su esposo con L. pequeña chacra que tienen cerca de su casa; ahí siembran plátano, café y palta, los cuales venden, al por mayor, a comerciantes de L. zona.
Para el fututo, Magaly tiene pensado implementar una pequeña tienda de productos comestibles.

Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP y está muy segura de cumplir -como siempre- con cada uno de sus pagos; además está muy satisfecha con el trabajo de su banco comunal, porque está compuesto por mujeres trabajadoras que al igual que elL. buscan salir adelante. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará comestibles para seguir vendiendo comida, también comprará cajas de cervezas. Magaly ya está empezando a ahorrar para tener en un futuro no muy lejano, su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Beneath the warm Peruvian sun lives a hard working 33 year old woman named Magaly. She shares her days with her 38 year old husband Roberto who grows plantains. Together they have three children who are their daily motivation: Roberto is 13; Lady is 10 and Milagros is 6. Magaly sells food on weekends and prepares diverse dishes that are much sought after by the usual diners such as the laborers who, after a long workday, are greatly looking forward to a good meal. Magaly loves cooking which she learned as a young girl. One day it occurred to her to help her husband improve the household’s finances, and she decided to start cooking and selling her dishes. As well as selling food, she also sells beer which many people like to have to complement her excellent food. Magaly elected this business because it is profitable, and also because with this work she can still look after her children. And if this isn’t enough, Magaly also helps her husband with the small farm that they have near their house. Here they grown plantains, coffee and avocados which they sell, for the most part, to local merchants. In the future, Magaly is thinking about starting a small grocery store. This is her fifth loan with MFP and she is very certain to comply – as always – with each one of her payments. She is very happy with the work of her communal bank because it is made up of working women who, like her, are hoping to progress. With the money that she is currently requesting, she will buy groceries in order to continue selling food and she will also buy cases of beer. Magaly is already starting to save in order to have, in the not so distant future, her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries and drinks

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis es un hombre muy trabajador de 41 años , vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en su casa que es propia.Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de ropa junto a su pareja con quien trabaja en este sacrificado negocio, ya que deben comprar al por mayor y distribuir toda la mercadería que le piden  sus clientes a provincias y lo hacen  en su pequeño camión, y este negocio les genera buenas ganancias. Lo que Luis desea es ofrecerle  un futuro mejor a su familia, es por esta razón que siempre se encuentra buscando  la manera de mejorar su negocio. Su labor no es nada fácil ya que debe viajar constantemente  y tiene que dejar  a su familia, pero por otro lado, es muy gratificante poder ofrecerles una buena calidad de vida, y ya tiene pensado invertir el dinero del crédito en comprar mas cantidad de ropa para vender en estas épocas navideñas ya que sabe que existirá gran demanda, y casi todas las personas quieren estrenar ropa nueva.Es su segundo préstamo con MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos.Con el dinero del crédito quiere comprar una gran variedad de ropa para poder ofrecer calidad y cantidad en estas épocas.
texts.en:
Luis is a hard-working 41 year old man. He lives with his wife and his two children in a house that they own. For a year he has been selling clothing along with his partner, who he works with in this difficult business. They must buy wholesale and then distribute all of the merchandise requested by their customers to various areas in the region. They do this in their small truck, and the business generates good earnings. What Luis wants is to offer his family a better future, and it is for this reason that he always finds himself looking for a way to improve his business. His work is not easy because he is always traveling and has to leave his family. However, it is very gratifying to be able to offer them a good quality of life. He is planning to invest the money from the loan in buying a larger amount of clothing to sell during the Christmas season. He knows that there will be a great demand and almost everyone will want to have new clothes. This is his second loan with MFP and he has shown himself to be on time in paying back. With the money from the loan he wants to buy a great variety of clothing to be able to offer quality and quantity during this season.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a larger amount of merchandise for his business

loans.name: Mutahira

texts.en:
Mutahira is a hardworking entrepreneur from Istaravshan, a city in the northern part of Tajikistan. Together with her husband they have three children. She runs a business where she sells kids' shoes at the busy central market in Istaravshan. Mutahira started her business 11 years ago and has run it with both extreme care and seriousness. It is an important source of income for her family of five, considering her husband is currently unemployed.

Mutahira has requested a loan of 5,000 Somoni so that she can purchase additional inventory of winter boots for kids and to continue developing her business. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to grow her business further and help feed her family.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase winter boots for resale

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 42 years of age.  She is married with six children aged 5-22 years. All her children go to school. Beatrice resides in and owns a five-roomed house where she stays with six people. She takes care of additional family members.  The family eats three meals a day, and has access to electricity, but not to piped water at home.  Her greatest monthly expenses includes paying utility bills, school fees for her children and medication.  

Beatrice is a poultry farmer in Makerere, where she rears both broiler and layer chickens. She picks at least 4 trays of eggs a day and sells them, retail and wholesale, to all kinds of people. She works seven days a week, serving about 10 customers a day. She has had her business for over fifteen years.  Her main challenges are transportation of chicken feed and thieves. Besides her poultry business, she also has some pigs around her place.  

Beatrice has been with MCDT for two years, and has taken four loans, working the whole time with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more chicken feed and chicks. She hopes to see her business grow bigger, and to start getting 20 trays a day.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and chicks

loans.name: Yudis Patricia

texts.es:
Yudis Patricia Jiménez es una joven de 28 años, que vive en el barrio 7 de Abril de la ciudad  de Barranquilla, con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos menores de 2 y 6 años; vende frutas, verduras y todo lo relacionado con la dulcería en su casa; se inició en el negocio en acuerdo con su cónyuge, quien desde hace 10 años vende frutas y verduras en el mercado público de Barranquilla; los dos convinieron en la necesidad de generar un nuevo ingreso al hogar y en que, mediante un negocio en casa podían lograrlo; por eso Yudis sin abandonar las responsabilidades domésticas, especialmente  la crianza de sus hijos, desde hace 4 años comercializa los mismos productos que vende su esposo; ella lo hace en el barrio donde residen, teniendo en cuenta que hay muchas tiendas y amas de casa que le compran por la frescura de sus productos. En la actualidad Yudis necesita un crédito  por valor de $ 1.000.000 para ampliar su surtido de frutas y verduras. Este es su segundo crédito con la  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y el anterior lo aplicó en la diversificación de sus productos, agregándole dulcería y mecatos, que le ha dado la oportunidad de un nuevo ingreso.

La meta familiar es tener una casa propia y respecto al negocio  mejorar su exhibición de productos, Su mayor desafío es la infraestructura física de acceso a su negocio,  pues aunque tiene una ubicación excelente, existen dificultades porque sus calles se encuentran sin pavimentar, con este propósito los vecinos de sector desarrollan bingos y otras actividades para lograr  mejor acceso en sus habitad.
texts.en:
Yudis Patricia Jiménez is a young woman of 28 who lives with her spouse and two young children, ages 2 and 6, in the 7 de Abril district of the city of Barranquilla. She sells fruits, vegetables, and everything that you would find at a candy shop from her home. She conceived of her business together with her husband, who for 10 years has been selling fruits and vegetables in the public market of Barranquilla. The two agreed on the necessity to generate a new source of income for their household, and realized that by running a business from within their home they could create this additional income. Toward this end, Yudis, without abandoning her domestic responsibilities, especially the raising of her children, has for 4 years now been selling the same products as her husband. She carries out her sales in the neighborhood in which she lives, knowing that there are many stores and house wives willing to buy her fruits and vegetables on account of their freshness. Currently, Yudis needs a loan of $ 1.000.000 to expand her supply of fruits and vegetables. This is her second loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She applied her previous loan toward diversifying her products, adding sweets to her array of goods, which increased her sales income. Her family's goal is to own a house of their own. With respect to her business, her goal is to improve the display of her products and her customers' ability to access her. Her biggest obstacle is the physical infrastructure of her neighborhood; although her location is excellent, the streets in her neighborhood are not paved, creating difficulty for potential customers to access her business. With this challenge in mind, her community has begun holding games of bingo and other such activities to raise funds to put toward improving access to their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: para ampliar el surtido de las frutas y verduras que comercializa

loans.name: Carla Pastora

texts.es:
Esta cliente es su primer credito que obtendra Y se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad de Malpaisillo  y se dedica ha dar clase de primaria en la comunidad la sabaneta.
Ella ha logrado venir realizandole mejora a su casa con sus efuerzo de su salario mas los ingresos de sus aguinaldo.
hoy piensa ampliarce mas con este prestamo contruyendo un cuarto y darle mejor condiciones a su hogar.
texts.en:
This is this client's first loan. She lives in Malpaisillo and is a primary school teacher in La Sabaneta. She has been doing some home improvements thanks to her salary and Christmas bonus. She intends to enlarge her home further with this loan, which will be used to build an room and improve her home's condition.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for labor costs of home improvements.

loans.name: Waheeda Habib Group

texts.en:
Habibullah son of M. R. is the leader of Waheeda Habib Group. He is 49 years old, married, and is the father of four children. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan.

Habibullah has a small shop from which he sells fresh fruit and vegetables in the city of Kabul. He needs a small loan for his business to make it strong and help his family.
 
Habibullah requested a loan to enlarge his business. He wants to expand and progress his business. Besides, he wants to buy necessary materials and complete his shop’s stock and continue working hard.

Habibullah is very happy with this process of small loans in Afghanistan and wants to thank everyone invoved, especially the Kiva lenders around the world.

loans.use: To expend his business

loans.name: Patrocenia's Group

texts.en:
Patrocenia N. is from the village of Alinam, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 45 years old. Patrocenia is the group leader of a 12-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Patrocenia is married and has 3 school-aged children. Patrocenia owns & operates a general store where she sells food & daily-use products. Patrocenia is just starting this business.

In 2007, Patrocenia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Patrocenia is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Patrocenia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

 
About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rakia Tieku Brefo

texts.en: Rakia T. B. is married and has four children. She has been through junior high school. Rakia sells different types of biscuits, toffees, drinks and other sweet and savory snacks at Akotokyire. Her husband is an architect. Rakia uses the profits she gets from her sales to sustain the family. Rakia will use the loan to purchase more goods to sell. With the new earnings from her expanded business, Rakia plans to save to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: Rakia will use the loan to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Ton

texts.en: Mrs. S. is 48 years old. She sells cupcakes from her store at her home. She sells to people who are her nearby neighbors and usually generates about $4 each day. She also sells the cakes in bulk to middlemen who then take them to retail. S. now has five children. Two of the children are married and live separately, and the rest are single and work as garment laborers. She has another financial earner in her husband, who grows rice. S. will be using part of her loan to buy a cow to raise for her family and the rest to accumulate capital for her cake sale trade.

loans.use: To buy a cow and to accumulate capital for cake sale trade.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario R. is from the village of Centro. She is 54 years old, married and has 3 adult-aged children. Rosario owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rosario has been involved in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Rosario joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosario has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosario is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Rosario from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en: Leonarda T. is from the village of Palaranan. She is 54 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Leonarda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Leonarda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her sari-sari store business. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Jicaltepec Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Jicaltepec, se eligió este nombre para el grupo ya que asi se llama la comunidad donde viven. La historia es acerca de la señora María López garcía, puesto que es una de las integrantes de este grupo. Ella tiene 44 años, esta casada su esposo es albañil, tiene 3 hijos, Leonel, Uriel y Luis ángel los 3 están estudiando, 2 de ellos van a la secundaria y el otro esta cursando el bachillerato, ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos como enchiladas y sopes, también vende tortillas hechas a manos.

María eligió la venta de antojitos por que dice que es una muy buena fuente de ingresos, ella invirtirá su préstamo en la compra de los ingredientes que utiliza para la preparación de la comida como son: leña, maíz, papas, chile poblano, chile verde, jitomates, tomates y queso, también para hacer sus aguas frescas comprará: piña, sandia, melón, naranjas y mangos. 

Su negocio le esta ayudando ahora que viene el termino de clases ya que 2 de sus hijos van a terminar, uno de la secundaria y el otro del bachillerato y con las graduaciones necesita hacer algunos gastos, pues tiene que comprarles zapatos, uniformes, además de las cooperaciones que le están pidiendo en las escuelas, también quiere mejorar su negocio, emparejando el suelo y echarle el piso ya que es de tierra, comprar una lona para usarla como techo en su negocio, sillas y mesas.

Su negocio beneficia mucho a las personas de su comunidad por que asi no tienen que ir tan lejos a comprar su comida y tortillas, ya que algunas personas de su comunidad prefieren comprarla preparada para no tener que estar haciendo en su casa.

La señora María quiere que sus hijos tengan una profesión ya que ella no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, ella esta pensando que aparte de la venta de comida puede vender frutas y verduras ya que en su localidad tienen que ir hasta la ciudad a comprar y es una actividad que no tiene competencia en su comunidad.

Nos comenta que en su grupo se trabaja muy bien , puesto que todas las integrantes se conocen y son muy responsables con sus pagos.

Y estos son los nombres y las actividades que realizan cada una de las integrantes del grupo.
Oralia S. galán – tienda artesanal
Eustolia garcía T. – antojitos
Carmela López M. – antojitos
Sotera garcía S. – antojitos
Juana garcía garcía – abarrotes
María López garcía – cocina económica
Teresa T. Pérez – deposito de refrescos
Rebeca M. garcía – cocina económica
Ricarda S. garcía – antojitos
Ofelia S. M. – antojitos
Eustolia V. Pérez – cocina económica 
Margarita Pérez López – antojitos 
Francisca M. – chiles y semillas
texts.en:
This group is called Jicaltepec, named after the community where they live. The story is about Ms. María López García, since she is one of the members of this group. She is 44 years old, married to a construction worker, and has three school-aged children: Leonel, Uriel and Luis Angel, two of whom are studying in secondary school and one in high school. She makes and sells traditional corn-based Mexican dishes such as enchiladas, soups and pastas, and also hand-made tortillas. María says she chose home-made food sales as her business because it is a very good source of income. She will invest her loan in the purchase of the ingredients she uses to prepare the food which are: firewood, corn, potatoes, poblano and green chiles, jitomates, tomatoes and cheese. She will also buy ingredients for her “aguas frescas” (light fruit juices): pineapple, watermelon, other melons, oranges and mangoes. Her business is helping now that the end of classes is near since two of her children are going to graduate, one from secondary school and the other from high school, and she will have some graduation expenses for them such as shoes and uniforms as well as the donations they are soliciting at the schools. She would also like to improve her business, leveling out the ground and putting in some flooring since it is a dirt floor, and to buy a canvas to use as a roof for her business, and tables and chairs. Her business provides a real benefit to the people in her community because now they do not have to travel so far to buy their food and tortillas, given that some people in her community prefer to buy prepared food so as not to have to cook at home. María wants her children to have a profession since she herself did not have the opportunity to study for one. She is thinking that in addition to selling prepared food she can sell fruits and vegetables since in her area people have to travel to the city to buy produce and there would be no competition for that business in her neighborhood. She mentions that her group works together very well, since all the members know each other and are very responsible with their payments. And these are the names and business activities each one of the members carries out: Oralia S. Galán – Traditional crafts shop Eustolia García T. – Food preparation Carmela López M. – Food preparation Sotera García S. – Food preparation Juana García García – Groceries María López García – Home-style restaurant Teresa T. Pérez – Soda pop and other non-alcoholic drinks Rebeca M. garcía – Home-style restaurant Ricarda S. garcía – Food preparation Ofelia S. M. – Food preparation Eustolia V. Pérez – Home-style restaurant Margarita Pérez López – Food preparation Francisca M. – Chiles and seeds

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase firewood, corn, potatoes, poblano and green chiles, jitomates, tomatoes and cheese

loans.name: Yaen's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yaen M. is 33 years old and is the village bank president, having been selected by its seventeen members who are located in Chheu Neang Khpos village, Takeo province. With their loan, each member of this village hopes to increase their income to improve the living of their family.

Mrs. Yaen M. is a farmer who owns 2-hectares (5-acres) of land that she uses to cultivate rice for a living. Aside from farming, she also sells groceries in the locality and is able to earn a small income to support her five children.

For her grocery selling, Mrs. Yaen M. will use the loan to buy more groceries to enlarge her business activities. She is widow with five children, one of whom is a laborer, one is a farmer, while the other three are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: V. Teodora tiene 54 años, su actividad económica es la compra y venta de camarones. Hace más de 12 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que siempre ha sido una persona muy responsable, ella disfruta de este negocio, por lo que ha sido su medio de vida, por lo que sale todos los días muy temprano a vender sus productos ella tiene varios clientes que siempre están solicitando la buena calidad que ofrece y también el buen trato que obtiene por medio de sus clientes. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de camarones en grandes cantidades pues ya tiene muchos pedidos. Para un futuro le gustaría establecer una pulpería en su vivienda y además seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
Teodora V. is 54 years old. She has been buying and selling shrimp for a living for more than 12 years now and she has always been a very responsible person. She enjoys this business as it is her livelihood. She leaves early every day to sell her product. She has various customers that treat her well and are always requesting the good quality product that she offers. She is requesting a loan to buy shrimp in larger quantities, as she already has many orders. In the future she would like to have a store in her house and continue to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shrimp in larger quantities

loans.name: Nasira's Group

texts.en:
Nasira lives in the city of Multan, famous in Pakistan for its history. Nasira has spent most of her life in Multan. She is married to D. A. who runs a business making and selling bedsheets.

She has given birth to five children, four sons and a daughter. Her daughter is illiterate while her eldest son also left his education after 8th standard (grade). They both have started doing work to financially support the family. Her daughter does embroidery and her son works in a factory. Nasira’s younger children are getting their education.

Nasira also does embroidery work for her neighborhood clients. She wants to expand business for herself and her daughter, so that’s why she has applied for a loan from Asasah.  This is the first time she is getting a loan from any MFI. With the loan amount she will buy embroidery material such as clothing, beads and colored thread in bulk which will help them to complete more embroidered dresses and for generating good profit on it.

She hopes that this investment will be profitable for both of them and they will be able to improve the financial conditions of their family.

loans.use: Purchase embroidery material for improving embroidery business

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda C. is a married woman who lives in C. St., Brgy. Talisay, Sta. Fe, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  food vending and pig fattening businesses. Her husband Crusilo C., who is 51 years old, works as a foreman in a construction firm to earn his living.  They have 7 children who are between 11 and 30 years old. 

Luzviminda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Luzviminda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 16th  loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use to pay to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for future for business and the education of her children. Luzviminda C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
Jenny M. A. es una señora de 32  años de edad el cual vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. 

Jenny  se ha dedicado  toda su vida  a la agricultura, pero en los últimos años se ha dedicado especialmente al engorde de cerdos. Ella  dice que  le ha ido bien  pero que por falta de recursos no ha podido desarrollar su negocio.  

Ella  desea obtener un micro crédito por un monto de ¢609.000 (seiscientos nueve  mil colones) para construir un corral para los cerdos y para comprar más de ellos. Con este préstamo espera abastecer la demanda que hay en su comunidad, la cual asegura es muy alta y se está vendiendo a un muy buen precio.

Jenny M. A. es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo,  y con el espera cumplir todas sus metas y aspiraciones y sacara adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Jenny M. A. is 32 years old and lives with her husband and 4 children in a community named Santa Fe in the province of Alajuela. This community is known for being mountainous and for being close to the northern border of the country. Jenny has dedicated her whole life to agriculture, but over the past several years she has dedicated herself specifically to raising pigs. She says that this has gone well for her, but that because of a lack of resources she has not been able to develop her business. Jenny wishes to obtain a microcredit in the amount of 609,000 CRC to build a corral for the pigs and to buy more of them. With this loan, she hopes to be able to supply the demand that there is in her community, which she assures is very high. She is selling the pigs at a very good price. Jenny M. A. is a member of Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial of Santa Fe, one of the 100 organizations that are members of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan, and with it she hopes to reach all of her goals and aspirations and to help her family get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy material to construct a corral for the pigs she raises

loans.name: Jean Baptise Desire

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is 55 years old and married with five children.  Jean Baptiste is commonly for selling a variety of drinks and this is his third successful year in this business.  

Although Jean Baptiste has been in this business for about three years, his profits are still too low to cover all the basic needs of his family and save for his future.  To end this, he needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, he will be able to satisfy the demands of his customers as well as the basic needs of his family. In addition, he will keep reinvesting in his business for better financial stability.

loans.use: Expanding his business

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
Haydee E. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 43 years old. Haydee is married and has 6 children. Her eldest child is 22 years old and the youngest is only 3. She is involved in farming and has been planting and harvesting rice crops for more than a few years now. She has also started raising pigs for breeding. Haydee wishes to fulfill her dreams and one of those dreams is to see all of her children finish college and have bright futures. She says raising 6 children is not easy but she finds comfort in knowing she and her husband support each other in efforts to keep their family intact.

Haydee joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Haydee has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Haydee is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and also feeds for the pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure and feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en: Vicky N.  is currently in the business of selling charcoal and fish at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Vicky is 40 years old and is married to a watchman. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a motorbike to transport charcoal to her home.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Hope To God Ii Group

texts.en:
Posseh K. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Posseh was born in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. She is 28 years of age. Posseh is married to a trader and the couple has two children who are attending primary school. For 10 years now, Posseh has been selling used clothes.

This is first the loan that Posseh and her group members have applied for from Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and, consequently, improve their living conditions. Posseh will use her share of the loan (SLL 800,000) to expand her business. She will buy a bale or two of used clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy a bale or two of used clothes to add to her current stock

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 25-year-old married man living with his wife and two young children. He is from Lebanon. He is an experienced carpenter with almost 10 years of experience. He manufactures different wood products such as doors and home furniture and he works closely with some locA. galleries. He also makes home furniture for his clients. He presents many choices and designs from furniture catalogs. He works hard to support his housewife and his young children. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additionA. wood. In the future, he is looking to further expand his merchandise and invest in a new wood-sanding machine. He hopes that the coming year will continue to bring positive growth and increased sales.

loans.use: To purchase additional wood

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 53 years old and married with nine adult children, one of whom is currently attending school. For over ten years, he has been practicing mixed farming. His farm is located in Kisii town, western Kenya, and he produces tea, milk, and eggs which he sells to the local market. Henry mainly depends on the income from his farm to provide for the needs of his family. His major challenge is the lack of reliable markets for his products.

Henry has a good record with Juhudi Kilimo and has successfully repaid a previous loan of 45,000 KES. He is requesting a loan of 70,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow. The loan will enable him acquire a quality dairy cow to improve milk production and provide enough milk for both domestic consumption and sale. Henry hopes to expand his farming activities and increase his productivity.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael S. is from the village of Minsapinit, Gingoog City. He is 52 years old. Ismael is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Ismael owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling souvenir products like key chains & figurines in the local community. Ismael has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ismael joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ismael has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Ismael is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional souvenir products to sell like printed shirts. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Ismael from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional souvenir products to sell like printed shirts

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 48 años, y  enviudo hace 12 años; pero a pesar de esto cuido muy bien de sus cinco  hijos, y los ha sacado adelante. Habita su casa propia que esta ubicada en una comunidad de la selva central peruana.Su lucha fue constante, pues después de la muerte de su esposo tenía que obtener mayores ingresos, es por esta razón que hace 10 años instaló un negocio de venta de dulces y helados en su casa. A pesar del poco tiempo que dispone, trabaja arduamente, ya que en verano tiene gran acogida, paralelamente a esta actividad  siembra plátano y café en sus dos hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas. Para sacar adelante a sus hijos desea instalar  más tiendas de comestibles en las zonas aledañas a su comunidad, pues son zonas alejadas y calcula que  no tendría mucha competencia, además sus ganancias aumentaran bastante.Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Palmas”, y este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP, además  asegura podrá adquirir buenas experiencias para el logro de sus objetivos.Para obtener un buen grano de café, María piensa invertir el dinero del préstamo en la renovación de sus plantaciones, y  también quiere  surtir su tienda de comestibles, de esta manera espera seguir progresando.
texts.en:
María is 48 years old.  She has been a widow for 12 years but, in spite of this, she has cared very well for her five children and has managed to get them ahead in life.  She lives in her own home which is located in a community in the central Peruvian jungle.  María's struggle has been constant since, following the death of her husband, she had to make more income.  For this reason, 10 years ago, she set up a business selling sweet treats and iced treats in her home.

In spite of the little time that she has available María works hard since her business is very popular in the summer.  In parallel with this business, she also grows bananas and coffee on her two hectares of farmland.  To get her children ahead in life, she would like to set up more food stores in the areas neighboring her community since they are remote areas and she figures that she will not have much competition.  In addition, this will increase her profits.

María belongs to the "Las Palmas" community bank and this is the first loan that she has had with MFP.  She assures us that she will be able to gain good experience in achieving her goals.  In order to achieve a good coffee bean, María is planning to invest her loan money in renovating her plantations.  She would also like to stock her food store.  In this way, she hopes to continue making progress.

loans.use: To buy plantations and to buy foodstuffs for her grocery store

loans.name: Nazeeran's Group

texts.en:
Nazeeran belongs to Kasur, which is a small city of Pakistan known for its leather industry. She lives there in the area of Bhasarpura with her family in a three-room brick house. She is 49 years old and has seven children.

Her elder son has a shoe manufacturing business and all of his siblings help him in completing his orders to financially contribute to the family. They are all illiterate and couldn’t get an education due to financial constraints. As a result they couldn’t find jobs. 

Her husband is involved in a paranda-making business (an ornament used to tie-back hair). It is in high demand in the local market and he earns a good income from his profession. 

Nazeeran is also a very talented lady. She operates an embroidery business at her home. She offers her services to her community ladies for a reasonable amount and gets good orders from them every month. 
 
She has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for the improvement of her son’s shoe manufacturing business. He will utilize the loan for the purchasing of raw material, like leather, nails, glue, etc. to manufacture more shoes for selling. He has been operating this business since he was a teenager and has vast experience in this field. Nazeeran is hopeful that an investment will take her son’s business to a more profitable position and that he will be able to make more money by fulfilling orders on time. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah.

loans.use: To buy leather, nails and glue for shoe manufacturing business

loans.name: Mrs. Neang Sopheap Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of eleven people located in Veay Chhneah village, Takeo province. All of the members will use their portions of the loan in various ways to support their families.

Mrs. Neang S. is the village bank president selected by the other members. She is a hammock maker who earns some money to support her family and her husband, Mr. S. Suon, is a motorbike taxi driver. Mrs. Neang S. faces a problem because her husband’s motorbike is too old to use. Therefore, she is applying for a loan to buy a new motorbike for her husband's taxi business. Mrs. Neang S. is the mother of four children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory and the others are studying in the local public school.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Takku Liggueye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité TAKKU LIGG.  existe depuis qu’il a reçu son premier financement  le30 décembre 2009. Il est composé de femmes qui du même village. Elles sont unies par des liens de de  parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Leurs activités génératrices génératrices  de revenus consiste a faire du petit commerce, de la transformation de l'huile d’arachide, de la vente de parfum, de la couture, de l’embouche, et de l’élevage de volaille. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Village de NDIARE D..

Madame NOGAYE D. debout tout à fait à droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est Mariée et mère de 10 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de deux de ses petits enfants

Elle fait un petit commerce de produits divers tels : des chaussures, des vêtements pour enfants, des légumes, du poivre, du piment, de l’ail etc.

Son nouveau crédit lui donnera la possibilité de développer et faire la promotion de son activité de petit commerce

Son objectif est de renforcer son niveau d’épargne, de prendre en charge le payement de la scolarité d’un de ses petit fils. Et enfin  de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge financière de la famille
texts.en:
The TAKKU LIGG.  solidarity group has been in existence since receiving its first loan on December 30, 2009. The group is made up of women from the same village, who have come together as family members, friends and neighbors. Their revenue-producing activities consist of small-scale retail, making peanut oil, selling perfume, sewing, fattening livestock, and raising poultry. The group is part of the NDIARE D. Banc Villageois.

Mrs. Nogaye D., standing at the far right of the photo, is the group's leader. She is married and the mother of 10 children. She is also responsible for 2 of her grandchildren. She sells various items: shoes, clothes for children, vegetables, ground pepper, peppers, garlic, etc. This new loan will allow her to develop and promote her small retail business. Her goal is to increase her level of savings and to take responsibility for paying school fees for one of her grandsons. Finally, she would like to support her husband in meeting the family's financial needs.

loans.use: To develop and promote revenue-producing activity

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.ru: Ашурова Мукаддас проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 36 лет. Замужем, имеет 6 детей. Образование-среднее. Она вместе с мужем занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет участок земли, где сеет овощи и злаковые культуры. Этим видом деятельности занимается два года. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений и топлива, чтобы получить хороший урожай для продажи.
texts.en: Mukaddas A. lives in the region of Yavan. She is 36 years old. She is married and has six children. She has secondary education. Together with her husband she does agriculture. She has a plot of land by her home where she sows vegetables and cereals. She has been in this business for two years. She is taking out the loan to buy mineral fertilizer and fuel to collect a good harvest.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth, 58, grows rice for a living. She tills her own land located in Surallah, South Cotabato and sells her harvest in her community. Ruth has been engaged in rice farming for more than 10 years and earns approximately PHP 5000 per month. Aside from being a farmer, Ruth also sells fruit, such as oranges at a rented stall near the school. Ruth has requested a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She is hopeful that this loan will help improve her harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa tiene 41 años, es muy jovial y emprendedora. Vive en su casa junto a su hijo de 19 años, por quien se esfuerza todo los días. Es estudiante, en una universidad pública para docencia, motivo por el cual aprovecha para vender productos de belleza y joyas de fantasía fina, a sus compañeras de estudio y de otras aulas, este negocio le esta yendo muy bien, ya que sus ganancias son buenas. Por ello, le gusta mucho su negocio,  ya que no necesita invertir tiempo adicional, más de lo contrario, capta buenas utilidades, con las que se cubre sus pasajes y los estudios de su hijo. De seguir así, está segura de poder brindarle toda su educación y hacer un profesional de éxito. Además, se  siente contenta, por ella misma,  ya que su carrera  postergada de hace muchos años, la retomó y pronto lo ejercerá. Por ello, no duda en derrochar todas sus energías para lograrlo y con el tiempo, anhela  incrementar su capital y ampliar su negocio de cosméticos y diversidad de joyas. Este es su veinteavo crédito con MFP, y se compromete a pagar cuotas puntualmente, para acceder posteriores ayudas, para crecer con su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más productos de belleza, para atender los pedidos  pendientes de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Teresa is 41 years old.  She is a very cheerful and enterprising woman who lives in her home together with her 19 year-old son for whom she works hard every day.  Her son is a University student and Teresa takes advantage of this in order to sell beauty products and jewelry to his fellow students.  Her business is doing very well and she makes good profits.

Teresa enjoys her business a lot because she doesn't need to invest extra time in it.  On the contrary.  She makes good profits which cover her transportation costs and pay for her son's studies.  By continuing in this way, she is certain that she will be able to provide her son with a complete education and help him become a successful professional.  Teresa feels happy for herself as well because her own career was put on hold for many years but she has taken it up again and will soon practice it.  Consequently, she doesn't hesitate in throwing all her energies into achieving this and, over time, she hopes to increase her capital and expand her cosmetics and jewelry business.

This is Teresa's 20th loan from MFP and she pledges to make her repayments on time so that she can access further loans in order to grow her business.  Teresa will use the loan that she has requested to buy more beauty products so that she can fill some pending orders that she has from her customers.

loans.use: to buy beauty products to meet her customers' demands

loans.name: Kezeroni

texts.en: Kezeroni is a 38-year-old married man with seven children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in a retail shop for a year, and the business is promising, as he has been able to get income to cater the family basics. His hardship is delays in supply delivery, and his vision is to have a wholesale shop, buy a plot in town, and educate his children. Kezeroni intends to use the loan to buy sugar and soap for selling.

loans.use: to buy sugar and soap for resale

loans.name: Haneen

texts.en:
Haneen is an Italian language student in Bethlehem University. She is a senior student and has to go to Italy to take a course to complete her degree.

Haneen took out a loan from FATEN to pay for her trip expenses. The course is very important for Haneen as she will be able to practice Italian and work on her research.

Haneen appears in the picture here in a FATEN branch office.

loans.use: to pay for attending an Italian language course.

loans.name: Luz Mery

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Hay un lugar conocido como la comunidad de Arin este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En esta comunidad de Arin conocimos a la señora Luz Mery de 36 años de edad, tiene su pareja y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos, vive con su pareja en su casa propia que cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la provincia de Calca, que pertenece al departamento del Cusco. Esta zona tiene como actividad principal la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Luz Mery tiene varios terrenos de cultivo donde cosecha y siembre dependiendo a la época diferentes productos como por ejemplo lechuga, asnapa, ruda, perejil, maíz, papa y otras cosas más. Ella en el interior de su casa tiene una granja donde se dedica a la crianza de animales como cuyes y gallinas. Desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron esta labor y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja junto a su pareja, que con mucho esmero siembran vegetales y hortalizas. 

El crédito que ha solicitado Luz Mery es de 1,500 nuevos soles a la Asociación Arariwa, será destinado para comprar más semillas. Luz Mery es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa que siempre ha sabido salir adelante para mejorar en la vida y poder tener lo que quiere.
texts.en:
In the city of Calca, department of Cusco, there is a place known as the Arin community.  The area is known for its beautiful landscapes, its food, and the quality of its people.

In this community of Arin is where we meet Luz Mery, who is 36 years old.  She has a partner with whom she has three children; they live in their own house, which has running water and electricity, located in the Calca province of Cusco.  The primary economic activities in this zone consist of agriculture, raising livestock and tourism.

Luz Mery has several plots of land where she harvests and plants, depending on the different seasons, items such as lettuce, asnapa (an herb), rue, parsley, corn, potatoes and other items.  She also has an area at her home where she raising animals such as guinea pigs and chickens.  Her parents taught her the farming trade from when she was a young girl, and now she has her own lands that she works with her partner, where they plant vegetables with great care.

The loan Luz Mery has requested from the Arariwa Association is for 1,500 Peruvian soles, which will be destined to buy more seeds.  Luz Mery is a hard-working woman who has always known how to get ahead in life and obtain what she wants.

loans.use: buy more seeds.

loans.name: Mereyda

texts.es:
Mereyda tiene 49 años de edad, ella es soltera y tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad.  Ella cuenta con casa propia   la cual está ubicada en el caserío llamado  Corral de arena  en el distrito de Olmos. Mereyda vive en la parte rural de este distrito, pero aun haci cuenta con los servicios básicos  (agua y luz).

Mereyda  se dedica a la  comercialización de animales menores, aves de corral en variedad y además de ovejas, los cuales cría en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio,  esta actividad la aprendió de sus padre y desde hace 5 años ella a realiza sus ventas en el mercado de Piura y también realiza entregas en su domicilio. En todos estos años mereyda ha adquirido experiencia en el rubro y clientela fija a su negocio.

Mereyda  está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000  nuevos soles para poder comprar animales con su respectivo alimento balanceado.  Además ella desea realizar unas mejoras en sus corrales, para mejorar el ambiente en donde cría a sus  animales. 

Mereyda desea mejorar su calidad  de vida, con esfuerzo y trabajo. Cuenta con buenas referencias laborales, las personas que la conocen la describen como una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Mereyda is 49 years old, she is single and has 2 adult children.  She has her own house which is located in the hamlet called Corral de Arena in the Olmos district.  Mereyda lives in the rural part of this district, but she still has basic services (water and electricity).

Mereyda works in the business of small animals, various poultry and also sheep, which she raises in pens located behind her home.  She learned this activity from her father.  5 years ago she started selling at the market in Piura and she also makes home deliveries.  In all these years, Mereyda has gained experience and established a client base for her business.

Mereyda is requesting a loan of 1,000 New Soles through Edpyme Alternativa to be able to buy animals together with their respective animal feed.  In addition she wants to make improvements to their pens, to improve the environment in which she is raising her animals.

Mereyda want to improve her quality of life with effort and hard work.   She has good work references, and people who know her describe her as a calm and responsible woman.

loans.use: to buy animals with their respective animal feed.

loans.name: Lout

texts.en:
Lout is a 36-year-old farmer who lives in the Baray district of Kompong Tom Province. Lout is married to Phorn, age 37. The couple work together in the farming business, and they have given birth to two children. One of their children is employed in manufacturing and the remaining one is learning in the local school. 

Lout would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, insecticides and seeds for planting. For the future, she hopes to buy a used motorbike for her husband to run a motorbike taxi service.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Visitación

texts.es: Visitación D. 54 años D. edad, casada con julio D. 48 años con quien tiene 4 hijos. Ellos viven en su casa propia del centro poblado D. Canayre del distrito D. LLochegua. Visitación es una mujer D. mucho coraje, que desD. muy joven trabajó en el campo, hace 10 años atrás recién incursiono en el negocio D. venta D. cereales, que ella misma los adquiere en la serranía del Perú, es la única proveedora D. cereales en su localidad, es por esta razón que cuenta con buenos clientes potenciales. Visitación realiza sus actividades con la esperanza D. ver a sus hijos felices y ser unos profesionales. Este será su  segundo crédito con MFP, por lo tanto espera el apoyo D. cada uno ustedes para continuar con su trabajo. Por otro lado se compromete a ser puntual en el pago D. sus cuotas. Visitación es la persona, que a pesar D. su edad es la más alegre y dinámica en su banco comunal. Con los 1.500 que solicita, comprará más productos como cereales para aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Visitación is 54 years of age and married to Julio, 48, with whom she has four children. They live in their own home in the population center of Canayre of the district of Llochegua. Visitación is a woman of great pluck who has worked in the fields from a very early age. Ten years ago she started up a business selling grains which she herself purchases in the mountains of Peru. She is the only grain supplier in her area and for that reason she has an excellent potential customer base. Visitación carries out her business in hopes of seeing her children happy and that some of them would be professionals. 

This will be her second loan with MFP, and she hopes for the support of each of you in order to continue on with her work. For her part she promises to be punctual about making her payments. In spite of her age, Visitación is the most cheerful and dynamic person in her communal bank. With the 1,500 she requests, she will buy more products such as grains in order to increase her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase more grains.

loans.name: Hanifamo

texts.ru: Ханифамо проживает в районе Хамадони. Ей 57 лет. Она замужем. У нее шестеро детей. Ее муж строитель. Сама Ханифамо занимается животноводством. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже 20 лет. Она в основном закупает несколько телят, откармливает и продает их по более выгодной цене. Ханифамо берет кредит для закупа крупнорогатого скота. Она хочет увеличить количество скота.
texts.en: Hanifamo lives in the Hamadoni region. She is 57 years old and married. She has six children. Her husband is a construction worker. Hanifamo does animal husbandry. She has been in this business for twenty years. She mainly buys several calves, feeds them and sells them at a more profitable price. Hanifamo is taking out the loan to buy large horned cattle. She wants to increase their head count.

loans.use: to buy large horned cattle

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 37 years old, married and has three children. For five years Virginia has had a retail shop where she sells canned goods, beverages and snacks.

Virginia is a new member of HSPFI. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, beverages and bread. In the future, Virginia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and bread.

loans.name: Nadera

texts.en:
Nadera is a hardworking, ambitious widow. Her husband passed away 20 years ago in a car accident on the same day her youngest daughter was born. On that day, Nadera was left with six children to raise.

Since she did have an educational background, Nadera started to prepare food for working mothers and be paid for it so she could survive with her family.
