Step by step, she was able to turn her small business into a catering business in Al Zarqa, have a whole new kitchen to work in, and send all of her kids into schools to get the best educational level they could have.

Going through what she experienced, Nadera decided to help more families by employing them in her catering business to support their families. Now Nadera has applied for a loan to expand her business and buy a delivery bus to be able to serve other cities like Amman.

loans.use: To buy a delivery bus

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a single woman with four children, all of whom have graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a dry fish selling business at the market for her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to boost her business to meet her customer’s needs. 

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase two goats, bundles of fish and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase two goats, bundles of fish and cooking fat.

loans.name: Archil

texts.en:
Archil is 43 years old and married. He is from the village Gantiadi, South Georgia, and lives with his wife and 8 year-old-son. His son goes to school. The family’s only source of income is agriculture. They have a small dairy farm with two milk cows and they sell milk to local dairy retailers. Along with the dairy farm, Archil and his family cultivate potatoes, wheat, and barley on their two-hectare plot of land. They sell their produce in Tbilisi, the capital city. Archil worked hard during this entire year. Weather conditions were favorable as well, and he has had a good harvest. Archil hopes that he’ll be able to sell it for good price.

Archil is requesting a loan to finance his harvesting and transportation activities. He will use his loan to hire a tractor owner, who will help harvest his produce, and a truck driver, who will take the harvested potatoes and corn to Archil’s storehouse. Approximately 40% of his loan will also be used to purchase wood for the oven, which is the only means of heat in Archil’s village during winter months.

loans.use: to hire harvesting and transportaton help and to purchase wood

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
This is Gloria, 49, a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Renato, an employee, and mother to her three children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Gloria oversees operations of their truck rental business. They have two trucks that they offer to be rented for cargo or for people who need a truck when transferring household materials to other places. They provide their services within the city & nearby provinces. Aside from this she also earns other income from the renters who occupy a small store beside her house. She earns a minimum of 3600 Philippine Pesos (PHP) every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and for maintenance of her trucks. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Gloria hopes to acquire another truck and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their truck.

loans.name: Kizza

texts.en:
Kizza is 44 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, with four of them currently in school. For the past 9 years, Kiza has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, Kizza has requested a loan of 2,200,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities like soap for resale, and it will help Kizza to generate greater profits and expand his business. Kizza hopes that in the future he will be able to open up a bakery business and supply the town with bread. 

Kizza is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Kizza who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities like soap for resale.

loans.name: Rosella

texts.en:
Rosella is a female motorcycle operator. She is 34 years old and blessed with four children. She has already been working in this occupation for one year and is earning PHP 300 per day, which is usually deficient given the expenses to put her children through school.

As a woman, it is difficult for her to be a tricycle operator. However, she still pursues it rather than stay at home. To maintain the strength of her motorcycle to travel, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy paint, new reserve tires and oil.

She hopes through this loan that she will be able to generate more income so she can better meet the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy paint, new reserve tires and oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy his own motorcycle

loans.name: Sevda

texts.en:
Sevda is an active 49-year-old mother of three. Sevda is engaged in a farming business and cultivates wheat, seasonal fruits and vegetables. She sells her crops in the Agsu central bazaar. Her two sons and daughter always help her to improve their living conditions. The income she earns from this business allows her to take care of her family. 

She has a good credit history. Sevda needs to buy seeds and organic fertilizer. Sevda is requesting a loan of 1,300 AZN to help her with this purchase.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es: Yaneth, de 42 años es una mujer ejemplar. Vive en compañía de Miguel, su esposo por 14 años. Ambos tienen 7 hijos de los cuales solo vive con 6 de ellos en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la localidad del Tambo. Ella nació en Acostambo, ahí comenzó a forjarse con lo único que sabe “la agricultura”, sus principales sembríos constan de papa, los cuales realiza en sociedad con su una pariente de su familia, quien también administra un grifo que pusieron juntos. Pues ella hace algunos años comenzó a vivir en la ciudad por los estudios de sus hijos. Ahí empezó a vender anticuchos en una esquina de su casa, según cuenta gana un promedio de 20 nuevos soles diarios, además de los fines de semana, donde vende fruta de toda variedad. Con todos estos ingresos sumados los de su esposo, quien es carpintero, podrá comprarse su casa propia, y así minimizar los gastos de alquiler que realizan cada mes, eso es su “sueño”. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Jooc sonjolla” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para concretar sus planes. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Yaneth, de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcirlos entre sus sembríos de papa.
texts.en:
Yaneth, 42, is an exemplary woman.  She lives with Miguel, her husband of 14 years.  They have seven children but only six still live with them in a rented house located in Tambo.  She was born in Acostambo and that’s where she started to develop “in agriculture” which is all she knows.  Her main crop is potato which she farms in partnership with a female relative who also manages a water spigot they installed together because she moved to the city a few years ago so that her children could go to school.  She started selling various items on the corner where she lives and, according to her, she makes on average about 20 soles daily and on weekends she sells fruit of all sorts.  With all this income and added to what her husband earns as a carpenter she will be able to buy a house of her own and reduce monthly rental costs; that is her “dream.”  

She belongs to the “Jooc sonjolla” communal bank and this is the first MFP loan where she hopes to get your support to solidify her plans.  She enjoys being part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible, very mutually supportive people.  If Yaneth were to receive your support, she’ll use the requested money to buy natural fertilizer to spread among her potato crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Salve

texts.en:
Salve is 43 years old and lives in Purok 3 Gango, Ozamiz City. She is married with three children. 

Salve has a buy & sell business and earns approximately PHP 7,000 each month doing this type of business. She has a requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase more dried fish for her retail business. 

Salve has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Salve hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for her retail business.

loans.name: Gloria Elena

texts.es: La señora Gloria a sus 53 años de edad es madre de tres hijos, se dedica desde hace 12 años a la reparación y arreglo de prendas de vestir desde su casa con la ayuda de una maquina de coser familiar que adquirió. Adicional a esta labor realiza lencería, acolchados para camas y bolsos en índigo y cuero sobre pedido. La señora Gloria requiere de la compra de una máquina plana que le permita confeccionar prendas de mayor tamaño. Con lo anterior, la señora Gloria podrá mejorar su eficiencia y producción, y aumentar sus ventas e ingresos. El sueño de la señora Gloria es poder configurar su propio taller de confección y en este poder generar empleos directos y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Sra. Gloria, 53, has three children.  She has operated a tailoring business for 12 years, fitting and mending clothing pieces on an ordinary sewing machine that she bought and installed at home.  She also makes products to order: lingerie, comforters and leather bags, for example.  Sra. Gloria wants to buy an industrial-sized sewing machine so that she can fill orders for larger garments.  Replacing the old machine with the new one will allow her to improve her output and operate more efficiently.  Her goal is to open a workshop, something that would both generate employment for others and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Ubora Wa Kahawa Jama Group

texts.en:
Helmina is a 24 years old a mother of two children, one of whom is attending primary education. She has been growing coffee, maize and beans for over 8 years. She faces agricultural problems such as lack of fertilizers and crop diseases.

She is working hard to find more funds for buying fertilizers and insecticides for her growing crops. She has a target in five years to expand her scale of production from 4 to 12 acres, also to buy simple coffee curing machine together with owning private transport.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics and beauty products

loans.name: Ezibatheth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 44 years old and the single mother of two children. She has been selling clothes for the last 10 years, earning a monthly income of approximately Kes 22,000.

She is requesting her first loan with KADET of Kes 30,000 which she will use to buy stocks of trousers, shirts, jackets, bags and blouses. With the anticipated profits she will start another type of business.

Her hopes and dreams are to expand her business and improve her literacy.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.en:
Dionisio is an entrepreneur from Trinidad, Bohol. He sells ready-to-wear clothes like men's and women's shirts. Dionisio also sells slippers and accessories. A hard-working father, Dionisio sells fried chicken to his community so he could have an extra income. He said one of his top priorities is his child's education.

Dionisio requested this loan to buy chicken meat, cooking oil and more items to sell, such as shirts. Dionisio hopes to continue earning and be able to feed his family 3 times a day and keep his child in school.

loans.use: to buy chicken meat, cooking oil and more items to sell, such as shirts.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Mère de huit enfants, Akossiwa est une femme mariée âgée de 48 ans résidant à Baguida. Akossiwa est une marchande de bouillie  préparée à base du mil et accompagné des gâteaux à domicile. Akossiwa revend sa marchandise en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Akossiwa s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché du nécessaire pour sa préparation et demande ce crédit pour commander des bols de mil et des unités de gâteaux afin de gagner une marge bénéficiaire assez importante pour pouvoir aider son mari dans les charges de la famille.

loans.use: Acheter 100 bols de mil et 40 unités de gâteaux.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a widow with four children all in Primary school. She is hard working and very active in group activities.

With the husband they started with two rooms in 2004 and in June 2005 they added two more to be four all together. She gets USD.88 every month and in addition she sells bananas, maize and vegetables.

loans.use: She wants to construct another room because there is enough space and demand for rental rooms in Nairobi.

loans.name: Esin

texts.en: Esin J. is 56 years old and together with her daughter keep an industrial goods store which is right to the cooperative market of the town. They both keep this store since 1996 and are well famous in their business.  They started their business because both were unemployed but the business had its development and now this store is the only source of income for both women and their families. Now Esin J. and her daughter need $ 1200 for working capital.

loans.use: For working capital

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Nkurankan, Ghana is a large marking centre for the people of the Yilo Krobo District of Ghana. Vida L. is a resident of Nkurankan and sells fried fish in the market. She is also a client of Kraban Support Foundation and is seeking a Kiva loan of $700.00 to help her improve and expand her business.

loans.use: Wants to expand her fried fish market.

loans.name: Zafar

texts.ru:
Zafar D. has been an active client of MLF MicroInvest for over 2 years. He has been in business for no less than 3 years. He orders his goods directly from his suppliers. Zafar D. began his business by selling 4-5 varieties of candies. By now, he has tripled the assortment of goods. Zafar D. is married and has 2 children of school age. He asks for $300 loan to increase the assortment of the goods sold, so that he can use the extra profits to pay for education of his children.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Чураев Зафар является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 2-х лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 3 лет. Товары заказывает у своих поставщиков. Начала свой бизнес с продажи 4-5 видов конфет. На сегодняшний день его ассортимент увеличился втрое. Он женат и имеет 2 детей. Дети учатся в школе. Ему необходимо 300$, для увеличения ассортимента товара, а полученную прибыль потратить на обучение своих детей.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: María Yolanda

texts.es:
Mrs. María Yolanda G. D. O. was born in the Usquil district in the Province of Otuzco in the Department of "La Libertad." 20 years ago she left her home community due to health problems, and she has not re-settled there. She is 70 years old, and lives alone with her husband.

Ever since she was young, Maria worked to bring products from her community (fruits, potatoes, herbs, etc) to the bigger cities such as Trujillo to sell in the markets. She is a member of the community bank "Laredo" in the Laredo district of the Trujillo province.

Maria can no longer travel, so now her family sends her products and she sells them in the Laredo market. With a loan of $700, she will purchase fruits and vegetables of the season to continue offering them to her loyal customers.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer

La señora María Yolanda G. D. O. nació en Usquil distrito D. la Provincia D. Otuzco del Departamento D. La Libertad – Perú hace 20 años salió D. su pueblo por problemas D. salud, tiene 70 años y vive solo con su esposo.

DesD. muy joven trabajó trayendo productos D. su pueblo (fruta, papa, oca, hierbas, rocoto, etc.) a las ciudades más grandes como Trujillo y vendiendo en los mercados. Actualmente radica en el distrito D. Laredo D. la Provincia D. Trujillo, y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Laredo”.

Ya no pueD. viajar, sus familiares le envían los productos y ella continúa vendiendo en el mercado D. Laredo. Con el préstamo D. S/. 2,200 ($700 aproximadamente) comprará frutas y verduras D. la estación para seguir ofertando a sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables, and for working capital

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen lives in the region of San Martín, in the province of Mariscal Cáceres, in the district of Juanjui. Her business is located in the central market of the town, and she belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Trabajadoras”. She sells stews, juices of fruits from the costal region, and fresh and cooked vegetables for salads. She began the business with the goal of improving her family’s economic situation. Thanks to the support of her family and her constant effort and perseverance, the business has grown considerably. When she first started her business, she was selling a ½ kilo of three different kinds of stew in a day, and now she sells 30 kilos per day of stews and also the other products she has.

Carmen is 56 years old. She lives with her husband and one of her younger daughters; they both help out in the business. The rest of the children are now independent. This business gives Carmen great satisfaction in earnings and in her personal life. She is an example of struggle and perseverance for other women, which encourages them to fight for their dreams and shows them that with effort and perseverance, one can achieve many things. Carmen plans to continue increasing her variety of products and improving service. That way she can assure the satisfaction and loyalty of her customers.

With the credit of S./ 1,500.00 (approximately $500.00) recently granted her by Manuela Ramos, to be paid back in 6 payments, she will buy a variety of stew ingredients, such as Huascar beans, Canary beans, cowpeas, and split peas. She’ll also buy vegetables, fruits, etc., in large quantities (sacks), and also some kitchen utensils, such as large steel cooking pots and large spoons. This is all due to the great demand being generated by her business and the desire to improve the quality of services and products so she can offer the best to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Carmen vive en la región San Martín provincia de Mariscal Cáceres distrito de Juanjui, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado central de la zona, pertenece al Banco Comunal "Las Trabajadoras". Se dedica a la venta de menestras cocidas, venta de extracto de frutas de la región y de la costa y venta de verduras picadas frescas y cocidas para ensalada, inició el negocio con el fin de mejorar la situación económica de la familia, gracias al apoyo de su familia, a su esfuerzo constante y perseverante, ha logrado que el negocio crezca considerablemente tanto así que en sus inicios comenzó vendiendo ½ kilo de tres variedades de menestras y actualmente vende 30 kilos diarios de menestras variadas y los demás derivados. La señora Carmen tiene 56 años, vive con su esposo y con una hija menor quienes son el pilar y el apoyo en el negocio, sus demás hijos son independientes, el negocio que dirige le esta dando grandes satisfacciones en su economía y en su vida personal, ya que es un ejemplo de lucha y perseverancia para otras mujeres a las que las incentiva y alienta a luchar por sus sueños y que con esfuerzo y perseverancia se puede lograr muchas cosas; en sus planes está el seguir incrementando en variedades de productos y mejorar el servicio del negocio y lograr así la satisfacción y fidelidad de sus clientes. Con el crédito recientemente otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/.1,500.00 (US$ 500.00) pagaderos en 6 cuotas, comprará menestras variadas como huascar, canario, chiclayo, alverja partida, verduras, frutas, etc. en cantidades más grandes (sacos), así como también algunos utensilios de cocina como ollas de acero más grandes, cucharones, todo esto por la gran demanda que le esta generando el negocio, así como también para mejorar la calidad de sus servicios y productos y ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy stew ingredients and fruits at wholesale prices. To buy kitchen implements.

loans.name: Estefanía

texts.es:
Estefanía is a hard-working mother of four children, who carries out her daily work in the street of her town, offering her delicious pork scratchings (chicharrones). While she dedicates her time to this worthwhile work her husband, Valentín, works in a small metal-soldering workshop and both, as a result of their dedication and much effort have been able to obtain a small amount of capital in order to renovate their humble house with the aim of improving their well-being and providing a better quality of life for their small children, who are currently studying in a modest educational centre in their hometown, Ayaviri. She intends to continue with her work, which often fills her with much satisfaction and happiness because of the good results she obtains.

To continue and expand her sales, she wishes to buy more raw materials in order to make her delicious pork scratching and is asking for a loan in order to acquire products to cook and prepare at home and at the same time to help her husband acquire new work tools. Help us to realise this wish to continue delighting the palates of her customers.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Estefanía, es una diligente madre de cuatro hijos, desempeña su labor diaria en las calles de su ciudad, ofreciendo sus deliciosos chicharrones (carne de cerdo asada). Mientras ella se dedica a esta noble labor su esposo, Valentín, trabaja en un pequeño taller de soldadura metálica y ambos a través de su dedicación y mucho empeño han podido obtener un pequeño capital para refaccionar su humilde casita con el fin de brindarles bienestar y una mejor calidad de vida a sus pequeños niños, quienes se encuentran estudiando en un modesto centro educativo de su ciudad natal, Ayaviri. Ella tiene en mente seguir desempeñándose en este trabajo, que a menudo la llena de mucha satisfacción y alegría por los buenos resultados que va obteniendo.

Para continuar y acrecentar sus ventas desea comprar más insumos para la elaboración de sus deliciosos chicharrones y solicita un préstamo para adquirir productos para su cocción y preparación en casa y al mismo tiempo para apoyar a su esposo y adquirir herramientas de trabajo nuevas. Ayudemos a concretar este anhelo para seguir deleitando los paladares de sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials and cooking products in order to continue preparing her delicious pork scratchings with the aim of helping her  husband acquire new tools for better daily employment.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
It's been 8 years since Josefina C. got divorced, leaving her in charge of three kids which she has to support since her husband doesn't offer economic support. For this reason, she decided to sell beauty products through catalog among her friends. With lots of effort she's been able to move her kids ahead offering them an education and making sure they are able to take care for themselves. She doesn't want the same to happen to them.

However, Josefina is actually applying for a loan in order to be able to buy merchandise this holiday season. This way she have different beauty products to offer her clients.The loan she is requesting is of $425 which will be available to be repaid within 4 months. With this money Josefina will be able to purchase more merchandise and be able to offer a wider variety to her clients. With your help Josefina will be able to support her kids, offer them the education they need and be able to send them to college.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 8 años que Josefina C. se divorció, quedándose a cargo de 3 hijos de los cuales ella tiene que mantener, puesto que su esposo no le brinda la manutención necesaria. Es por eso que decidió comenzar a vender productos de belleza por catálogo entre sus amistades. Y con mucho esfuerzo va sacando poco a poco adelante a sus hijos brindándoles estudio para que ellos sean unas personas de bien y no pasen por lo mismo que está pasando Josefina.

Sin embargo actualmente Josefina está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mercancía para esta temporada navideña y así tener algo que ofrecerles a sus clientes para los regalos. El crédito que está solicitando es de US $425 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses y con este dinero Josefina podrá comprar más mercancía para tener variedad en sus productos. Con tu ayuda Josefina podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos para que tengan estudios universitarios.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for the holiday season

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa K. is married with two children.  He sells plastic sandals and children’s clothing in Magburaka town in Sierra Leone. Musa started his business two years ago and expanded it with his first loan from SMT.  His business is the only source of income for the family.  He is requesting another loan to expand his business so that he can take better care of his family.

loans.use: To buy sandals and clothing for resale

loans.name: Naim

texts.en:
Naim I.  is 23 years old. Naim  supports his mother and his younger brother. 

Naim is provides taxi services from his vehicle. He is a very nice, diligent and smart young man. Naim has been working as a taxi-driver for the past 2 years. He is applying for a loan for the first time as he needs additional funding for purchasing spare parts to repairhis vehicle. He requests 2 000.00 Somoni ($600.00 US Dollars) for the term of 12 months. Let us help Naim with his intention to make his business more successful and to generate a stable income for his family.

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts for the repair of his vehicle.

loans.name: Sauda's Uzomboko Group

texts.en:
Sauda is 35 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 21 and 15 years old. She and her husband also take care of 2 other children, ages 7 and 2 years old. Sauda started her food and fruits selling business in 2006. Everyday, she works from 8am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mwema and Mwajabu, who have businesses dealing in food sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es:
Alcides Alcara is 43-years-old and is the owner of "La Despensa Alci". A despensa is a mini-market that is very common in Paraguayan neighborhoods. In case someone needs some type of merchandise from food to cleaning products, they go to the despensa to get it.

Five years ago, Alci saw a large opportunity in the despensas market due to the shortage of them in his neighborhood, so he decided to open one. Today he has a loyal clientele, neighbors who know him and always come to him when they need something.

Alci's family is made up of his wife, Ana Rivas, and his two children, who have always helped him with his business. Ana is in charge of helping the customers of "La Despensa Alci." With the money from this loan, Alci will buy the merchandise necessary to continue his business: sugar, flour, herbs, rice, noodles, bread, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Alcides A. de 43 años de edad es el dueño de “La Despensa Alci”. La despensa es un mini supermercado muy común en barrios paraguayos. En caso de necesitar algún tipo de mercadería desde comestibles hasta productos de limpieza los vecinos del barrio siempre acuden a él.

Hace ya cinco anos Alci vio una gran oportunidad en el mercado de despensas debido a la escasez de ellas en su barrio, fue entonces cuando decidió abrir una. Hoy día ya cuenta con una clientela formada, vecinos que lo conocen y siempre recurren a el en caso de necesidad.

La familia de Alci esta conformada por su esposa, Ana Rivas, y sus dos hijos que siempre lo ayudan en el negocio. Ana es la encargada de la atención al cliente de “La Despensa Alci”. Con el dinero otorgado Alci comprará las mercaderías necesarias para continuar el negocio, las cuales son azúcar, harina, hierba, arroz, fideos, panificados y otros.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (rice, sugar, noodles, bread, etc.)

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Born in 1958 in Ghana, Mrs. Adjo A. currently lives with her husband and six (6) children in Afoudomé (Prefecture of Zio). Her husband is a farmer and draws very little income from his work. Dynamic and entrepreneurial, Mrs. Adjo A. has developed her small business selling foodstuffs in the village. Thanks to this well-managed business, she takes care of the feeding of her children in one way or another. Honest and rigorous, she managed her previous loan well. She is currently asking for a loan which will serve to buy bags of maize and other goods in order to strengthen her business. Thus, she will be able to increase her income and meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1958 au Ghana, Madame A. Adjo vit actuellement avec son mari et ses six (6) enfants à Afoudomé (P/Zio). Son mari est cultivateur et tire très peu de revenu de son activité. Dynamique et entreprenante, Madame A. Adjo développe sa petite activité de vente de denrée alimentaire dans le village. A partir de cette activité qu’elle maîtrise bien, elle assume tant bien que mal les besoins élémentaires des enfants. Honnête et rigoureuse, elle a su gérer le précédent crédit. Elle sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit qui lui servira à acheter des sacs de maïs, et autres en de renforcer ses activités. Ainsi donc, elle pourra augmenter ses revenus et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Tun

texts.en:
Tun C., 54, grows crops on farmland located behind her house. She earns approximately $6.50 per day from the sale of her crops. Her husband, Svay Chun, sells firewood around the village. They have five children, all of whom are married, and they live in Dondeav Village, Siem Reap Province.

Tun C. is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase two oxen to use to transport firewood for her husband's business. She hopes that the purchase of these oxen will improve working conditions and allow them to increase their household income to better provide for their family.

loans.use: To purchase two oxen to use for her husband's business

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva knew that she would have to support her household herself for many years when her husband died. She had to manage on her own to generate income to settle the needs of her 6 children. Now they are adults that can maintain themselves. Elva is dedicated to the arduous tasks of the field. Like she herself says, one works where one’s strength permits. She feels full of vitality to continue, having already completed 20 years as a hard-working farmer, making trips to sell her products in the capital city. To increase the profits from her crop of potatoes and corn she is requesting a loan that she will invest in buying agricultural supplements and fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Elva supo durante muchos años solventar sola su hogar, luego que su esposo muriera, ella tuvo que ingeniárselas para que sola pueda generar ingresos para solventar las necesidades D. sus 6 hijos, ahora ellos ya son personas adultas que se auto sostienen. Elva se dedica a las arduas tareas del campo, como ella misma dice, trabajara hasta donD. sus fuerzas lo permitan, y se siente llena D. vitalidad para continuar, son ya 20 años cumplidos D. Elva como una esforzada agricultora, realizando viajes para vender sus productos en la ciudad capital. Para incrementar las ganancias D. su siembra D. papa y maíz está solicitando un préstamo el que invertirá comprando abono y fertilizantes

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplements and fertilizer to increase her potato and corn crop.

loans.name: Sountou

texts.fr: Sountou B., 38 ans est mariée avec 03 enfants en charge. Elle sollicite un prêt pour renforcer son petit commerce. Elle pourra ainsi acheter des légumes qu’elle va revendre en détail sur sa table de commerce installée devant sa maison. <b>Elle va rembourser au bout de six mois en une seule échéance<b/>.
texts.en:
Sountou Balda, aged 38, is married with three children to take care of. She is requesting a loan to strengthen her small business. She will thus be able to purchase vegetables which she will sell at retail from her business stand set up outside her home. She will repay the loan after six months in a single installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell vegetables from a small stand

loans.name: Maria Rosly

texts.es:
La señora Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Paykanas”, ubicado en la Av. Miraflores Mz.A Lt.1 PJ. José Olaya, distrito de Yarinacocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 42 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos, 2 de ellos mayores de edad y 2 que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja de obrero en la municipalidad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/.300, decide invertir en la venta de productos lácteos.

En la actualidad, Maria cuenta con 3 motokar, los cuales son las herramienta de trabajo que le generan ganancias para cumplir con sus gastos y responsabilidades.    

Con este préstamo de S/.1,200, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, invertirá en el arreglo de 2 de sus motokar, los cuales los tapizará a un costo de S/. 300 cada tapizada y en el arreglo del motor a un costo de S/.150 cada motor. 
   
Maria se siente una mujer triunfadora. Agradece a Manuela Ramos y sobre todo a Dios por brindarle grandes oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria H. is a member of the “Las Paykanas” microfinance institute, located on Ave. Miraflores Mz. A Lt.1 PJ. José Olaya, in the Yarinacocha district, in the department of Ucayali. She is 42 years of age and has 4 children, 2 of whom are adults, and 2 of whom are still her dependants. Her husband works as a laborer in the municipality. She decided to invest the first 300.00 PEN loan that she obtained from Manuela Ramos in dairy product sales.

Maria currently owns 3 motorcycle taxis, which are her work tools that generate earnings that cover the household expenses.

She will utilize this loan of 1,200.00 PEN, which will be repaid in 4 months, to repair 2 of her motorcycle taxis. She will upholster them at a cost of 300.00 PEN each, and repair the engine for 150.00 PEN each.

Maria feels like a triumphant woman. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos, but aboveall, to God, for giving her such great opportunities in life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair two of her motorcycle taxis

loans.name: Bu

texts.en:
Mrs. Bu K. is a villager in Trapaing Krasang Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Ert Bo, is a construction worker who can only make a small income to support his family. Although they have different business activities, they still cannot support their family well. Thus, Mrs. Bu K. has decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a cow for breeding.

Mrs. Bu K. is 38 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is at the age of three years old. Her husband is shown on her right in the photo.

loans.use: to add to her savings to buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia tiene 32 años, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos, todos viven en la casa de sus padres. Se levanta a las 4.00am para preparar los desayunos de sus hijos que se van a la escuela, después prepara el almuerzo para llevar a su esposo, donde trabaja en sus plantaciones de café, de inmediato regresa para atender su tienda de abarrotes. A ella le agrada estar en comunicación directa con la gente cuando vende sus productos, con este negocio esta desde hace un año atrás, y dice que poco a poco ya está ganado clientela, sobre todo por el trato que les da a sus clientes. Su dificultad es la falta de dinero para tener todos los productos que sus clientes necesiten. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mercadería, como arroz y azúcar por sacos para que le dure y esa inversión será de 1.000 soles, de ese modo puede dar un precio mas cómodo y atraer a más clientes.
texts.en:
Sonia is 32 years old. She is a common law wife and has two children. They all live in parents' home. She gets up at 4:00 a.m. to prepare breakfast for her children who go to school. Later she prepares lunch to take to her husband who works on the coffee plantations. She then returns immediately to tend to her grocery store. She likes to be in direct communication with the people when she sells her products. She has had the business for a year and says that little by little her clientele has grown, above all because of how she treats them. Her difficulty is the lack of money needed to have all of the products that her clients need. This is her first loan with MFP. With the money requested she will buy merchandise like sacks of rice and sugar so that they last. That investment will be 1,000 soles and she can offer a better price and attract more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for a grocery store

loans.name: Nohemí

texts.es:
La señorita Noemí A. en casa de una amiga, y trabaja en un salón de belleza.
La vivienda necesita protecciones de metal en puertas y ventanas porque ellas trabajan todo el día y temen ser victimas de un robo.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y por ello solicita un préstamo para darle seguridad a la casa donde vive.
texts.en:
Noemí A. lives at a friend’s house and works in a beauty salon. The home needs additional security, such as metal bars on the doors and windows, because she works all day and fears they will be victims of a robbery. She is a very hard-working person and for this reason requests this loan to provide added security to the house where she lives.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install protective metal bars on the doors and windows of the house she lives in.

loans.name: Ruth Mary

texts.es:
La señora Ruth Mary S. S. tiene 38 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Emprendedoras II  y vive en el Asentamiento Humano Luis Alberto S. Mz D lote 1 del Puerto Marítimo de Salaverry provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudio hasta tercero de Secundaria, pero no continuó porque se caso a los 17 años y tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales el hijo mayor trabaja.
Al principio del negocio vendía postres típicos, por ejemplo, mazamorra, arroz sambito, otros dulces y también papa rellena. Actualmente tiene un pequeño bazar en su casa.
El primer crédito fue de 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas, lo invirtió en insumos para sus comidas que vendía en ese tiempo.
Con este crédito de 500 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas invertirá en algunas cosas para Navidad.
Ruth desea con construir su casa.
texts.en:
Ruth Mary S. S. is 38 years old, and belongs to the Banco Comunal Las Emprendadoras II. She lives in the settlement Luis Alberto S. Mz D lote 1 of the Puerto Marítimo de Salaverry in the Trujillo province, departmento de La Libertad, Perú. She studied up to her third year of high school, but had to leave school because she got married at age 17 and went on to have 4 children, of which only the eldest is now working. When she began her business, she was selling traditional Peruvian desserts like mazamorra, rice pudding with molasses, and other such sweets, as well as stuffed potatoes. Today she has established a small market in her home. Her first loan was for 300 soles, paid off in four installments, and she used it to pay for ingredients for the foods she was selling at that time. With this new loan of 500 soles, which will also be paid off in four installments, she will invest in materials to sell for the Christmas season. Ruth also wishes to use it to work on her home.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in materials for Christmas season sales

loans.name: Mrs. Chhum Chhorn Village Bank Group

texts.en: Ten people living in Preak Treing village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Chhum C., the 41- year-old village bank president, is a fish seller. Her husband, Mr. S. Savorn, is a fisherman. In his fishing, he faces a problem because he does not have enough fishnets. Thus, Mrs. Chhum C. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishnets for her husband. She hopes to increase their income and improve the living conditions with this loan. She has four children, two of whom are printing house workers, while another helps the father work, and the remaining one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more fishnets for her husband's fishing.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
Concepcion  inició el negocio para poder ayudar a 2 nietas, ya que cuando sus hijos se casaron se fueron de la casa y ella se quedo a cargo de sus nietas.
Comenzó el negocio en Febrero de 1998 cuando una amiga la invitó a ser parte de un grupo solidario que iba a solicitar crédito en una empresa. En aquel entonces, ella vendía productos cosmeticos y otros productos pero tenía muy poco dinero para invertir, pero cuando entro a este grupo solidario tuvo dinero para invertir en productos de otras lineas.
 
Su negocio ha ido progresando poco a poco ya que ha ido aumentado el número de  clientes y desea llegar a alcanzar el grado MASTER dentro de la empresas multinivel donde vende y también seguir ganando regalos con la venta de sus productos.

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $12,000 que pagara en 12 catorcenas para  surtir pedidos de sus clientes lo cual le ayudará a entregarlos a tiempo y asi seguir teniéndolos contentos para que sigan comprando sus productos.
texts.en:
Concepcion started her business to be able to support her two granddaughters. When her children got married they moved out of her house and left her in charge of the two girls.

She began her business in February of 1998 when her friend invited her to join a group of entreprenuers that was going to ask for a loan from a company. Back then she sold cosmetic products and other products as well. However, she did not have enough money to invest in her business. When she entered the group and they got the loan, she was able to get enough money to invest in purchasing products from other cometic lines.

Her business has progressed little by little and her number of clients has increased. Her goal is to get to the MASTER level of sales in the multilevel company that she sells products for. She also wants to keep earning gifts from the company by selling products.

She needs a loan for $825. She will make 12 payments every 14 days. She will use the money to by products that her clients order, which will help her to fill her orders on time and will keep her customers happy.

(Translated by Ashlee of San Roque High School.)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Zareth Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Zareth Guadalupe tiene una concesión  de una C. de abarrotes y venta de diversos productos, con una antigüedad de 3 años administrando con éxito este negocio. 
La señora Zareth E. y su esposo le han ido haciendo mejoras a su casita para brindarle a la familia una mayor comodidad, lo cual hace efecto del porque están solicitando este crédito, ya que es para la construcción de una barda lateral.
texts.en:
Zareth Guadalupe owns a chain grocery store selling various products, and has run this business successfully for three years. Mrs. Zareth E. and her husband have been making improvements to their house to make their family more comfortable. They are requesting this loan for the construction of a side wall.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construct a side wall

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia A. is 30 years old and the widowed mother of one child. Currently her son is in school. She lost her husband a year ago through a minor sickness which no one thought would kill him. She lives in Elmina in the central region of Ghana.

Emelia is a trader who deal with assorted products like cooking utensils, clothing materials, drinking glasses, etc. She mostly sells through hawking (house-to-house selling). She has been trading for eight years and two months now. With her humorous behavior, she has attracted lots of customers who purchase from her stand. She treks to Accra to purchase her stock of goods.

Recently Emelia has been facing challenges in her business as a result of inadequate funds to buy stock. She requests a loan to buy more of the products like cooking utensils, clothing materials and drinking glasses, which are frequently demanded by her numerous customers. With the loan she believes she will have the resources to make lots of profits and be able to build a store to reduce the frequent walking in the streets to sell. She belongs to a village bank called Shepherd. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy cooking utensils, clothing materials, drinking glasses, and gari to sell

loans.name: Bimala

texts.en:
Mrs. Bimala A. lives in Bhakepati which is located in Kathmandu district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural work. Mrs. Bimala A. lives in a single family home.

She has three members including herself in her family. Her husband is a taxi driver and drives his taxi around Kathmandu valley. She has one son who is studying in grade 9.

Mrs. Bimala A. is engaged in poultry farming. She buys chicks and sells them to the dealers after 50 to 60 days. She engaged in this business to improve the living standard of her family.

Now she is requesting a Rs 25,000 loan to buys chicks for her business. She wants to provide a better education for her son.

loans.use: To buy chicks to raise and sell

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida is a 28 year old single woman living in Saida, southern Lebanon. She has owned her own clothing store since 2005. Today, Sajida is requesting to borrow $1,200 to increase her purchases.

loans.use: To increase purchases.

loans.name: Digna Rosa

texts.es: La señora Digna Rosa Pérez M. , tiene la edad de 35 años , habita en el barrio Esquí pulas , junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como guarda de seguridad , para apoyarla con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen a su cargo dos niñas una de 10 años que estudia su primaria y otra de un añito , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , doña Digna desde hace cuatro años trabaja en una casa privada como ama de llaves , al inicio con sus propios esfuerzos , fue construyendo poco a poco su casa , pero se le es difícil sin un financiamiento , los sueños de ella es ver construida su vivienda y por eso que opto por trabajar con nosotros y esta contenta ya que con el primer financiamiento logro hacer parte de la vivienda y ahora con este segundo terminara parte de sala. A futuro espera terminar y tener una casa digna para su familia.
texts.en:
Digna Rosa Pérez M., 35, lives in the Esquí Pulas neighborhood. She lives with her husband, who works as a security guard to help with the household expenses. They have a ten-year old daughter, who is in elementary school, and a one-year old daughter. The family's plan is to improve their living conditions. Digna has been working as a housekeeper in a private home for four years. Through her own efforts, they have been building their house little by little. But it is difficult without financing. Her dreams are to see her house finished. That is why she has opted to work with AFODENIC. She is happy with the part of her house that she did with the first loan. Now, with the second loan, she will finish the living room. In the future, she hopes to finish and have a decent house for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to finish her living room

loans.name: Rosalinda De Constancia Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Rosalinda D. Constancia pertenece a la Comunidad D. Pampas-Constancia del distrito D. Lircay ubicado en el departamento D. Huancavelica. Esta comunidad se dedica a la crianza D. vacunos y ganados, algunas se dedican al tejido, pero la mayoría son agricultores, es su imagen fuente D. ingresos.

Bertha Lucila es casada, tiene 4 hijos D. 10, 9, 8 y un bebe D. 11 meses, su negocio es una tienda D. abarrotes, se inició con un capital pequeño, el negocio lo maneja ella misma, su esposo por falta D. trabajo se fue a laborar a la mina. Ha solicitado un préstamo D. 500 soles que invertirá en su tienda para la compra D. productos D. primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio, surtirlo D. muchas cosas, para tener más ventas y más ganancias.

Reymunda es casada, tiene 3 hijos D. 22, 17 y 12 años, ella tiene una tienda donD. venD. dulces, galletas, refrescos, chupetines, chiclets, etc. Primero vendía ambulatoriamente en los estadios y actividades, posteriormente puso su tienda. Solicita un préstamo D. 600 soles para la compra D. golosinas, Reymunda quiere seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que sean profesionales y logre mejorar su vivienda.

Rosa es casada y tiene 6 hijos, en su tienda D. abarrotes venD. todo tipo D. productos D. primera necesidad, se inició hace 30 años con el apoyo D. su esposo e iniciativa D. sus hijos. Solicita un préstamo D. 600 soles para la compra D. productos para su tienda, le gustaría ser más independiente con su dinero, sus ahorros lo usara para mejorar su vivienda y apoyar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Community Bank "Rosalinda D. Constancia" belongs to the community of Pampas-constancia in the district of Lircay located in the department of Huancavelica. This community raises livestock and some weave, but most of its members are agricultural farmers and this is their primary source of income. Bertha Lucila is married, she has four children aged 10, 9, 8 and a baby of 11 months. She runs a grocery store, which she begun with a small amount of capital and manages herself because her husband due to a lack of work has left to work in the mines. She has asked for a loan of 500 soles to invest in her shop to purchase essential goods such as rice, sugar and oil. Her dream is to improve her business and to stock many more things in order to have higher sales and more income. Reymunda is married, she has three children aged 22, 17 and 12. She has a shop where she sells sweets, biscuits, soft drinks, candy, gum etc. She used to be a walking salesperson in the stadiums and at events, but later she established her own shop. She is asking for a loan of 600 soles in order to buy snacks. Reymunda wants to continue helping her children so that they can be professionals and better their lives. Rosa is married and has 6 children, in her grocery shop she sells all sorts of essential products. She started some 30 years ago with the help of her husband and the encouragement of their children. She is asking for a loan of 600 soles in order to purchase products for her shop. She would like to be more independent with her money and will use her savings to improve her home and help her children.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products to stock businesses

loans.name: Aitu

texts.en: Aitu M., 63, is married with 6 children. She has 2 years of experience in the pancake business. She sells to the  the public and people of the village 3 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 150 Tala (~100 USD). SPBD loans are Aitu’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients, pots, oil, gas oven and a filter for the business.

loans.name: Gloria Vilma

texts.es:
Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal Manantial.
Gloria es casada, tiene 40 años y 2 hijos, Gloria es casada, tiene 40 años y 2 hijos, Gloria junto a su esposo se dedican a la siembra de verduras en sus tierras y también alquila terrenos, sus ventas lo realiza en el mercado Nery García. 
Gloria necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de abono, semilla y peones.
Los sueños de Gloria son brindar una buena educación con sus hijos, ahorrar para tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the Communal Bank Manantial. She is 40 years old, and married with two children. Together with her husband, Gloria works cultivating vegetables on their own land as well as on land they rent. They sell their produce in the Nery Garcia market. Gloria is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds. Gloria's dream is to be able to provide a good education for her children, and save enough money to set up a shop in her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Ofelya

texts.en: Ofelya S. is a 50-year-old widow. Her husband was a volunteer soldier who died in the Artsakh war. Ofelya has a daughter and a son who are helping her run her business. She has a private house where she has built a bakery. Here she bakes and sells her product. Now Ofelya needs $2300 to repair her bakery and buy modern equipment for her business.

loans.use: To repair her bakery and buy modern equipment for her business

loans.name: Herculine

texts.en:
Herculine S. is from the village of Linangcayan, Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 49 years old. Herculine is single. To make a living, Herculine owns and operates a 'sari-sari' (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Herculine has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Herculine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Herculine is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Herculine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.en:
Marcelo D. is a rice grower. He is 59 years old and has lived in Trento, Agusan Del Sur Mindanao for his entire life. He says his neighbor convinced him to join and he observed that the loan really helped his neighbor grow a sari-sari (general store) business.

He would like to ask for a loan of PHP 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. He will use the loan to finance his farm. He needs to buy farming materials as well as fertilizers to grow rice.

Receiving a loan is truly worthwhile since it is a very urgent need of his farm. He chose CEVI because he heard that CEVI has the lowest interest rate on their loans, which is 2% a month.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Kaku

texts.en:
Kaku V. is currently in the business of selling books at the bookshop and is requesting a loan to purchase more texts and exercise books to sell. 

 Kaku is 26 years old and is Married with a husband that is a professional secondary teacher. She has 2 children and her children go to school. 

 With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a printing press.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more texts and exercise books to sell

loans.name: Cristo Vive Group

texts.es: Banco comunal "Cristo Vive" son socias unidas y alegres; las señoras tienen una amistad desde hace mucho tiempo. Se conocieron en sus actividades comerciales y son vecinas del barrio. Desempeñan diferentes tipos de actividades comerciales como: tienda de abarrotes, venta de comida y venta de cosméticos  sus negocios atienden en su propio domicilio y otros son ambulantes.  En cuanto al entorno competitivo podemos mencionar que sus competidores si bien están presentes en el barrio, pero las socias tienen sus clientes fieles que constantemente les compran sus productos, en caso de que no les va muy bien en el barrio se dirigen a otros lugares para realizar la comercialización de sus productos o diversifican su actividad económica de forma que puedan cumplir con el pago correspondiente y obtener más ingresos.  Con el crédito compraron para surtir sus tiendas, compra de material de trabajo y comprar insumos en mayor cantidad y las promotoras de cosméticos aprovecharon las ofertas y lograron acomodar el producto a un precio más elevado. Sus expectativas es  tener más ingresos y ser más independientes económicamente para que sus hijos puedan estudiar en un futuro, en cuanto a sus experiencias crediticias algunas solicitaron crédito en crecer y otras tienen créditos individuales, en cuanto a la experiencia en Agrocapital solo 5 socias cumplen su tercer ciclo el resto son nuevas.

loans.use: Capital de operaciones

loans.name: Parissi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Parissi de l’association Dori est composé de 6 femmes mariées de la ville de Tominian, une des préfectures de la  région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles avec  en moyenne 26 ans et au moins 4 enfants.
Les femmes du groupe Parissi font l’achat et la vente d’articles divers tels l’arachide,  les condiments alimentaires, les boissons de fabrication locales, les tissus etc. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs activités, les femmes du groupe Parissi de l’association Dori ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui, elles sont à leur premier prêt. 
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter une grande quantité d’articles divers de commerce auprès des grossistes et forains. Elles effectuent leurs ventes en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle riche et variée. 
Les membres du groupe Parissi comptent réaliser chacun un bénéfice mensuel 15 000 à 18 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille. 
NB : Alice Dembélé est absente de la photo pour raison de maladie.
texts.en:
The Parissi group of the Dori association is composed of 6 married women from the city of Tominian, one of the prefectures in the Ségou Region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional families and average 26 years of age and at least 4 children. The woman of the Parissi group buy and sell various products such as peanuts, food condiments, locally made beverages, fabrics, etc.

Eager to make their businesses profitable, the women of the Parissi group decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their first loan. The loan will be used to buy a large quantity of various products from wholesalers and fair vendors. They sell retail, for cash and on credit, to a very diverse clientele.

The members of the Parissi group intend to turn a monthly profit of XOF 15'000 to 18'000 (ca US$ 35 to 42) each, to be used to repay the loan and to provide for the daily expenses of their families.

NB: Alice Dembélé was ill when the photo was taken, and is therefore not in it.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell various products such as peanuts, food condiments, locally made beverages, fabrics, etc.

loans.name: Leandro

texts.es: Leandro A. S. reside en San Marcos municipio del departamento de San Salvador. A sus 65 años de edad Leandro sigue manteniendo la postura firme y responsabilidad en su negocio, con el cual sostiene a sus familia, que la compone sus tres hijos María de 21 años, Leandro de 14 y Javier de 12 años, también vive con ellos su esposa doña Berta. Leandro tiene montado su negocio en su domicilio ofreciendo diversos productos para el hogar, pero ahora el esta solicitando de este crédito ya que desea surtir su negocio con más variedad y cantidad de mercadería para su tienda.
texts.en:
Leandro A. S. lives in the town of San Marcos in the department of San Salvador. He is 65 years old and continues to maintain a strong position of responsibility at his business. His income enables him to sustain his family, which consists of his three children: Maria (age 21), Leandro (age 14), and Javier (age 12). He is married to Doña Berta.

Leandro established his business from home and sells different household products. He is requesting a loan because he wants to restock his store with more variety and a greater quantity of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is a 40 year old married woman from Agusan Del Sur. She lives with her husband and their five children. Her oldest child is now 18. She works hard not merely to provide for the daily needs of her family, but also to save for her children’s future. Evelyn is currently preparing her land for planting. She needs seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies. She thus applied to CEVI and is now requesting a loan of PHP 7,000. She will use this loan to finance her farm, buy the necessary supplies and pay the laborers who work at her farm.

loans.use: purchasing seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: 16 De Julio Group

texts.es: El grupo “16 D. Julio” esta representado por la señora Carmen Silvia y conformado por 11 miembros, la mayor parte D. las personas que componen este grupo son D. escasos recursos teniendo como ingreso solo un pequeño negocio los cuales montan en las ferias naviD.ñas pero cuando no se dedican a la venta D. juguetes poseen mercadería alternativa como la venta D. cueros, pan, comida, pollo, refrescos y otras se dedican al servicio D. limpieza domiciliaria. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición D. mercadería naviD.ña para la feria y para incrementar su capital D. trabajo.  En cuanto a la experiencia los miembros del grupo ya tienen experiencia en grupo solidarios gracias  a financiamientos anteriores en instituciones similares a la fundación Agrocapital pero los miembros del grupo están contentos por el apoyo económico D. nuestra institución les brinda ya que con ello podrán generar mejores ingresos y así podrán darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The 16 D. Julia group is represented by Carmen Silvia. It is comprised of 11 members. Most of the people who make up this group have scant resources, and their income is solely from their small businesses that they set up at Christmas fairs. When they are not selling toys they sell other merchandise like leather goods, bread, food, chicken, and soft drinks. Some proviD. housecleaning services. The loan is to get Christmas merchandise for the fair and to increase their work capital. The group members have experience with communal banks thanks to previous loans with institutions that are similar to the Agrocapital Foundation. The members are happy with the economic support from our institution because they will be able to generate more income. This way they will be able to give their families a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: Alejandrina tiene 32 años, vive con su pareja y su pequeño hijo, por el cual trabaja y se esfuerza a diario.Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de ropa  en un local ubicado  en uno de los mercados mas concurridos de la  zona por donde vive; le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que puede lograr un ingreso extra al sueldo de su pareja y juntos  le pueden ofrecer  mayor bienestar a su pequeño hijo, usualmente trabaja todos los días de 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde , ofrece variedad de ropa que trae desde el centro de la ciudad para venderla a un poco mas de su precio, trata de que sea muy peculiar con  bonitos diseños y colores, factores que han determinado que su negocio  sea muy visitado sobretodo por jóvenes  que buscan adquirir estas prendas con el consejo de Alejandrina, que tiene un gran poder de convencimiento . En el futuro quiere aperturar un bazar para abarcar mayor  cantidad de clientela.Es su primer préstamo con MFP y según sus propias palabras su responsabilidad en su trabajo abogan por el pago puntual de  cada una de sus cuotas.Con el dinero del crédito quiere comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería para lograr vender mas sobretodo por la campaña navideña y el año nuevo, ya que las personas buscarán comprar ropa nueva, y sabe que será una buena oportunidad para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 32 years old and lives with her partner and their little son, for whom she works and makes an effort every day. For a year, she has been selling clothing at a stall in one of the busiest markets in the area where she lives. She likes her job very much because she can get an income in addition to her partner's salary, and together they can offer their son a better well-being. She usually works every day from 8 in the morning to 6 in the evening. She offers a variety of clothing that she brings from the center of town in order to sell at a bit of a profit. She tries to get unique clothing with pretty designs and color. For this reason her store is visited principally by young people who want to buy these clothes based on Alejandrina's suggestions, because she is very convincing. In the future she wants to open a store with various products in order to attract more customers. This is her first loan with MFP and as she says, her responsibility in her work shows that she will be on time with each of her repayments. With the money from the loan she wants to buy more merchandise in order to sell more. This is particularly because of the Christmas and New Years celebrations, because people are looking to buy new clothes and she knows it will be a good opportunity to get better returns.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise to improve her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional traditional cloth.

loans.name: Leandro

texts.es:
Leandro tiene 36 años de edad, es conviviente hace 4 años, tiene un hijo de 2 años de 
edad. El vive en casa de sus suegros con su familia, El adquirió la mototaxi con las 
utilidades ya que el se dedicaba a la minería informal, en la parte de la sierra. El 
viene brindando este servicio ya hace un año y medio. Ellos emigraron de su ciudad natal,
para poder brindarle mejores condiciones de vida para su hijo. Leandro  y su cónyuge 
sueñan con tener su casa propia ya que por el momento los están ayudando brindandole un espacio en casa de sus suegros, Leandro destina todos los ingresos que obtiene a la manutención de su familia. 
Leandro solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de su mototaxi y así no tener problemas con su vehiculo.
texts.en:
Leandro is 36 years old and has lived with his girlfriend for 4 years with whom he has a 2 year old son. They live in his in-laws' home. He was able to save up to purchase a moto-taxi with money he earned working in mining in the mountainous region of Peru. He has worked as a moto-taxi driver for the past year and a half. They emigrated from the city of their birth to provide a better life for their son. Leandro and his partner dream of owning their own home since now they are living with his in-laws. Leandro uses all of his income to support his family. He is seeking a loan for moto-taxi maintenance in order to avoid problems with his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Lilian Elizabeth Benegas

texts.en:
Lilian, age 43, sells fruits and vegetables from her cart in the local neighborhoods of Villarrica. She is seeking a loan in order to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell and aspires to higher profit levels, as she has already established a client base. Liliana's husband, a bricklayer, helps her with the household expenses. 

Lilian began working at a booth in the market, and later purchased her own cart and began selling her produce around town. This loan will allow for the purchase of sufficient fruits and vegetables to satisfy her clients' demands.

loans.use: To purchase fruit to sell

loans.name: Cherry May

texts.en:
Cherry May E. is from the village of Casinglot, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is thirty-two years old. Cherry May is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Cherry May is starting a specialized retail store in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling food supplement products in the local community. Cherry May is just starting this business.

In 2010, Cherry May joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cherry May is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which Cherry May will use to purchase inventory and working capital for her business. This loan will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia S. is from the village of Sto. Nino, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 40 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children. Delia owns and operates a business providing trisikad (a bicycle with a rider seat attached on the side) services used to transport passengers, a business managed by her husband in the local community. Delia has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Delia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Delia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Ceferina's Group

texts.en:
Ceferina G., from the village of Del C., Cabatuan,Isabela, is the 54-year-old leader of a 14-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Ceferina, who is married and has six adult-aged children, owns and operates a specialized retail store selling fruits and vegetables in the local community. Engaged in her business for over 20 years, she earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Ceferina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP, her fifth, to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Las Sabrositas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Sabrositas” esta representado por la señora Verónica Beatriz y conformado por 10 miembros caracterizados por ser muy trabajadores, unidos y muy solidarios, todos se conocen ya que residen en la misma zona y confían plenamente en sus integrantes. La señora Verónica Beatriz se dedica a la venta D. dulces y comida rápida en el snack del colegio 6 D. Junio, ella también trabaja como portera del mismo colegio y aprovecha para vender sus productos, ella resiD. en el mismo colegio y desea poder ampliar su pequeño negocio con la compra D. sillas y mesas para su snack esta es la razón por la que desea el crédito, su mayor anhelo es poder darles a sus hijos una casa propia para poder crecer y vivir mejor.   El resto del grupo se dedica a la venta D. frutas, venta D. refrescos, flores, bebidas y al transporte público d pasajeros ya sea como propietario D. sus vehículos o solo como chóferes y otro D. los socios se dedica al alquiler D. mesas D. futbolín. Todos los integrantes del grupo tienen mucha experiencia en su rubro por lo que la competencia no es un factor que les impida generar ingresos. El crédito será destinado a la compra D. mercadería, reparación D. sus vehículos, pagos D. deudas y para la compra y refacción D. algunas mesas D. futbolines. El grupo va cursando su primer ciclo pero el grupo ya tiene experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo que saben como administrar sus fondos y ser un grupo responsable con sus compromisos.
texts.en:
The “Las Sabrositas” group is represented by Verónica Beatriz and maD. up of 10 members who can be described as very hardworking, tight-knit and close; they all know one another since they live in the same area and have complete trust in each other. Verónica Beatriz sells sweets and fast food in the snack bar of the 6 D. Junio school. She also works as a schoolkeeper and uses it as an opportunity to sell her products. She lives at the school and wants to expand her small business with the purchase of chairs and tables for her snack bar. This is why she would like the loan. Her greatest wish is to be able to give her children a house of their own in order to grow and live better. The rest of the group works at selling fruit, soft drinks, flowers, drinks and providing public transportation of passengers as an owner of one's own vehicles or as chauffeurs and another of the members works at renting table football tables. All the group members have a lot of experience in their work so competence is not a factor that prevents them from generating income. The loan will be put toward the purchase of merchandise, vehicle repair, payment of debts and for the purchase and refurbishment of table football tables. The group is in their first cycle but already has experience with solidarity groups, which is why they know how to administer their funds and be a responsible group with their commitments.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for operations

loans.name: Etienne

texts.en:
Etienne is 31 years old and is single. He is still living with his parents.

Etienne owns a small grocery business. This business is profitable in his region which is the reason why it was chosen by Etienne as his principal activity. Etienne is seasoned in his business simply because he has two years of experience. The hours of his business are from six in the morning to nine in the evening every day, even during the weekend.

Etienne is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of growing his business. With this loan he needs to buy a fridge which will be used in his grocery. With the extra profits, Etienne hopes to buy his own house so that he can get married in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a fridge for his grocery store

loans.name: Ty
