texts.en: Ty T. N. was born in 1956. She lives with her husband and three children in Dong Anh town. She has a store at home. She sells beer, fruit and other items. Her husband is a bricklayer. They have a monthly income of about $280. Mrs Ly has a participated in SEDA since 2006 and repays punctually. She has to raise her children, so she always tries to work hard. She likes repaying loans weekly because she can save money. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,066,000 VND to invest in her store.

loans.use: to invest in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Releasing merchandise at the port

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is divorced with two grown children. She is retired but still runs a small business selling women's clothing like dresses, knitted wear and suits in the central marketplace of Novomoskovsk. Ludmila studied commerce in college which helps her in her practical day-to-day dealings with customers and suppliers. She has been in the market for two years. Presently, Ludmila has 30,000 Grivnyas in inventory. 

Ludmila is seeking a loan of 7,500 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise and develop her business. She is hoping to re-stock her inventory for the summer season. Ludmila broke her leg two months ago but didn't withdraw from her usual business routine. She has a very persistent and strong personality.She has a good reputation in the market.

loans.use: to grow her business

loans.name: Tab's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tab P. is 47 years old and is the village bank president, having been selected by its fourteen members who are located in Sdok Prei village, Takeo province. With their loans, the members of this village will use the money to support their different purposes.

Mrs. Tab P. and her husband, Mr. Hen Nei, are sugar palm sellers who are able to earn a small income to support their family. This couple has seven children: three are construction workers while the other four are students in the local school and also support their parents’ business.

In order to support their business, Mrs. Tab P. decided to ask for a loan to buy more sugar palm to sell.

loans.use: To buy more sugar palm to sell

loans.name: Bokk Kogne Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BOKK KOGNE est créé depuis l’inauguration du Banc Villageois qui l’abrite : NEMA2. Il est composé de 06 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même quartier. Elles se sont organisées par voisinage et par affinité. C’est des femmes très motivées et qui développent un bon esprit de solidarité entre elles.

Madame Caroline K. à droite de la photo est la responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 53 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. 
Elle fait un petit commerce de fruits de saison. Elle mène cette activité depuis plus d’une décennie. Elle achète des oranges et des mangues dans les villages environnants pour les revendre à Ziguinchor et à Dakar.

Son objectif est d’augmenter ses revenus financiers, de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels et de participer au bien-être familial.
texts.en:
The solidarity group BOKK KOGNE was created after the inauguration of the NEMA 2 Banc Villageois where it is based. It is composed of 6 women who all come from the same neighborhood. They are organized by neighborhood and kinship. These women are very motivated and have developed a strong spirit of solidarity amongst themselves. Mrs. Caroline K. at the right in the photo is the leader of the group. She is 53 years old, married and the mother of four children. She operates a small business in seasonal fruits and has run this business for more than a decade. She buys oranges and mangos in the surrounding villages to sell in Ziguinchor and Dakar. Her goal is to increase her income, to provide for her personal needs and to contribute to the well-being of her family.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy oranges and mangos

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en:
Shadi is a 37-year-old married man living in Lebanon with his wife and four children. Shadi has worked in a few occupations -- trading charcoal and wood, decorating glass with sand, and as a farmer -- for 13 years. Shadi believes that, in Lebanon, you have to work at multiple things in order to insure a good living for your family. 

This is Shadi’s fifth loan cycle with Al Majmoua and he proved to be a trusted person. This time Shadi is requesting a loan in order to buy a pickup for his business so he can do his work in an easier and faster way. 

Shadi hopes to widen his work in all sectors and benefit his family members through working with him.

loans.use: To buy a pickup for his business

loans.name: Khuy

texts.en: Mrs. Khuy E. is a local rice farmer, 29 years of age. Her life partner is Mr. Poch Proeung, 33 years-old, who earns a living as a motor-taxi driver. This couple is blessed with three children who are enrolled in secondary school. As the farming season approaches, Khuy E. needs a loan to be used for planting rice crops.

loans.use: To be used for planting rice crops.

loans.name: La Union Group

texts.es:
El comité La Union nace hace un año despues de que la mayoria de la gente que estuviera en un comité se retiro y decidieron entre ellas volver a formar un nuevo comité, ya con la esperanza de crecer y no volver a cometer los mismos errores que en el pasado.
Actualmente el grupo esta conformado por señoras que viven en Barcequillo de San Lorenzo - asi tuvieron la posibilidad de seguir trabajando con la institucion y fueron mejorando dia a dia.
La Sra. Cinthia posee un puesto de venta de frutas y verduras, el mismo posee buena demanda teniendo en cuenta la calidad de sus productos además de la buena atención.
La señora desea aumentar sus ingresos, abaratando el costo de sus mercaderías, mediante la adquisición en mayores cantidades, de modo a obtener mayores ingresos. 
Así también desea adquirir más variedad de frutas como son las de estación.
texts.en:
One year after their initial committee was progressively abandoned by its members, a few of these women decided to join forces and create another committee, hoping to grow and to avoid the same mistakes they had made in the past; this is how the group named Comité La Union (The Union Committee) was born. The women who currently compose the group are residents of the Barcequillo neighborhood in the town of San Lorenzo: they have had the chance to keep on working with the same institution, and their work has progressed on a daily basis. Cinthia owns a fruits & vegetables stall that attracts many customers, thanks to the quality of her products as well as to the caring way she tends to her customers. She wishes to improve her income, and she plans to do so by lowering the price of her products through the wholesale purchase of bigger quantities of products. She would also like to buy a wider variety of seasonal fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of a wider varity of seasonal fruit.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene A. is a married woman who lives in Abuno, Brgy. Pajac, Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a sari-sari (general) store, multicab (a small passenger van) transport and t-shirt printing. Her husband Jaime A., who is 53 years old, works as a multicab driver to earn his living. Their children are between 11 and 19 years old. Arlene joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Arlene has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loans have helped her build her working capital so that she could stock up her general store with a wide variety of merchandise, which now enables her to earn an average monthly income of 70,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to buy rice and chicken feeds to sell in her general store so that she can continue to sustainably expand her general store and achieve her dream of opening another sari-sari store in a new location, while continuing to improve the living conditions of her family and to save up for the education of her children. Arlene A. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Mastura's Group

texts.en:
Mastura Z. is the leader of the group. She is 61 years old and married. Her spouse is working as a watchman in an industrial complex. The couple has four children: the elder son raises money by working as a builder, the daughter works as a nurse in a polyclinic, the youngest son currently works in Russia. Besides this, the family is engaged in cattle breeding. At this point, 2 cows and 7 livestock animals are being fattened. Out of profits, Mastura has managed to arrange her children’s weddings. Her loan purpose is to purchase 6 sheep for fattening and resale. In the future the family is aiming to create a mini-farm. In addition, Mastura wants to sell products.

Zinat P., 58, is married. She is the treasurer of the group. Her family has four children. Her daughters are married and live separately from parents. Her sons work in Russia. Zinat, together with her spouse, a farmer, runs their business of cattle breeding. Out of the earnings, the family has managed to organize the children’s weddings. In order to obtain a cow for fattening and breeding, the family is planning to get a loan. In the future they want to create their own mini-farm.

Gulshayir K., 30, is married. Together with her husband, who supports the family by working as a private builder, she has a daughter. 4 years ago, when Gulshayir lived with her parents, she used to run her business of reselling dairy products. With the business, she earned money to obtain furniture. The loan purpose is to purchase dairy products (100 kg) for further resale. In the future, the family intends to open a shop for foodstuff selling.   

Nargiza D., 24, is divorced. She makes her icome by cattle breeding. Now, with the help of her parents, she fattens up 2 bulls. Her loan purpose is to purchase 3 sheep in order to expand the business. In the future Nargiza wishes to create a mini-farm and to marry successfully.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase six sheep.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 38 years old; he sells glasses to earn a living.  With his income, he is able to raise his three children who go to school.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, his business has grown, hence his living standards have improved. He has been running the business for two years with one employee. In five years, he hopes to employ more people in his business.  With the loan of 20,000 Kes, he will buy more glasses.

loans.use: To buy more glasses

loans.name: Redamta

texts.en: Redamta is 43 years old. She is a widow and has four children between the ages of eight and twenty. All her children go to school. Her husband has no job. Redamta sells goats and has had this business for three years. She is requesting this loan to buy more goats to sell.  She will save the money generated from this business as profit. Her business is very helpful because it has enabled her to meet her family needs. In the future, she would like to increase the number of goats she sells.

loans.use: To buy more goats to sell.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa, 41, has a rice farming business. She has been doing this farming business for 15 years already. She has a rice field in Agusan del sur, and loves her work in the farm. She is a mother of 6 children, and strives hard in order to provide the basic needs of the family.

She requested a loan of 4,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to financially support her farm. With this amount, she will be able to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Anipa

texts.en:
Anipa B. is 57 years old and widowed.  She was born in a large family of farmers and from early childhood was engaged in looking after cattle. She finished school and because of the limited income of her family she couldn’t continue her studies.  Nuruypa got married and worked with her husband as a stock keeper in the local area.  Unfortunately, in 1992 her husband died because of cancer and she became the only bread-winner for her family.

In order to find additional means of income, she decided to begin her business of cattle breeding.  Due to her vast experience in this activity, Anipa managed to maintain the farm and was able to reconstruct one of the rooms in her house into a small shop with groceries.

Now Anipa is applying for a loan of 80,000 Kyrgyz Soms to buy two cows and sheep.  With the revenues, she plans to broaden her business by opening a bigger grocery store.  Anipa is an optimistic woman and believes that her tireless efforts will lead her family to a more prosperous life. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population.  Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan.  As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the needs of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn C. is from the village of Malinao, Gingoog City. She is 23 years old. Jovelyn is married and has two small children. To make a living, Jovelyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned good, and snack foods. Jovelyn has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jovelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like snack foods. This loan will be the first loan Jovelyn has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like snack foods.

loans.name: Alexandra Esther

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 1 De Agosto que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

La señora Alexandra es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución y por las facilidades para los créditos. Tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 10, 6 y 3 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo es guardia de seguridad. Nuestra socia hace algún tiempo estudio belleza en una Academia en Montecristi.

Es así como saco provecho de lo aprendido. Tiene un salón de belleza en el cual  realiza tinturados, cortes de cabellos, pintado de uñas y otros trabajos. Trabaja desde las 8am hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde si sus clientes requieren de sus servicios.  También vende productos de Esika, Lebel, Yanbal y Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas).  el cual lo hace al mismo  tiempo cuando realiza sus otros trabajos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar tintes, shampoo, permanentes y productos de Avon, Yanbal entre otras. Sus sueños son llegar a tener un SPA.
texts.en: The 1 De Agosto ["August 1st"] Community Bank meets every fifteen days in the Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and crafts, which are known on a national and international level. This location is home of the famous straw hats. Mrs. Alexandra is a founding member of this Community Bank, and she likes it because of the additional benefits that the institution offers and for the ease of getting a loan. She is 33 and married. She and her husband have three children ages 10, 6 and 3. The two oldest are in school. Her husband is a security guard. Alexandra has gone to beauty school at an academy in Montecristi for some time now. This is how she takes advantage of what she is learning: she has a beauty salon where she dyes and cuts hair, paints nails and provides other services. She works from 8 am to 9 pm, and sometimes later if her customers need her. She also sells Esika, Lebel, Yanbal and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories). She does this at the same time as she does her other work. She will use this loan to purchase dyes, shampoo, perm materials and Avon and Yanbal products, among other items. Her dream is to have a spa.

loans.use: to purchase dyes, shampoo, perm materials, and Yanbal and Avon products.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya D. is married and has a grow son, Yevgenyi. Natalya owns two big spacious greenhouses and grows vegetables for sale at the market. She has been in farming for nine years. Currently, Natalya has 40,000 UAH invested in this project. She spends about 15,000 UAH on seeds and clear polyethylene film every year. 

This year she is building a new green house, which will increase the amount of produce offered for sale. Natalya is willing to work very hard to see her plans fulfilled. Natalya is seeking a 12,000 UAH loan to purchase supplies for her greenhouses.

One of her personal goals is to generate enough income to build a small shop that will enable their son to start working and generate income. 

Note: In the photo, Natalya is with her husband, a retired policeman.

loans.use: To purchase greenhouse supplies

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea K., 32, owns a small handcart that she uses to sell snack food around her community in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She typically makes around $2 US profit each day to ensure that her family has a comfortable life. In addition, she and her husband always buy used goods to resell, and they can generate $7 US a day from this business. The couple has been married for years and has two teenage children, one of whom works in a coffee shop. Mrs. K. would like to use her loan to buy more stock of used goods for selling.

loans.use: to buy more stock of used goods

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz O. is from the village of Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 26 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Luz owns a sari-sari (variety) shop selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, biscuits  and breads. Ma. Luz has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Ma. Luz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Ma. Luz from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods and biscuits to sell

location.town: Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda P. is from the village of Malibago,Oro. She is 66 years old, married and has 4 adult aged children. Rosalinda operates a family member's business in the retail sector, running a general store in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rosalinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products for her sari- sari store. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Rosalinda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria, 48 years old, lives in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato with her family. She is married to a farmer and they have six children, the oldest 28 years old. Gloria, also a farmer, grows rice and corn, some for family consumption, with the rest sold to the market. She has requested a loan to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and pig feed and hopes for her business to prosper.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and pig feed

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa forma parte del banco comunal “Unidas siempre unidas” perteneciente a la ciudad de Concepción. Ella se dedica al corte y confección de ropa de casa, vale decir; cortinas, sábanas, cortinas y accesorios para baño.
Rosa se dedica a éste oficio desde hace 4 años aproximadamente. Ella trabaja desde su casa, confeccionando productos a pedido. Las temporadas de más alta demanda son para el día de la madre, navidad y fiesta costumbrista de la independencia de Chile. Cuando le quedan productos su hija es quien los vende en su lugar de estudio, al igual que Rosa, quien además trabaja como asesora del hogar en casas particulares y también ofrece sus productos de confección. Su horario laboral como asesora es de lunes a viernes por las mañanas y en las tardes se dedica a la confección de ropa de lunes a domingo. Por tanto sus clientes y ganancias han aumentado considerablemente. 
Su mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Concepción, en distribuidoras de telas las cuales los costos son menores, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente. 
Con éste préstamo pretende comprar insumos para su negocio específicamente; telas, blondas, hilos y cierres.
Rosa vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 20 y 11 años. Ella es el único ingreso económico de su familia. Las motivaciones de Rosa de seguir en el negocio es costear los estudios superiores de su hija de 20 años, quien estudia odontología. 
El sueño de Rosa es instalar un taller en su casa, de manera de poder ampliar el espacio en el cual trabaja en la actualidad.
Rosa está muy agradecida y contenta del crédito otorgado por Fondo esperanza, ya que podrá  invertir y aumentar su productividad. Además disfruta mucho de las reuniones que se realizan junto a las demás socias, ya que comparten nuevas experiencias de vida y esfuerzo.
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Bíobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the "Unidas Siempre Unidas" (United Always United) community bank which is located in the city of Concepción.  Her business is making soft furnishings such as drapes, sheets and bathroom accessories.

Rosa has been in this business for approximately 4 years.  She works from home, making products to order.  Her busiest seasons are Mother's Day, Christmas and the festive period around Chilean independence day.  When she has products left over, her daughter takes them to sell at college.  Rosa also works as a maid in private houses and takes advantage of this to sell her products.  Rosa works as a maid on weekday mornings and she makes her furnishings from Monday to Sunday in the afternoons.  Her customers and profits have increased considerably.

Rosa buys her supplies in the city of Concepción.  She buys from fabric wholesalers whose products are cheaper and therefore more financially convenient.

Rosa will use this loan to buy supplies for her business, specifically fabric, lace, threads and fasteners.

Rosa lives with her husband and her two children aged 20 and 11.  Hers is the only income the family has.  Rosa's motivation to continue working in her business is to pay for her 20 year-old daughter's higher education.  She is studying dentistry.

Rosa's dream is to set up a workshop in her home so that she can expand the space in which she currently works.

Rosa is very grateful for, and happy with, the loan she has been granted by Fondo Esperanza since she will be able to invest and increase her productivity.  She also enjoys the meetings with her fellow community bank members since they share new experiences.

Concepción is located at the mouth of the River Bíobío, one of the biggest rivers in the country.  It is in the south of Chile, in Bíobío region.  This city has played an important part in our history as it was the scene of some important battles and notable settlement, especially during the Arauco War as it formed the border with Mapuche territory.  The city currently has high economic and demographic growth.  It is becoming considered one of the most important urban, demographic, administrative, financial and commercial centers in Chile after Santiago and Valparaíso.

loans.use: to buy fabric, lace, threads and fasteners

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 42 years old and married to a teacher. She has six children and all of them go to school. 

Grace currently has a business selling ice cream. She is requesting a loan to stock more ice cream to sell. She hopes to build a concrete house in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: stock more ice cream to sell.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is divorced with a grown son. She lives and runs her venture in Novaya Kahovka, selling women's clothing items in one of the local malls. She has been in this trade for 20 years. Presently, her turnover capital is 40,000 grivnas (UAH) and her income is about 13,000 UAH per month. 

Tatyana is requesting a 20,000 UAH loan to purchase seasonal merchandise to sell in her shop. Financial assistance will help Tatyana to increase her income and thus provide for her family needs and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Hay un lugar conocido como la comunidad de Arin este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En esta comunidad de Arin conocimos a la señora Matilde de 40 años de edad, tiene su pareja y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos, vive con su pareja en su casa propia que cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la provincia de Calca, que pertenece al departamento del Cusco. Esta zona tiene como actividad principal la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Matilde se dedica a la venta de verduras y también a crianza de animales menores y ella vende en diferentes mercados de los diferentes ciudades como Calca, Urubamba y Cusco. Desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron esta labor y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja junto a su pareja, que con mucho esmero siembran vegetales y hortalizas como por ejemplo culantro, perejil, orégano y otras vegetales. Matilde también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas, cerdos y patos.    

El crédito que ha solicitado Matilde es de 300 nuevos soles a Asociación Arariwa, será destinado para comprar más semillas. Matilde es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa que siempre ha sabido salir adelante para mejorar en la vida y poder tener lo que quiere.
texts.en:
In the city of Calca in the department of Cusco, there is a place known as the community of Arin which is known for its beautiful landscapes, its cuisine, and the warmth of its people.

In the community of Arin, we meet Matilde, who is 40 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives with her paretner in their own house that has water and light services.  It is located in the province of Calca in the department of Cusco.  This area's main activities are farming, livestock, and tourism.  

Matilde works selling vegetables and also raises small animals.  She sells in different markets in various cities like Calca, Urubamba, and Cusco.  Since she was very young, her parents taught her this work, and now she has her own land where she works with her partner.  With great care, they plant vegetables and greens, for example cilantro, parsley, oregano, and other vegetables.  Matilde also raises small animals, for example guinea pigs, chickens, pigs, and ducks.

Matilde has asked for a loan of 300 nuevos soles from Asociación Arariwa to purchase more seeds.  Matilde is an earnest and hard-working woman who has always known how to succeed to improve her life and have what she wants.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 27 años vive con su hija en casa de sus padres y disfrutando de la compañía de ellos. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a la agricultura y junto a sus padres siembra en las diferentes extensiones de tierra que poseen, parte que le corresponde es la mitad de la extensión. De esa manera tanto para él como para sus padres asumen los gastos. Del mismo modo, vende animales los fines de semana en la feria ganadera de su localidad y los demás días se dedica a la confección de buzos. Su madre la ayuda en las técnicas del bordado, pues es la principal diseñadora, además es quien vende el tejido artesanal el fin de semana, logrando percibir una cantidad considerable. Por ahora lo que más desea es extender la siembre y desarrollar las otras actividades, por ello pide de su apoyo para que se concrete sus planes. Este será su crédito número 6 con MFP, ella manifiesta su compromiso de continuar pagando sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos para su maquina de coser y sacos de abono para su siguiente siembra.
texts.en:
Maria, 27, lives with her daughter in her parent’s home, enjoying their company.  For more than 6 years she has worked in agriculture together with her parents, farming the different fields that they own.  She was given half of the area to work and this is the way expenses are covered.  She also sells farm animals on the weekends in the cattle market in her town and the rest of the week she knits sweaters.  Her mother helps her with the embroidery but she is the main designer.  She is the one who sells knitted crafts on the weekends and is able to earn quite a lot. 

 Now she wants to plant more and to increase the other work, and that is why she is asking you for support to help her with her plans.  This will be loan number 6 with MFP and she demonstrates her willingness to make all the payments.  She will use the loans to buy replacement parts for her sewing machine and fertilizer for her next crop.

loans.use: To fix her embroidery machine and to buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Kouko

texts.fr: Revendeur  de produits  génériques (efferalgan, seringue, nifluril gel…), Mr Kouko a crée une petite entreprise « SANTE POUR TOUS » en  2008. Sa femme est également revendeuse et ils ont 01 enfant. Il vend à domicile après achat dans un laboratoire de médicaments. Ce crédit  lui servira à renforcer  son activité.
texts.en: A retailer of generic pharmaceutical products (Efferalgan, syringes, Nifluril Gel...), Mr. Kouko established a small enterprise named “SANTE POUR TOUS” in 2008. His wife is also a retailer, and they have one child. After making purchases from a medicines laboratory, Kouko sells out of his house. This loan will serve to bolster his business.

loans.use: to buy generic pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Mayosi Group

texts.en:
Memunatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Memunatu was born in Newtown, an outskirt of Freetown. She is 45 years of age. Memunatu is married to a carpenter and the couple has 3 children – 1 in primary school, 1 in secondary school and 1 adult. Memunatu sells charcoal and fire wood. She has been a businesswoman for 10 years now. 

With the help of this loan, Memunatu and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Memunatu will use her share of the loan (500,000 SLL) to buy a large quantity of charcoal and fire wood to sell.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of charcoal and fire wood to sell

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
Apolonia has a shop that sells dried fish and rice by the kilogram. She is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. Apolonia has had her business for three years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy additional dried fish and rice to sell.

Apolonia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Apolonia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish and rice to sell.

loans.name: Sehati Group

texts.en:
Eti is 54 years old and has two children. This is her second loan with VisionFund Indonesia. She is requesting a 1,000,000 IDR loan to pay for a freezer to hold the soft drinks she plans to sell. Before, she sold only food, but now she want to expand her business by offering soft drinks.

Eti hopes she can find a strategic place to run her business. She also hopes a better future for her children, so she has committed herself to sending her children to school.

loans.use: to pay for a freezer.

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en:
At the age of 46, Bonifacio has managed his hog-fattening business for one year. He is married with one child. His wife is a housekeeper who takes care of their child. Bonifacio's priority in life is to give his family a better life and lift them out of poverty.
Bonifacio is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy feed and piglets to raise. He is dedicated to his work. He works hard and manages his business well to ensure that he will someday reach his goal. 
Bonifacio also operates a tricycle for transportation services. His earnings from this business helps enable his child to go to school. The profits from his businesses pay for his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets to raise

loans.name: Gambo

texts.en:
Gambo is a married man with five children; four attend school while one is still too young for school. He lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over ten years, he has operated a garage business, servicing motor vehicles. He faces a major challenge of power shortages and machine failures. Gambo dreams of purchasing another machine and employing more people in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase welding rods, iron sheets and tubes. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase welding rods, iron sheets and tubes.

loans.name: Jenny Pilar

texts.es:
Jenny es madre de familia de 38 años de edad, vive con sus hijos en casa de unos familiares, cuenta  con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada  en el distrito de José leonardo Ortiz que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Zona que se caracteriza por la alta actividad comercial que existe y de transporte público.

Jenny brinda servicios de carpintería desde hace 3 años, su negocio lo ha instalado en su mismo domicilio, fabrica y vende todo tipo de muebles para el hogar, cuenta con su propia clientela y también realiza trabajos a pedido,es conocido por elbuen servicio que brinda y la calidad de sus trabajos, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá solventar sus obligaciones familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de madera y seguir cumpliendo con los pedidos pendientes, al realizar un buen trabajo se incrementarían sus clientes, lo que le permitirá tener mejoras económicas para pagar su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Jenny es una mujer dedicada y trabajadora con la finalidad de que su familia siga adelante y lo gre sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Jenny is a 38 year old mom, lives with her children in at a house owned by family members, the house counts with water and power services and is located in the district of Jose Leonardo Ortiz in the province of Chiclayo, area characterized by high commercial activities and public transportation.

Jenny provides carpentry services, she has done this for three years, her business is located at home, she builds and sells all types of home furniture, she has a client base and also gets projects upon request, she is known for the good service provided and the quality of her work, with the income she is able to cover the family's financial obligations.

She has requested a loan to Edpyme Alternativa of 1,000 new soles to buy more wood to complete pending orders, by doing a good job the orders from clients would increase, which would allow more profit to pay for her loan and improve her quality of life, Jenny is a dedicated and hardworking woman with the dream to get her family ahead and achieve their goals.

loans.use: To buy more wood to build furniture.

loans.name: Zuurakan's Group

texts.en:
Zuurakan is the leader of this group. She is 56 and unfortunately she is a widow. She has raised two sons and three daughters, and all the children are; either employed or engaged in farming. At the moment Zuurakan is engaged in livestock breeding; she resells livestock after fattening. In this way she earns about 700 soms per month. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase three sheep for breeding, fattening and further reselling. In the future Zuurakan wants to expand her business and improve her living conditions. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Abdualim

texts.ru: Абдуалим проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст, 36 лет. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. У него средне – специальное образование, продавец. Он занимается торговлей продуктов питания. Этим видом деятельности занимается три года. Кредит берет для закупа парфюмерии и продуктов.
texts.en: Abdualim lives in the city of Dushanbe.  He is 36 years old, married and has two children.  He has a secondary-specialized education, as a salesperson.  He is involved in sales of food products.  Abdualim has been in this business for three years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of perfumery and food products.

loans.use: to buy perfumery and food products

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is 39 years old and married to Kiptoo with five children between 14 and 5 years old. She sells second hand and new clothes and she has been in this business for three years with a monthly income of KSHS 5,000. Her husband is a farmer who also helps in generating more income for the family.

She is borrowing a loan of KSHS 24,000, which she plans to use to add more stock of clothes (both second hand and new) to her business for resale. She plans to expand her business with the anticipated profit from the business. This is her third loan. She successfully repaid her previous loans. 

She hopes to continue with her business and be able to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more second hand and new clothes to sell

loans.name: Fuente Para El Desarrollo 1 Group

texts.en:
AngeL. is a single mother who lives in the beautiful town of Samana with her three children. This area is a nascent tourist zone, surrounded by the Atlantic ocean and mountains, a river and natural breezes. AngeL. says her most important challenge is to proviD. for all the needs of her family, such as clothing, education, food, etc. She enjoys working and hopes to change her life with a prosperous and stable business. 

AngeL. wants to expand her business with this loan, which is her second one. She operates a clothing sales business, and also she works at sewing clothes, and she wants to uses this loan to buy a sewing machine, some fabrics, sewing accessories, and clothing for men and women. 

In the future, with her savings and profits, she is planning to have a business and to build a bathroom in her house.

Thanks for supporting this group of entrepreneurs!

loans.use: to buy clothes and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 30-year-old single man living with his parents and three siblings. He has been working as a freelance painter for the past 15 years, sticking with multiple construction projects and private businesses. In parallel, he has worked in a locA. factory since 2009. It’s very common in Lebanon to have multiple jobs as it is often not enough to have an office salary or small shop to cover the increasing life costs. Today, he’s requesting to borrow 1,000 USD from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase painting tools and supplies. He notes that this will increase his business productivity by 10%.

loans.use: to purchase painting tools and supplies

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es: Marleny, de 32 años es una mujer alegre. Vive en compañía de Pedro, su esposo desde hace 13 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos: Gina, Mayumi y Jeri a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Hualahoyo. Su mayor anhelo es ver a sus hijos realizados. Por ello gracias al apoyo de su esposo, quien trabaja en una mina. Pudo abrir una pequeña tienda de comestibles, donde no solo vende productos de primera necesidad. También diversos accesorios de cocina y hasta acondicionó una pequeña ferretería, donde vende clavos y demás productos. “En mi tienda encuentran de todo”, afirma. Ya que su mayor deseo es tener un supermercado, donde todo este distribuido y acondicionado. Además de su negocio, ella se dedica a crianza de cuyes, ya tiene 70 ejemplares, los cuales engorda para luego venderlos a buen precio. Sus planes por el momento, es aumentar el número de ejemplares, ya que en estas fiestas navideñas tendrá mucha demanda. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Hualahoyo al progreso” y este es el décimo séptimo crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores crédito. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Marleny, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de panteones, chocolates y todo lo necesario para la temporada de navidad.
texts.en: Marleny is 32 years old. She is a cheerful woman. She lives with Pedro, her husband of 13 years. They have 3 children: Gia, Mayumi and Jeri. they care for them in their own home located in the community of Hualahoyo. Her greatest wish is for her children to attain their goals. For this, thanks to her husband, who works in a mine, she was able to open a small food store. She doesn't just sell basic necessity products. She also sells different kitchen accessories and she even set up a small hardware store, where she sells nails and other products. “In my store, you can find anything", she affirms. Her biggest wish is to have a supermarket, with everything set out and arranged. In addition to her business, she raises guinea pigs. She already has 70 of them, which she fattens up to later sell at a good price. At this time, her plans are to increase that number, since there will be a lot of demand for the Christmas season. She belongs to the “Hualahoyo al Progreso” supportive group, and this is her seventeenth loan with MFP, where she hopes for your cooperation to cement her plans. She also promises to make her payments on time, as with previous loans. She is happy to be a part of the association because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people. If Marteny receives your support, she will invest the money she has asked for in buying panetons, chocolates and everything necessary for the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy panetons and chocolates.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is married and has 3 children. She is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. Betty has been a farmer for 20 years, growing rice to earn a living. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase fertilizer for her rice plantation. Betty has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her rice plantation

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana tiene 56 años de edad, vive en la comunidad de los Nuevos Colorados, ahi vive con su hija quien le ayuda en su negocio, que es la produccion y venta de tortillas,  actividad que realiza desde hace 8 años, Juana es una mujer que trabaja muy fuerte para hacer crecer su negocio y tener buenas ganancias, todo esto para obtener una mejor calidad de vida.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de las tortillas.
texts.en: Sra. Juana, 56, lives with her daughter in the rural town of Nuevos Colorados.  Her daughter helps her with the business making and selling tortilas.  She has made her living from the business for 8 years.  Juana is working hard to expand her business and increase her earnings.  She is fighting for a better quality of life and this loan will allow her to buy the supplies she needs to make the tortillas she sells.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food business.

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Phat is 25 years old and single. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. He earns a living operating a business of making hats at his house, which he has done for the past 7 years. He buys fabric and materials to make embroidery hats.

Phat would like to take a loan to buy better materials for his business. He hopes the loan will help him to provide better products, generate more income to cover his family's living expenses, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy better materials for his business of hat production

loans.name: Maletile

texts.en:
Maletile is 40 years of age, married, and has five children.

Maletile owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has one year of experience in this business. Maletile needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase harvesting equipment, such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve/expand her business.

Maletile joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Because they lack collateral, most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks. This is Maletile's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment, such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.

loans.name: Tham

texts.en: Ms Tham is 31 years old with two small children. She is managing a small restaurant and selling soft drinks.  Her business started 10 years ago.  In 2010, she took part in Seda’s credit program. She used her loans for her restaurant.  For this new loan, she wants 8,736,000 Vietnam dong to buy  some kitchen equipment and drinks.

loans.use: to buy kitchen equipment and drinks.

loans.name: Emerilou

texts.en:
Emerilou is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Emerilou has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, beverages & rice per kilograms. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, sacks of rice & beverages.

Emerilou has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Emerilou hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, sacks of rice & beverages

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es: José tenía una sociedad junto a su padre en la venta de arroz y cerdos pero viendo que poco a poco iba mejorando se independizo. Su trabajo es tener que visitar a las tiendas del sector y vende a crédito. Unas de sus dificultades son el mal clima y la delincuencia. José está casado tiene hijos pero todos se independizaron  su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos. Con el préstamo va comprar arroz y cerdos.  Unas de sus aspiraciones desean mejorar su vivienda y una mejor vida para su hogar.
texts.en: José had a partnership with his father in the rice and pigs selling business, but seeing that his situation gradually improved, he became independent. His work is to visit the stores of the sector. He sells on credit. Some of the hardships he faces are bad weather and crime. José is married with children, but all his children are already independent, and his wife does household chores. With this loan he'll purchase rice and pigs. Some of his aspirations are to improve his home and his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase rice and pigs.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa est une femme âgée de 30 ans qui vit à Baguida. Mariée et mère de deux enfants, Akossiwa est une marchande de l’eau en sachets généralement appelé «  pure water » qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Akossiwa désire ce crédit pour financer son achat de sachets d’eau «  pure water » en gros en vue de bien revendre et de tirer profit afin de gagner plus de revenus et pouvoir mieux contribuer aux charges de la famille.

loans.use: Acheter 68 sachets de pure water voltic et 50 sachets de pure water mobile.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
A. Doreen is an active member and worker at Life in Africa. She is currently employed in the Invisible Children Bracelet project. She enjoys her work and the companionship she finds with the other workers and is happy that she is making a good living.

She came to Kampala in 2003 when she had to flee her home in Northern Uganda because of the war. She was quite bored just sitting in the camps and so she tried working in the stone quarry to earn money. She found this work to be extremely hard physically. She still works the quarry but now hires others to do the actual labor.

She is a good business woman and knows that she can make a success of a business that offers a needed service in her community. She plans to open a salon/barber shop. The profits from this business will allow her to save so that someday she can build a permanent home and possibly another house to rent out. To do this she is seeking a loan in the amount of 500,000. She will be able to repay this loan in 12 months.

Below are the budget in full:-

  1. machine 2@ 80,000 /= 160,000=

  2. Chairs 2 @ 20,000= 40,000=

  3. Mirror 2 big pcs @ 15,000/= 30,000=

  4. Rent 3 months @ 30,000= --- 90,000=

  5. transport ----------- 30,000/=

  6. Labour 2 @ 40,000/= ---- 80,000=

  7. Aprons 4 pcs @ 5,000= ---------- 20,000=

  8. Cosmetics ---------------------- 60,000=

    TOTAL 500,000=

WE Team to benefit: Talent discovery

loans.use: Buying materials for setting loan use

loans.name: Bibi Jan

texts.en:
Bibi Jan 42 years old with her 5 children's living in district 7 Kabul Afghanistan.

Bibi Jan is uneducated women by the helps of there neighborhood she took 1st then 2nd cycle loan through AFSG,She believes that taking more loan they can able to grow up there business and find's a good income for her home.


Bibi Jan is buying string, cotton and fabric ..etc

loans.use: To buy fabric, Cotton, string

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Nkurankan, Ghana is a large marking centre for the people of the Yilo Krobo District of Ghana. Madam A. is a resident of Nkurankan and manufactures beads. She is also a client of Kraban Support Foundation and is however seeking a Kiva loan of $900.00 to help her improve her business.

loans.use: Bead Manufacturer

loans.name: Asif

texts.en: Asif is married and has 2 children. He is 40, lives in Salyan region, Yenikand village. Asif has raised cattle for 6 years. He has calves and cows. Now he needs a loan of $475 to buy grass.

loans.use: To buy grass

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret, 40 years of age, is a widow with two pairs of twins, aged 11 and 13. She lost her husband, who was a veterinary doctor, in 2000. He left behind a four-room house and un-roofed structure that was meant for poultry rearing.

They have two cows which are on zero grazing and at the moment. Margaret and the children cut grass for the cows every day and look after 100 chickens. She is requesting $ 900 to boost her poultry business to five hundred birds and also roof the structures. When this is achieved she will be able to comfortably pay school fees for the children and meet home necessities.

loans.use: Poultry Rearing

loans.name: Orlanda

texts.es:
Orlanda is a Young mother with three children for whom she strives every day to give the best. They have become the motor that drives her life. That is why three years ago she decided to make crochet weavings. She began this work thanks to the push of her best friend and in little time her diligence had granted her quality and excellent finished works. This has permitted her community to recognize her as a great worker and they have called her to weave hats for exportation. Orlanda covers the orders that they make to her to weave which ever article of clothing. Aside from that she weaves jackets made of wool in her free time in order to offer them for sale inside her community in the hopes of generating additional income that would allow an increase in her family’s wellbeing.

She hopes very much to be able to open her own export company of woven hats and to become partners with other women in her community that do the same thing. Like a good mother she wants to offer her children a comfortable life and a suitable education so that they can forge a prosperous future.

As a first step to achieve this goal she has dedicated herself to increase even more the variety of weavings she makes and needs more capital to invest. She is soliciting $100 USD. With your support we can make it so that Orlanda increases the amount of jobs she has and so that she can realize her children’s dreams at home.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer.

Orlanda es una joven madre de 3 hijos por quienes se esfuerza cada día para darles lo mejor de si, ellos se han convertido en el motor que impulsa su vida, por esa razón hace tres años se dedica a realizar tejidos a crochet; se incorporó a esta labor gracias al impulso de su mejor amiga y en poco tiempo su diligencia le ha otorgado calidad y excelentes acabados a sus trabajos. Esto le ha permitido el reconocimiento de su comunidad como una buena tejedora y la han llamado para tejer chullos de exportación. Orlanda cubre los pedidos que le hacen para tejer cualquier prenda de vestir, a parte de ello se dedica a tejer chompas de lana en sus momentos libres para ofrecerlos dentro de su comunidad con el fin de generar un ingreso adicional que le permita incrementar el bienestar de su familia.

Desea con todas sus fuerzas poder abrir su propia empresa de exportación de gorros tejidos y asociarse con otras señoras de su comunidad que se dediquen también a esta labor con el propósito de conseguir un espacio directo de exportación. Como buena madre quiere ofrecerles una vida cómoda y una adecuada educación a sus hijos a fin de que puedan forjarse un próspero futuro.

Como primer paso para conseguir este propósito ha decidido incrementar aún más la variedad de los tejidos que realiza y necesita un capital de inversión, por tal motivo solicita un préstamo de 100 dólares. Con tu apoyo podremos hacer que Orlanda incremente sus trabajos y fabrique en su hogar los sueños de sus pequeños

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to increase her production.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria G. lives in Anticretico in the Vino Tinto Zone, north hillside of the city of La Paz. She lives with her husband and a daughter. Mrs. G. is dedicated to promote, offer, and sell cosmetic products in offices. Her husband is employed with the postal service of La Paz.

The apartment where they live has shown water leaking problems in the kitchen and bathroom and it's causing damage to the home furnishings. The loan that she is asking for will be used to repair and waterproof the kitchen and bathroom so they can solve the water leaking problem at their home.

This is the first time that they ask for a loan and the socioeconomic analysis made, show that they qualify in good standing to have access to credit.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Maria G. vive en anticrético en la zona de Vino Tinto ladera norte de la ciudad de La Paz con su esposo y su hija; la señora Maria se dedica a promotora ofreciendo productos cosméticos en las oficinas y su esposo es empleado en el servicio de correos de La Paz. El departamento en el que viven presentó problemas de filtraciones de agua en la cocina y baño y están ocasionando el deterioro de sus muebles. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la refacción e impermeabilización de la cocina y el baño para de esta manera solucionar el problema de filtraciones. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Repair and waterproofing two rooms at her dwelling.

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
Florence N. sells clothing. She wants the loan to purchase more inventory and increase sales.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To expand her stock

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura R. is a fifty eight year old divorced mother of three. All of her children are married and have families in Brazil and in Paraguay. While her children were growing up, she made ends meet as a commercial business promoter in Asuncion, the capital of Paraguay.

In 1979 she decided to become an independent business woman and began a small grocery store. After she had made a little money she then added bookstore goods. Her store is located in a perfect location, very near to a school, so she has had great business from the students. Now, Laura has also added some pieces of clothing and footwear that she picked up from a nearby town, Foz de Iguazu.

The loan that Laura is applying for is very important to continue amplifying her sales and diversifying her goods. Her store has already shown great success, and because of its great location and her business practices, it should only continue to grow in popularity.

loans.use: To buy various goods for her general store, such as food, books and clothes.

loans.name: Magamaga Central J Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Kibonde S.. She is currently in the business of running a tree nursery and is requesting a loan to add capital. Kibonde is 39 years old and is divorced. She has 6 children ranging from age 12 to 24 and her children go to school. Each week, Kibonde makes approximately UGX 21000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children and invest more in her business. Kibonde has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to the business and the loan was paid back on time.

Kibonde is joined in her small group by Edith N.. Edith N. has a business in maize selling and wants to boost business.

loans.use: To purchase more seeds and buy nursery equipment like watering cans

loans.name: Rizvan

texts.en: Rizvan Y. is an ambitious 20-year old. He lives in Saatli in the southern part of Azerbaijan. Rizvan grew up around farming and now wants to purchase 4 baby calves of his own. The expected cost of each calf is $250 USD. The remainder of his $1100 loan will be used to purchase fodder.

loans.use: To buy four baby calves and fodder

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia

Ms. Eugenia is 42 years old and she was able to complete her third year of secondary school. She has two dependent children. She live in the El Porvenir district in the province of Trujillo in the town of La Libertad. She began her business eight years ago when she was able to obtain a stand at the “Miguel Grau” market in the El Porvenir district. She sells all types of cooked legumes such as beans, lentils, carrot and beet salad, and other products that can be stewed. Ms. Eugenia is a member of the Banco Comunal “Bendicion de Dios” where she obtained her firt loan of 300.00 soles and with that money was able to buy a few kilos of a variety of legumes, corn, stewed corn, wheat and salads. With the 1100.00 soles loan, which she will repay in four months, She will buy, a sack of garbanzo beans, a sack of panamito (white beans), a sack of serranita lentis, a sack of pallares (white lima beans) and corn. Ms. Eugenia dream with expanding her business and hiring others to sell her products in other markets.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juarez Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Eugenia tiene 42 años de edad, estudio hasta el tercer año de secundaria. Tiene dos hijos en total que aun dependen de ella.Vive en el distrito El Porvenir en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad. Hace ocho años se inicio vendiendo en un pequeño puesto que consiguió en el mercado “Miguel Grau” en el distrito El Porvenir, se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de menestras cocinadas tales como frijoles, lenteja, ensaladas de veterraga y zanahoria y otros productos que se puedan sancochar. La señora Eugenia es socia del Banco Comunal “Bendición de Dios” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro unos cuantos kilos de una variedad de menestras, maíz, mote, trigo y ensaladas. Con el préstamo de S/. 1100.00 el cual pagara en un periodo de cuatro meses comprará: un saco de frijol garbancillo, un saco de panamito, un saco de lenteja serranita, un saco de pallares y maíz mote. La señora Eugenia sueña con ampliar mas su negocio, contratando gente para vender sus productos en otros mercados.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise in order to sell it

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.en: N. Zulfiya is 53 is years old. Zulfiya and her husband, who is a driver, have been married for almost 30 years and have raised three wonderful children. One of them is already married and has children of his own. Zulfiya has been running her own small business for 15 years already. She has a place for selling foodstuff such as macaroni, soft drinks, sweets, potted goods, detergents, soap, toothpaste and other items. She works from the 7:00 a.m. till 5:00 p.m. Her daughter helps her in the store, registering the stock and serving clients. Zulfiya and her daughter are very friendly and polite which allows them to have the clientele. She is requesting a loan of $600 dollars. Zulfiya is planning to spend the loan for purchasing more goods for selling, thus increasing the range of products. Zulfiya promises to repay her loan during 6 months and thanks everybody who decides to support her.

loans.use: Increasing the stock

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng C., age 20, works collecting rubber for resale to the factory. Normally she makes $5 each day. Her husband works as a blacksmith and earns $2.70 a day. They have two young children and an older mother and father live with them.

Mrs. Heng would like to apply for a loan from Kiva to purchase more rubber for resale and any remaining money will be used to complete the construction of their home. (Heng's husband is pictured behind the incomplete construction)

loans.use: To purchase more rubber for resale and any remaining money will be used to complete the construction of their home.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.vi:
In 2003, Mrs. L. T. H. Oanh's husband passed away after an accident, leaving her with their two young children. Theif lives were hard; the house was unsettled. Mrs. Oanh tries very hard to provide her kids with food and education. At the beginning of 2004, Mrs Oanh remarried and has another child with her second husband. Her husband's job is to sell sand from the river. However, this is a seasonal job, which he can only work during the dry season. During the raining season, he has to do all kinds of jobs. Mrs. Oanh is doing farming. However, since the soil is not good, and she cannot employ a lot of technical advances, their family income is still very limited. Earning money is hard, and keeping peace in the family is not good either (since her sons and her husband do not get along well). Mrs. Oanh wants to borrow money to raise cows and save money for her children's schooling. In Mrs. Oanh's family, the average monthly income is 190,000 VND ( equivalent to 12 USD) per person.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva's Volunteer.

Năm 2003 chồng bị tai nạn giao thông chết để lại cho vợ 2 đứa con thơ vì thế hòan cảnh gia đình rơi vào túng T.ếu, nhà cửa chưa ổn định. Một mình vất vả làm thuê nuôi 2 con ăn học. Đầu năm 2004 cô Oanh đi bước nữa với người chồng thứ 2 bây giờ và có thêm 1 đứa con nữa. Chồng mới làm nghề vớt cát dưới sông đem lên bờ bán, tuy nhiên nghề này chỉ làm được vào mùa khô còn mùa mưa thì làm lung tung đủ thứ. Vợ làm rẫy nhưng do đất xấu và T.ếu kỹ thuật canh tác nên thu nhập thấp. Kinh tế hiện tại gặp nhiều khó khăn, gia đình lại cảnh cha dượng, con vợ nên lắm lúc rối tung cả lên. Gia đình muốn có nguồn vốn nuôi bò để các cháu ăn học sau này. Thu nhập bình quân 190.000 đ/người/tháng.

loans.use: Raise cattle

loans.name: Mémouna

texts.fr:
Mme E. Mémouna est née à Lomé en 1950. Divorcée de son mari, elle s’est retrouvée avec 06 personnes à sa seule charge. N’ayant reçu aucune formation ni scolaire ni professionnelle, c’est la débrouille qui lui permet de vivre et de s’occuper de sa famille. L’activité de taxi moto étant très rentable dans la localité, Mme E. désire tenter sa chance dans ce domaine. 
      
Elle sollicite alors un crédit pour l’achat de taxi moto qu'elle va affreter à son frère pour transport. Elle espère ainsi améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs Mémouna E. was born in Lomé in 1950. Divorced from her husband, she found herself with six persons to care for, by herself. Having never received any formal schooling or professional training, she manages nonetheless to survive and take care of her family. Mrs E. would like to try to work in the field of motorcycle taxis which are very profitable in her area. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase a motorcycle taxi which she will charter to her brother for transport. She is hoping in this manner to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Vanesa Dortis

texts.es:
La señora Vanesa pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Brisas, ubicado en el Jr: Pachacutec Mz.1 Lt.1, Distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 27 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es madre soltera que lucha día a día. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de S/.300, decide invertir en compra de pollo.

En la actualidad Vanesa continua con el mismo negocio de venta de pollo. Trabaja desde muy temprano para luego dedicarse a cuidar a sus hijos.

Con el préstamo de S/.2,500, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará un motokar para así generar mayores ingresos, pagar el préstamo y cumplir con puntualidad.

Vanesa se siente feliz y con mucha fuerzas para seguir adelante. Agradece a Dios por darle vida y salud.
texts.en:
Vanesa belongs to “Las Brisas” community bank, located at Mz.1 Lt.1 Jr. Pachacutec, district of Calleria, Ucayali. She is 27 years old, has 2 young children that still depend on her, she is a single mom that fights day after day. With the first loan that she received of $100 US (S/.300), she decided to purchase chicken. Currently, Vanesa continues with the same business of selling chicken. She starts working very early to then take care of her children. With the loan of $850 US (S/.2,500), to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy a motorized cart to generate better income and repay the loan on time. Vanesa feels happy and with lots of strength to keep moving ahead. She thanks God for giving her life and health.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a motorized cart

loans.name: Mersiha

texts.en:
Mersiha, 36 and living in Đurđevik, a small agricultural village in Bosnia, is married and has two daughters in primary school. Because her husband is retired with a disability, she single-handedly supports her family by knitting high-quality traditional tablecloths and decorative wall hangings, receiving orders from both Bosnia and Germany.

Because Mersiha lives in a very rural location, there is a $700 deposit required to set up an electrical connection at her house. She is requesting a loan of $350 to help her meet this deposit requirement.

loans.use: To cover the costs of getting electricity to her home.

loans.name: Apolonio

texts.es: El Sr. Apolonio tiene 36 años de edad, casado y con dos hijos de 7 y 9 años de edad que su esposa le tiene, los niños estudian la primaria en el barrio del colegio donde habitan,  que se llama Hialeah en la capital de Managua, don Apolonio trabaja en el día como soldador y albañil y por las noches en servicios de vigilancia, es un poco agotador pero tiene que hacerlo devido a que todo esta  caro y su salario es bien bajo, tiene cuatro años de estar laborando de albañil, cuando inicio lo hizo como ayudante, hoy trabaja solo y se ayuda mas económicamente, con la solicitud que esta haciendo a Afodenic lo desea para hacer un muro en su casa ya que hay mucha delincuencia para tener mas seguridad para su familia y también poder remodelar las divisiones de los cuartos, con estas solicitudes ha sido de gran beneficios en su familia ya que gracias al capital que obtiene lo ha invertido en las mejoras de su vivienda. A largo plazo desea tener un trabajo donde pueda ganar mejor, terminar de construir su casa, y ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios
texts.en:
Apolonio is 36 years old and married with two children, seven and nine years old. His children go to an elementary school in the neighbourhood of Hialeah in the capital city of Managua.

By day, Apolonio works as a welder and bricklayer and by night, he works as a security guard. It's quite exhausting, but he must do it as his salary is so small and everything is so expensive. He's been working in masonry for 4 years. He started out as an assistant but now works on his own, which helps financially.

With the loan he is soliciting from AFODENIC, he'd like to build a wall around his house to protect his family from any danger and also to remodel the divisions of the rooms in the house.

The loan he received previously has benefitted his family greatly thanks to the capital he was able to invest in renovating his house.

In the future Apolonio would like to have a job that pays more, finish building his house and help his children with their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials like stone, sand, cement, and iron

loans.name: Sulhiyat

texts.en: Sulhiyat is a widow with 2 children. She lives in Khachmaz town. She was born in 1952. Five years ago she started a cafe business. Now she needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy the necessary equipment for her cafe.

loans.use: To buy the necessary equipment for her cafe

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana Maria is a member of the Las Golondrinas (“The Swallows”) Village Bank. She is 25 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their two children. Ana Maria and her husband have a motorcycle taxi, which they use to transport passengers around the city of Ayacucho. Her husband also has a mechanic’s shop, where he fixes motorcycle taxis.  Ana Maria needs a loan of 1050 soles, which will be added to some money she has saved up to buy another motorcycle taxi.  Ana Maria dreams of having her own replacement parts store, of selling wholesale, and that her children will grow up to be working professionals. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Ana Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Las Golondrinas. 
Ana Maria es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 2 hijos, Ana Maria junto a su esposo tienen un mototaxi con el cual realiza transporte en la ciudad de Ayacucho, Además el esposo de Ana Maria tiene un taller mecánico en el cual arregla mototaxi. 
Ana Maria necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido como parte de pago para adquirir otra mototaxi. 
Ana Maria sueña con tener una tienda de repuestos, ser mayorista y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Buy another motorcycle taxi  (partial payment)

loans.name: Mullojon

texts.en:
Mullojon S. is 36 years old. He is married with two children. His wife looks after the house and the kids. Mullojon supports his family by breeding cattle, which he sells for meat. He started his business in 2003. Cattle-breeding is the main source of income for the family and generates the income necessary to allow Mullojon to support his family and improve their living conditions. Now he has applied for a 400 USD loan, which he is planning to use in purchasing one milk cow.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.
