These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing a milk cow to expand his business

loans.name: Lélatou

texts.fr: Agée d’une quarantaine d’année, Mme Lélatou O. est mariée avec deux (02) personnes à charge. Elle mène comme activité la vente de produits céréaliers (mais, mil, sorgho etc.…). Très dynamique et dévouée dans activité qu’elle exerce depuis presque dix (10) ans, elle compte la développer avec pour objectif de vendre en gros. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un financement pour pouvoir stocker davantage de céréales, pendant cette saison d’abondance et les revendre en période de soudure. Cela augmentera forcement son chiffre d’affaires et ses bénéfices et améliorera ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lélatou O. is in her forties and married with two people in her care. She runs a business selling cereal products (maize, millets, sorghum, etc.). Very dynamic and dedicated to the business that she has been running for almost ten (10) years, she intends to develop it with the goal of selling in bulk. This is why she is asking for a loan to stock more cereals during the ongoing season of abundance and to re-sell them during leaner times. This will undoubtedly increase her sales figures and profits and improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock and sell cereals

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en: Mr. Sophea N. lives in Tonle village in Takeop province, with his wife, Mrs. Meb Dynal. Mr. N. is a chicken breeder. His wife is a farmer who cultivates both rice and vegetables on a plot of land they own. On their plantation, Mrs. Dynal faces a problem because her field is far from an irrigation system. Thus, Mr. N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a pump machine to support the field to make his crop more productive. He is a 27-year-old father of a child who is too young to work or study. His wife is presented on the right of photo.

loans.use: To buy a pump machine to irrigate the field

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.es:
La socia RICARDINA, es natural D. la provincia D. Calca, ella tiene 70 años D. edad y tiene 5 hijos los mismo que hicieron su propia familia, ella vive con la menor D. sus hijas D. 22 años.

Nuestra socia tiene su negocio D. venta D. verduras en el mercado central en calca, ella venD. todos los días sus verduras, para lo cual necesita el préstamo para comprar verduras a l por mayor y así ella seguir vendiendo en el mercado, la socia nos manifiesta que siempre ha trabajado en la venta D. diferentes productos pero ahora lo hace con verduras por que es mas fácil para ella transportar este producto por su edad, pero también nos indica que trabajando D. esta manera ella se siente más joven y disfruta su trabajo.

La socia Ricardina esta muy contenta con el préstamo otorgado y previo un saludo manifiesta que se compromete a pagar el préstamo en el tiempo programado.
texts.en:
Member Ricardina is a native of Calca province. She is 70 years old and has 5 children, all of whom have families of their own now. She lives with her youngest daughter who is 22 years old.

Our group member's business is selling fruit at the Calca central market. She sells her vegetables every day. Therefore she needs this loan in order to buy vegetables wholesale, and in this way continue selling in the market. This member tells us that she has always worked selling different types of products, but now she focuses on vegetables because it is easier at her age to transport produce. She also notes that working in this way makes her feel younger and that she enjoys her work.

Group member Ricardina is very please with the granted loan. Before sending her hellos, she pledges to repay the loan over the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Morey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell vegetables

loans.name: Tunas Baru A Group

texts.en:
Tunas Baru A is a group of 15 farmers in Bokong Village in the Kupang District of East Nusa Tenggara Province in Indonesia. This group is led by Stefanus A., a 38-year-old man. He is married with one mute son who is 10 and one adopted daughter who is 6 years old and studying in the elementary school grade 1.

Both Stefanus and his wife work hard to fulfill their family needs. As a farmer, Stefanus leans upon his harvest to generate income for his family. In the rainy season, he usually plants corns, peanuts, cassavas, pumpkins, bananas and coconuts. And in the dry season, he usually plants some vegetables, onion, tomatoes and chilies. Then Stefanus and his wife will sell their harvest to the markets. The nearest market is situated about a 30-minute drive from their village. The road in Bokong Village where Stefanus lives is bumpy with many holes. It is hard for public transportation to serve this area in the rainy season; as a result the farmers in Bokong Village (including Stefanus) cannot bring their harvest to the market to be sold. The income that Stefanus generates by selling his harvest is unstable, that is one of the reasons why he is interested in the TLM cattle-fattening program. Stefanus plans to spend the profit of selling the fattened cattle to meet his daughter's education needs and to meet his family needs. 

Stefanus is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner TLM amounting to Rp 3,200,000 to buy young cattle to be fattened over a 12-month period. Just the same as Stefanus, the other 14 members of this group are also requesting loans to buy cattle to be fattened. All of them have a dream to have better lives through their involvement in the cattle-fattening program.

Note: When the picture was taken, Marselina, Ribka and Lodia weren’t present.

loans.use: To buy cattle to be fattened

loans.name: Awleyikpè

texts.fr: Cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de charbons de bois et de tubercules, elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays dans la ville de sokodé, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2001 au marché local d’adidogomé, son stock de marchandises actuel ne lui permet pas de satisfaire convenablement ses clients, n’ayant jamais obtenu du crédit de WAGES, elle sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter 15 sacs de charbons de bois, 10 sacs d’ignames et divers. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.
texts.en:
This is a lady who earns an income from commerce in charcoal and tubers. She acquires her supplies from inland locations, in the city of Sokodé. She has been in this business since 2001 at the local marketplace in Adidogomé. Her current inventory of merchandise prevents her from satisfying her customers appropriately. Never having had a loan from WAGES, she's requesting her first loan to buy fifteen sacks of charcoal, ten sacks of yams, and other items. She is married and the mother of three.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal and yams

loans.name: Prescille

texts.en:
Prescille S. is from the village of Taboc Norte in Oroquieta City, the capital of Misamis Occidental province in the Philippines. She is 31 years-old and married with one child who is still in school. To make a living, Prescille owns and operates a business selling clothes to the local community. Prescille has been in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

Prescille has just joined GDMPC this year in hopes of getting access to financial services that will help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Prescille is requesting her first loan from GDMPC in the amount of 5000 PHP to purchase new products to sell.  Prescille plans to save the extra revenue generated from the additional items in a reserve fund in case of future emergencies for her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing items to sell.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
La microempresaria Maria del Socorro U. M. tiene 42 años de edad es casada con 3 hijos dos menores y una mayor de edad, se dedica desde hace 6 años a la venta de ropa usada, en donde compra pacas de pantalones, camisetas, shorts, blusas de mujer y hasta sabanas.

Este negocio le ha dado buenos resultados ya que ella tiene una familiar en la capital y logra conseguir pacas de ropa de calidad, la cual se vende bastante ya que muchas personas prefieren comprar este tipo de ropa por la calidad y el precio. Esta microempresaria ya ha sido beneficiada por parte de Kiva con dos créditos anteriores a este y los ha pagado en tiempo y forma.

Actualmente esta solicitando a los prestamistas de Kiva que le ayuden con el financiamiento de: 1 Paca de camisetas la cual compra a US 230 la paca, 1 paca de  pantalones jeans a US 260 la paca  y 1 paca de  blusas para damas a US 210 la paca,  todos de  ropa usada.
texts.en:
Microentreprenuer Maria del Socorro U. M. is 42, married, has 2 minor children, and one older child. For six years she has been selling used clothes that come with pants, shirts, shorts, women’s blouses, and even sheets packed in bulk. This business has brought her good results. She has a relative in the capital who is able to get her quality bulk clothing. She sells a lot since many people prefer buying this type of clothing for the quality and the price. She has received two previous loans from Kiva, she repaid them on time and as agreed upon. She is currently asking the Kiva lenders to help her buy: 1 bulk package of shirts for US 230 per pack, 1 bulk pack of jeans at US 260 per pack, and 1 bulk pack of women’s blouses at US 210 per pack. All of the packs contain used clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bulk packages of used clothes containing shirts, jeans, and women's blouses

loans.name: Rose Anyango

texts.en:
Rose is the mother of three children who are all in secondary school. The costs associated with their schooling can be challenging for her.

Rose has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase a milk-cow. Since she currently has cows that produce 10-15 liters a day, which sell out very fast, she knows that she will only increase her income with a new cow.

A quiet but hard-working woman, Rose is determined to grow her 15-year-old business.

loans.use: To buy a new milk-cow

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth es una pequeña comerciante (venta de ropa, calsado etc, alajas) de la zona de Nueva Guinea, solicita el 3er crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para realizar compra de cambio de techo de su casa pues en esta epoca de invierno se le moja parte de la sala, cuenta con el apoyo de su papá para esta solicitud, tiene capacidad y volunta de pago. Elizabeth expresa sentirse satisfecha con el sevicio recibido por AFODENIC ya que los interes son bajo, pues con los creditos que ha recibido de AFODENIC a logrado realizar obras de construción en su casa, mejorar así las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a small business owner (selling clothes, shoes, etc., jewelry) in the Nueva Guinea neighborhood. She is requesting her 3rd loan through AFODENIC to purchase a new roof for her house, since in the winter season part of her living room gets wet. Her father is helping her with this loan request; he is willing and able to make payments. Elizabeth is pleased with the service she receives through AFODENIC as the interest rates are low. With the loans she has received from AFODENIC she has been able to do construction projects on her home, thus improving her family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roof replacement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase stock of glass

loans.name: Zoya

texts.en:
Zoya is married with two children. She sells clothing at the central market in Novomoskovsk and has been in this business for ten years. During this time she has obtained many repeat clients that buy clothing from her.

There is a high demand for this type of goods, so Zoya is going to continue developing her business. She has got enough energy and enthusiasm for this.

Zoya would like to borrow 12,000 UAH to increase her assortment. She hopes to increase her sales and make additional income for her family.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Sunday C. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to purchase more stock to sell.  Sunday is twenty-nine years old and married to a businessman. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay her children's school fees.

About the MFI: BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: buy charcoal stock to sell

loans.name: Bazarsad

texts.en:
Bazarsad is 66 years old and lives with her grandson in the Uvurkhangai province in central Mongolia. The two of them live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian tent home, in the capital city of the ancient Mongolian empire of Khar-khorin. Her grandson currently attends the Technology and Science University of Mongolia. 

Bazarsad owns and operates a small store in her town selling a variety of grocery and consumer products. Her grandson helps out at the store by selling ice cream, which is a very popular item during the hot Mongolian summers.
 
Bazarsad started her shop in 2003 after retiring from her career as an obstetrician at the local hospital. With the addition of the ice-cream sales, she has been able to grow her business quickly and has slowly increased the variety of products she sells. She attributes her success to her good personality and customer-service practices that make her business popular in her community. 

For the future, Bazarsad hopes to continue to expand her business. Her wish is that she can continue to support her grandson so that he can graduate and find a decent job. She is requesting a 1,200,000 tugrug loan to purchase more groceries and ice cream for her store.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and ice cream for her store

loans.name: Fabiola Regina

texts.es:
Fabiola es socia del Bancomunal San Judas Tadeo.
Fabiola es soltera, tiene 21 años, no tiene hijos, vive con su papa, su mamá pertenecía al Bancomunal pero hace un año falleció, es así como ella decide integrar el grupo, se puso a estudiar cosmética dermatológica hace un año, ella tiene muchas amigas y por la necesidad tuvo la idea de vender ropa, al mismo tiempo consiguió trabajo en una peluquería.
En Finca Perú tiene 8 meses, está aprendiendo a ahorrar porque ella vio el ejemplo de su mamá que ahorraba y daba resultado.
Ella necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de ropa.   
El sueño en un futuro es abrir su salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Fabiola is a member of the communal bank "San Judas Tadeo." She is single, 21 years old, has no children and lives with her father. Her mother belonged to the communal bank but she died a year ago. At that point Fabiola decided to join the group and began studying cosmetic dermatology. She has many friends and out of necessity she had the idea of selling clothes; at the same time she got a job working in a hair salon. She has been with FINCA Perú for 8 months and is learning how to save, because she saw the example set by her mother, who saved and got a good result. Fabiola needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy clothing. Her dream is to someday open a beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Boubacar Mahaye

texts.fr:
Né le 24 septembre 1980 à Bougouni (région de Sikasso), Monsieur  Boubacar Mahaye C.  est marié et vit avec son épouse dans une  grande famille traditionnelle élargie au quartier Babemba, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur C. n’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer dans les études, il s’est très vite initié à un métier, à savoir celui de la  construction métallique, depuis très jeune. Il travaille actuellement avec deux apprentis à son propre compte, il y a environ une année et il est beaucoup sollicité  de la plupart de ses clients pour la qualité de ses prestations.
Actuellement pour mieux répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, il sollicite  un prêt  au niveau de Soro Yiriwaso afin  d’acheter, une machine de soudure, une meule, quelques barres de fer U, Z, des baguettes, etc. Ses  matériels sont achetés sur place et servirons à concevoir des produits (des chaises, tables, bancs, etc.)  destinés à la vente au comptant surtout.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 95 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born on September 24, 1980 in Bougouni (region of Sikasso), Mr. Boubacar Mahaye C. is married and lives with his wife in a large traditional extended family in Babemba, an outlying district of Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  Not having had the chance to continue his education, he soon got introduced at a young age to a trade, namely metalwork.  He has been working for about a year with two apprentices in his own business.  And he is in high demand by most of his customers for the quality of his work.  At the moment, in order to respond better to the expectations of his every-growing customer base, he's requesting a loan from Soro Yiriwaso to purchase a welding machine, a grinding wheel, a few U and Z iron bars, welding rods, etc.  His supplies and equipment are bought locally and will be used to design products (chairs, tables, benches, etc.) destined for sale, for cash in particular.  With the loan, he envisions realizing a monthly profit of 95,000 francs CFA that will essentially be used to increase his business capital, to help cover family expenses, to pay the loan interest, and to invest the rest in his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy welding supplies and equipment

loans.name: María Elvira

texts.es: María Elvira A. D. P. originaria del departamento D. La Libertad, tiene 51 años D. edad vive con su esposo y dos nietos D. 11 y 5 años D. edad. María ha manejado por años su negocio donD. muchos clientes prefieren hacer sus compras allí, por la amabilidad y alegraría que María transmite con sus tratos, son quince años D. experiencia y a cargo D. su tienda llamada “Tío Paco”, donD. ofrece productos D. consumo, ella ahora solicita D. este crédito, para poder surtir su negocio y seguir fortaleciendo sus ventas como lo ha hecho hasta ahora.
texts.en:
María Elvira A. D. P. is from the La Libertad department. She is 51, and she lives with her husband and two grandchildren. The grandchildren are 11 and 5. María has managed her business for years. Many customers prefer to make their purchases there because of the kind and cheerful treatment that María gives them. She has 15 years of experience having her store, which is called “Tío Paco”. She sells consumer products. She is now asking for this loan to be able to stock her store. She wants to continue strengthening her sales as she has been doing up until now.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en: Brenda is a 26-year-old mother of two and has been married to her husband Roderick for two years. Her oldest child is seven. Brenda has invested in rice farming to help sustain her family. She works hard to keep her farm in good condition while also taking care of her family. She is a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and applied for a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy fertilizer and other supplies for her farm.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farm

loans.name: Yolanda Vicenta

texts.es:
Yolanda C. de 53 años, vive en un sector periurbano sin alcantarillado y solo cuenta con electricidad tiene una casa de caña ubicada en la zona de Paraíso de Guayaquil. Yolanda hace tres años comenzó a vender pañales y cuadernos poco a poco aumento su mercadería ya que hay una escuela cerca de su domicilio donde tiene el pequeño bazar.

Trabaja desde las 6:00Am para vender a los niños que estudian cerca, compra en la Bahía de Guayaquil, 300 pañales que los vende a 0.20 c/u, cuadernos y útiles,  aunque en las lluvias a los clientes le es de obstáculo el acceso al bazar no se da por vencida, su esposo le ayuda vendiendo pañales fuera de casa recorriendo tiendas, por lo que sus hijos ya son mayores y tienen sus propias familias, Yolanda y su esposo quieren seguir adelantes juntos.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar papelería, esmaltes, aretes, láminas para poder surtir su negocio, y en el futuro quiere expandir más su negocio y adecuar su local en la esquina de su sector.
texts.en:
Yolanda C. is 53 years old and lives in the outskirts of a city without a sewage system. She only has electricity. She has a house made of reeds located in the Paraíso zone in Guayaquil. Yolanda began to sell diapers and notebooks three years ago and little by little expanded her merchandise. There is a school near her home where she has a small store. She begins working at 6:00 am to sell to the children that study nearby. In the Bay of Guayaquil, she buys 300 diapers that she sells for 20 cents a unit, notebooks, and school supplies. Even though during the rains clients are unable to access her store, she does not get defeated. Her husband helps her sell diapers outside of her house going from door to door. Since her children are older and have their own families, Yolanda and her husband want to move forward together. With this loan, Yolanda would like to buy stationery, nail polish, earrings, and posters in order to supply her business. In the future, she would like to continue to expand her business and move her locale to the corner of her neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stationery, nail polish, earrings, and posters

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 45 años vive con su pareja y su hijo Jesús de 10 años, en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 1 año se dedica  a la venta de “ceviche ” (platillo tradicional peruano hecho a base  de pescado con limón), y  tiene gran demanda por la zona donde vive , porque es muy exquisito ya que los secretos de su preparación los aprendió de  su madre cuando era muy pequeña, desde entonces , como dice María nadie le gana en la  preparación, le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que es un don que posee y además puede generar buenos  ingresos económicos, todo para  beneficio de su pequeño hijo , por el cual trabaja y es el  motivo  de su esfuerzo diario , es por esta razón que  espera que estudie una profesión . En el  futuro tiene  pensado aperturar un negocio mas estable,  como un restaurante o  pollería (lugar donde se vende pollo a la brasa) para así formalizarse y lograr mejores ingresos, ya que sabe que tiene que mejorar, esas son sus expectativas para este nuevo año y espera concretarlas.Es su primer préstamo con  MFP y promete ser puntual en cada uno de sus  pagos ya que quiere seguir trabajando con esta entidad  para progresar aún más en la vida.Con el dinero del crédito quiere comprar más cantidad de ingredientes para aumentar sus ventas en el verano, y empezar a proyectarse para el futuro.
texts.en:
María, 45, lives in her own house with her life partner and her 10-year-old son, Jesús. For the last year she has sold "ceviche" (a typical Peruvian dish made primarily of fish and lemon juice). It is in high demand in the area where she lives because it is delicious and her secret way of preparing it, which she learned from her mother when she was a little girl, insures that nobody's is better than hers. She enjoys her work very much since this is gift she has and she can earn good income with it; all to benefit her young son, for whom she toils daily, in hopes that he will study a professional career. In the future, she hopes to open a more stable business, like a restaurant or a "pollería" (place where grilled chicken is sold) so that she can be formalized and earn better income. She knows she needs to improve and these are her expectation for the new year; she hopes to reach her goals. This is her first loan with MFP and she pledges to be punctual with each of her payments because she wants to continue to work with the institution in order to progress even more in life. She will use the funds to buy greater amounts of raw materials to increase her sales in the Summer and to start to project herself into the future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meals preparation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more used clothes in bulk

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 29 years of age and married with four children between the ages of 8 and 14 years. All her children go to school. The family resides in and owns a three-room house where she stays with five people. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  The family has access to electricity but no piped water at home.  The family has three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses include utility bills, school fees for her children and medication. Rose is a tailor in Bwaise market, sewing all types of clothes including Gomesi (African tunics), shirts and dresses. She also repairs torn clothing.  She works seven days a week. She receives an average of 20 customers a day. She has done this business for over 10 years. Her main challenges are seasonality and the rainy season because she works from an open place.  She sells at both retail and wholesale. She has been with MCDT for seven years, servicing her 14th loan and working all this time with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more clothing materials and threads. She hopes to see her business grow bigger, to start a tailoring school and to start sewing bridal gowns
.

loans.use: To buy more material and thread for sewing

loans.name: Madre Teresa De Calcuta Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Madre Teresa D. Calcuta, se encuentra ubicado en la Comunidad D. Ayaccocha, la cual pertenece al distrito D. Acoria en el departamento D. Huancavelica.

Aurea es casada y tiene 04 hijos. Aurea se dedica al tejido y a la venta D. artesanías. Aurea necesita un préstamo, el cual usaría como capital para invertir en su negocio, adquiriendo D. esta manera lanas D. varios colores, grosores, palos D. tejer, etc. Aurea, tiene como sueño el lograr que sus tejidos se vendan a los grandes almacenes y mas adelante poder exportar al extranjero. 

J. es casada y tiene 08 hijos. J. tiene como negocio una pequeña bodega la cual esta creciendo gracias a sus prestamos. J. necesita un préstamo para comprar mas mercadería para su bodega, tiene como sueño el tener un minimarket, donD. pueda vender diversos productos.

Georgina es casada y tiene 04 hijos. Georgina se dedica a la venta D. comidas como pollo frito, pescado frito y derivados. Georgina necesita un préstamo con el cual comprará insumos para su negocio, ella tiene como meta el hacer crecer su negocio hasta que llegue a ser un restaurante.
texts.en:
The Madre Teresa D. Calcuta communal bank is located in the community of Ayaccocha, which belongs to the district of Acoria, in the department of Huancavelica. Aurea is married and she has 4 children. Aurea works in knitting and sells craft items. She needs a loan, which she will use as capital to invest in her business. She will buy wool of various colors and thicknesses and knitting needles, etc. Aurea’s dream is for her knitted items to sell in the biggest stores and eventually to be able to export them. J. is married and she has 8 children. J. has a small grocery store that is growing, thanks to her loans. She needs a loan to buy more merchandise for her store. Her dream is to have a mini market, where she could sell a variety of products. Georgina is married and has 4 children. She sells foods such as fried chicken, fried fish, and related food items. Georgina needs a loan, which she will use to buy ingredients for her business. Her goal is to make her business grow until it becomes a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool and knitting needles

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila M. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 48 years old. Mila is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Mila owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Mila has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mila is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Mila from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional working capital

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 58 years old and married with three adult children, ages 20, 29, and 35. Her youngest is still enrolled in school. She has been running her farm for over twenty years in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale. Her primary cash crop is maize, which she sells at the local market. She says that the main challenge right now is the sharp fluctuation in market prices for her goods. 

Annah has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for 46,800 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her meet the family's basic needs. In the future, she would like to supply milk to the Kenya Cooperative of Creameries and reap the full benefits of increased milk production.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en: Meriam owns and tills a hectare of rice farm. She is 32 years old, married with four children. Her oldest child is only aged twelve. She wants all her children to someday finish college and have a bright future. Aside from farming, she also makes charcoals and sells them around her community. Like other entrepreneurs, she wants to prosper in what she does. She applied to CEVI to gain financial support for her business. She is asking to loan Php15, 000, which she will use to acquire farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers. She also hopes to increase her capital for her charcoals.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Yudelka

texts.en:
Yudelka is an individual loan client with Esperanza. Her story is representative of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). In El Seybo, where she is located, running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home in a simple structure here, as a single mother with her child.

Yudelka is excited to be taking her seventh total loan and third individual loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business raising livestock by purchasing two cows which she will use to produce milk and eventually meat. She will use the profits to save towards the purchase of more land to continue to expand her farm, as well as provide for the needs of her child. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to purchase two cows

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is a 41-year-old tailor. She is married and has two children. She has been tailoring for 18 years. She saves her money with a group of entrepreneurs in Faulu Kenya, hence the members can easily guarantee her a loan. She has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to buy fabric for making clothes. She hopes to expand her business so that she can get more income. She dreams of adding stock so that she can employ people in her business.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene P. is from the village of Upper Centro,Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old and married with two adult children. To make a living, Irene owns a general store selling a variety of different products. Irene has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Irene joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Irene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Irene is requesting a new loan of 50000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Irene from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the her business. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Bendu Group

texts.en:
Wurie B. (second from right) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Wurie was born in Magburaka town, in Northern Sierra Leone about 40 years ago. He is married to a businesswoman and the couple have two children, both attending secondary school. For over nine years now, Wurie has been selling clothes:  T-shirts, vests, socks, etc. With the help of this loan, he will be able to expand his business, make more sales, and consequently improve his living conditions. Wurie will use his share of the loan (800,000 leones) to expand his business. He will buy T-shirts, vests and socks wholesale to add to his current ones. 

In the picture are members of the B. Group and loan officer, Mohamed L. Tarawalie, on the right, handing over the loan.

loans.use: To buy T-shirts, vests and socks wholesale

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier es un padre de familia de 41 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el sector Corral de Palos, una zona rural del distrito agrícola de Cayaltí, el lugar ha experimentado un incremento en su actividad comercial durante los ultimos años. Se encuentra ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Javier trabaja desde hace cinco años en la crianza y venta de animales. Esta actividad le sirve para adquirir ingresos adicionales con los cuales solventa sus gastos familiares. El cría animales menores en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan la zona frecuentemente.

Otra actividad que le provee de ingresos es el trabajar como vendedror en un grifo de la localidad, el trabaja vendiendo combustible a los transportistas de la zona durante todo el día.

Javier desea realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Javier es un padre trabajador y bastante responsable. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima y le consideran una persona honrada.
texts.en:
Javier, age 41, is the head of a family. He lives with his wife and their two children in the Corral de Palos sector, a rural area in the agricultural district of Cayaltí. This place has experienced an increase in business activity during the past few years. It is located an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

For five years, Javier has worked raising and selling animals. This business has allowed him to acquire additional income with which to meet his family expenses. He raises small animals in pens located at the rear of his house. When they have matured, he offers them for sale to traders who frequently visit his area.

Another activity which provides him with income is his work as a sales person at a local gas station. He works all day selling fuel to transport workers.

Javier is a hardworking father and very responsible. In the area where he lives his neighbors and acquaintances have a lot of respect for him and consider him an honorable person.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction mateirals in order to make improvements to his home.

loans.name: Anwari's Group

texts.en:
Anwari lives in a city called Chichwatni in Pakistan. She is fifty years old lady who has four children but only one of them has got his education till 10th standard. 

Her husband buys animals, raises them, and then sells them in the animal market. He has been doing this business for almost 20 years. Anwari supports her husband by making and selling artificial flowers. She is very good at this art. 

Anwari has successfully completed its first loan from Asasah and now is applying for a loan for the second time to financially support her husband who will buy more animals for selling to expand his business and to increase his income. Anwari is hopeful that the investment in her husband’s business will bring a good positive change in her financial life.

loans.use: Purchasing animals for resale

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes E. is from the village of Brgy. Almaguer South, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 39 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Lourdes owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for breeding. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Lourdes joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase breeding livestock. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the second loan taken out by Lourdes from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia B. is from the village of Punit. She is 36 years old and is married with four school-aged children. Cecilia owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling cosmetics products from Avon, Boardwalk and Personal Collection in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2008, Cecilia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Cecilia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Pok's Group

texts.en:
Mr. P. K., age 63, is the village bank president, having been selected by its twenty-one members. The members of this village live I. Preak Thmei village, Kandal province. With their loan, each member of this village bank hopes to increase his or her income to improve the living of their family.    

Mr. P. K. is a farmer who rents some of his land to cultivate vegetables and jasmine. His wife, Mrs. Thoa Kum, is a flower seller I. the market. With both of their occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. This couple has three children: one is a teacher, one is a car mechanic, and the last one is a construction worker.

I. order to support the farming crop, Mr. P. K. will use the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to cultivate vegetables.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide to cultivate vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase packs of used clothing for youth and children and pack of used sheets

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia O. is a married woman who lives in Basak Mercado, Brgy Basak, Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a sari-sari (general) store and a vegetable vending business. Her husband, Fernando O., aged 42, works as a Brgy. Tanod (a community security guard) to earn his living. They have seven children who are aged between six and 24. The two oldest ones already have their own families, another works to help the family and two of the younger children currently go to school. 

Amalia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000 helped her increase her monthly income to PHP 42,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her ninth cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000, which she intends to use to purchase more products to sell so that she can continue to save up for her children's education, family security and expansion of her businesses. Amalia O. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'Honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma R. is from the village of Estrada. She is 42 years old. Gemma is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gemma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Gemma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marc

texts.en:
Marc is 41 years old, married with three children who are 6, 12 and 14 years old.  Marc is commonly known in the business of raising cows and it is through his livestock that he gets milk for sale.  Marc has been in this business for about 10 years.  

Marc needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a.  With this loan, Marc will buy more cows which will allow him to get enough milk for sale.  Once the sale of milk increases, the profits will increase and when the profits increase, he will create some other sources of income as well as jobs for the people from his community and in addition to that, he will continue taking care of his family.

loans.use: buying more cows to raise and getting milk for sale

loans.name: Luvy Jeaneth

texts.es: Luvy Jeaneth vive en su propia casa con su hijo que todavía depende de ella. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a la venta de ropa. Anteriormente ella no tenía el capital suficiente para seguir adelante, ya para iniciar a trabajar una amiga le facilito un préstamo y poco a poco ha ido creciendo con su negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos. Su deseo es proporcionarle mejoras a su humilde vivienda para sus hijos.
texts.en: Luvy Jeaneth lives in her own home with her son who is still dependent on her.  She has been in the clothes selling business for more than 8 years.  In the past, she didn't have sufficient capital to keep moving forward but a friend gave her a loan to start her business and little by little she has been growing her business.  The loan she is requesting is for working capital with which to buy products.  Her dream is to improve her humble house for her children.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María tiene 40 años, está casada y tiene 3 hijos. Es comerciante desde hace más de 10 años, empezó vendiendo primeramente en forma ambulante, con un pequeño ahorro y la ayuda de su marido que es empleado de una empresa envasadora de gaseosas, pudo formar su micro-comercio e instalarlo en su casa, gracias a la buena atención y la buenisima calidad de sus mercaderías hoy día tiene una clientela formada.
 La Sra. Maria solicita el crédito para la compra de shorts, jeans, remeras, vestidos y otros, que son las prendas con más demandas en esta época del año.
La Sra. María desde ya agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva por el apoyo y la confianza que le otorgan.
texts.en:
María is 40 years old.  She is married and has 3 children.  She has been a saleswoman for more than 10 years.  She started out selling as a street trader but, with a little saving and the help of her husband who is a worker in a soda packaging company, she has been able to set up a small business in her home.  Thanks to her good service and the really good quality of her merchandise she now has a fixed customer base.

Maria is requesting a loan to buy shorts, jeans, t-shirts, dresses and other clothes.  These are the garments which are in greatest demand at this time of year.

Maria is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the support they are giving her and the trust which they are placing in her.

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, jeans, shorts, dresses and other garments

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 50 years old and married to Haron, a lecturer. They have been blessed with five children. She has been selling clothes for the last nine years, whereby she makes an income of Kshs 6,000 per month. She is likely to succeed because her husband is in a stable job, thus meeting most of their expenses, and this paves the way for Mary's business to grow. 

The loan will be used to purchase more clothing stock, especially to sell during the December peak season. She was introduced to Kadet by a friend, and this is her first loan. Her future dream is to grow the business to be a stable source of income.

loans.use: Clothing stock

loans.name: Greysi

texts.es:
la joven Greisy R. T. tiene 23 años de edad, vive en union libre y tiene un hijo de 7 años de edad, Greysi se dedica a la venta de abarroteria en su pulperia y tambien vende golosinas los fines de semanas (sabados y domingos) vende tacos y enchiladas.
 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su pulperia.
 
su mayor sueño es que su familia este unida para esta epoca de navidad.
texts.en:
Greisy R. T. is 23 years old.  She lives with her common-law partner and has a 7-year-old son.  Greysi sells groceries at her store as well as sweets.  On the weekends (Saturdays and Sundays), she sells tacos and enchiladas.  

She will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock her store.  

Her greatest dream is that her family be together this Christmas season.

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, beans, bread, cookies, coffee, lard, soft drinks, oil, margarine, churros, soups, pastas, batteries, candles, matches, corn and wheat flour, chicken, juices, sardines

loans.name: Verónica Johanna

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 1 De Agosto que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Verónica. Tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos  hijos de 7 y 4 años, el mayor estudia en  escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa en Manta.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas).  También vende ropa interior de damas. Trabaja cinco días a la semana por las mañanas ya que aprovecha que uno de sus hijos esta en la escuela y al otro se le hace más fácil cargarlo, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Sus productos los recibe en su casa y lo que es ropa interior las compra en Manta.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The Banco Comunal 1 De Agosto (1st of August Communal Bank) meets every fifteen days in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and nationally and internationally recognized handicrafts. The place is famous for Panama hats.

In this place we meet Señora Verónica. She is 26 years old, married and has two children from this relationship, ages 7 and 4. The older attends school. Her husband works in a business in Manta.

She is a housewife and, in order to obtain her own income, engages in catalogue sales of clothing and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories). She also sells women’s underwear. She works five days a week in the mornings, taking advantage of the fact that one of her children is in school and the other is easier to take care of. She sells her products on credit and collects payment each week or every fifteen days, according to the desires of her customers. She receives the products at her house and buys the underwear in Manta.

This loan is for purchasing perfume, creams, cosmetics and underwear. This is her third cycle in the communal bank. She likes it because the payments are easy to make. Her dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: To purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics and women's underwear.

loans.name: Joanne Kristine

texts.en: Joanne Kristine G. owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is a 25-year-old single woman from the town of Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Joanne Kristine has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Joanne Kristine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Joanne Kristine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly L. is 30 years old and his wife, Sao Korl, is 27. Ly L. and his wife are good at making bamboo baskets for selling in and around his community. He and his wife take time to go through the village and seek bamboo to take home and then they put them into water for almost a week.  After that, he and his wife dry them under the sunshine for three days. They split the bamboos into smaller pieces after that he and his wife start making them to basket. Recently, Ly L. decided to take a loan to invest in his handicap business. He dreams of having a degree for his children.

loans.use: To invest in his handicap business by purchasing more baskets for selling.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina L. is from the village of Poblacion, Dangcagan, Bukidnon. She is 35 years old. Gina is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting extracted rubber from rubber trees. Gina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. Gina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to rent land to raise additional crops. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Gina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To rent land to raise additional crops.

loans.name: Joven

texts.en:
Joven E. is from the village of Fatima, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. He is 28 years old. Joven is single. 

To make a living, Joven owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general services to local community members. Joven has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Joven joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joven is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Joven from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa E. is from the village of Osukan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 45 years old, married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Nimfa owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling wild-caught fish in the local community. Nimfa has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2011, Nimfa joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nimfa is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: German Antonio

texts.es: Germán Antonio se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio, su forma de vender es ambulante. Tiene un hijo menor de edad a su cargo, pues para él ha sido muy satisfactorio obtener un medio de vida y mantener a su familia. Inicio este medio de vida por su Papa quien le enseño a sobrevivir con este negocio, la mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan con mayor demanda de electrodomésticos, ropa, calzado, cosméticos. Es por eso que solicita su financiamiento que es para la compra de materia prima. Sueña con establecer una tienda en donde ofrezca diferentes productos.
texts.en: Germán Antonio's business is selling general merchandise.  He has been in this business for more than three years and makes his sales in an itinerant manner.  He has one child in his care.  It has proven very satisfactory for him to be able to earn a living and support his family.  He started out in this line of work as his dad taught him to survive with this business.  Most of his customers are demanding more and more electrical appliances, clothes, footwear and cosmetics.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can buy goods.  His dream is to set up a store where he can sell different products.

loans.use: to buy small electrical appliances, clothes, footwear and cosmetics

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong S., a 61-year-old married woman living in the province of Kompong Cham, has spent her life cultivating crops, a skill she learned from her grandparents when she was young. Her husband also works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. Kong's three children, all married, are employed in a variety of occupations and contribute income to her to help support the family’s needs.  In order to make additional profit, Kong will use her loan to buy some iron to sell in the busy market.

loans.use: to buy some iron to sell.
